loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 39 years old, married to Susan and blessed with three children, ages 9, 7 and 5 years old, respectively. He sells shoes and clothes, a business he started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000.

He has requested his second loan of KES 20,000 to purchase shoes and clothes to sell. The profit made will help him repay his loan.

He dreams of owning a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene tres hijos de 6, 9, 15 años de edad, solamente ella trabaja para mantener a su hogar ya que es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y administra una tienda en un centro escolar, ofrece productos comestibles como boquitas, galletas, dulces, bombones, desde hace siete años administra este negocio y sus hijos le ayudan.

Ella se comprara productos de la canasta básica para preparar alimentos para los estudiantes por ejemplo plátanos, yuca, carne, tomates, condimentos, aceite, entre otros productos que le pueden ayudar para mantener el negocio, este préstamo será un gran aporte para el fortalecimiento del negocio aumentando sus ganancias.

Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio para mejorar la situación económica de su familia dándole a sus hijos una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Ana, 37, has three children who are 6, 9 and 15 years of age.  She’s the only one who works to support her home since she’s a single mother.  She lives with her parents and manages a store at a school that sells food items like snacks, cookies, candy, bonbons; she’s been in business seven years and her children help her.

She will buy basic staple items like bananas, manioc, meat, tomatoes, condiments and oil, among others that will help her stay in business and to prepare the food for the students.  This loan will be a great support to strengthen her business and increase profits.  Her wish is to strengthen her business to improve her family’s economic situation providing a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy bananas, manioc, meat, tomatoes, condiments and oil.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: la Sra. Domitila tiene  29 años,  se dedica a la  venta de verduras como papa en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la localidad de Sacaba, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya bastante tiempo,   este préstamo es el primero dentro de la institución, la Sra. Domitila  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de papa por mayor y también para la compra de semillas de papa ya que tiene un terreno donde también se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de papa, la Sra. Domitila  enfrenta retos en su negocio que la competencia que tiene pero ella trabaja duro muy duro para sacar adelante a sus seres queridos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando papa y así de esta manera  poder brindar su producto a su clientela.
texts.en:
Sra. Domitila is 29 years old and sells vegetables, such as potatoes, from a vending stall in the town of Sacaba. She has been in this business for quite some time. This is her first loan with Emprender.

Sra. Domitila will use the loan to buy potatoes in bulk. She will also buy potato seedlings since she also has a plot of land that she cultivates and uses for growing potatoes. Sra. Domitila faces challenges in her business from the competition, but she works extremely hard so that she can help her loved ones move forward. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, she can continue buying potatoes so that she can provide these products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and potato seedlings.

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marta, es comerciante de frutas y verduras, vive con sus hijos y su esposo, trabajan juntos en el negocio desde hace cinco años en el mercado municipal, su horario de atención es de las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde, todos los días de la semana.

Ella necesita invertir en el negocio y para eso está solicitando préstamo que les sirva para comprarse papayas, sandías, manzanas piñas, también platanos, papas, tomates, cebollas, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar el negocio vendiendo fruta fresca para aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.

Tiene como objetivo con respecto al préstamo mejorar e incrementar el negocio, de su familia espera que a través de sus ingresos puedan tener una vida mejor más confortable, a futuro comprarse un vehículo para transportar la mercadería.
texts.en:
Marta is a fruit and vegetable merchant.  She lives with her children and husband.  They have worked together in the business in the municipal market for five years.  Her schedule is six in the morning to three in the afternoon every day of the week.

She needs to invest in the business and this is why she’s requesting a loan to buy papayas, watermelons, apples, pineapples and also bananas, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.  This loan will help her improve the business selling fresh fruit to increase sales and profits.

Her goal with respect to the loan is to increase business and with respect to the family is that by means of her income they will be able to have a more comfortable life.  In the future she wants to buy a vehicle to transport the merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a 39 year old, hard working woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver, and all of her children are studying in private school. For two years, she herself has been running a vegetable shop in the market to offer more variety to clients. 

As a member of an eight person lending group, Perveen has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of vegetables and fruits for her shop. With the profit amount, she is interested in opening a new shop near her house, as the current shop is too far from her residence. 

Perveen hopes for a bright future for her children. Many thanks from her to all staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: In the picture, Perveen is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables and fruits for her shop.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married with four children. Norma is 70 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin.

Norma sells "suman" (a variety of rice cake) to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Norma has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients for "suman" making such as sugar, oil, butter, etc.

Norma has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Norma hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for "suman" making such as sugar, oil, butter, etc.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is from Lilo-an, Bonifacio. She's a 50-year-old widow. To make a living, she prepares and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. Recently, she joined GDMPC. Carolina is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients needed to prepare food products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare food products for sale.

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es: San Sebastián es un grupo solidario que van en su segundo ciclo. Se llaman así por el nombre de la colonia donde la mayoría habita. Modesta es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos (2 niñas y 1 niño), todos menores de edad y se dedican a estudiar, su esposo es carpintero y siempre la a apoyado con su crédito. Modesta se dedica a la venta de snak en casa, tiene 2 años con el negocio y le va muy bien; en esta temporada piensa vender tamales, ya que va a dejar de vender bollos y mangonadas y el crédito le ayudara a comprar una vaporera y los articulos que le falten para la preparacion de los tamales.
texts.en:
San Sebastian is a solidarity group that is on its second loan. Their name comes from the name of the neighborhood where most of them live.  

Modesta is a 32-year-old woman who is in a common law marriage and has three children (two girls and one boy), all of whom are minors and are in school.  Her husband is a carpenter and he has always supported her with her loan.  Modesta earns a living by selling snacks from home.  She has had the business for two years and it is going very well.  

At this time she is thinking of selling tamales as she is going to stop selling bollos [a type of bread roll] and mangonadas [mango ice drink].  This loan will help her to purchase a steamer and the other necessary items to make tamales.

loans.use: o purchase a steamer and the other necessary items to make tamales.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es:
Jose, vive con su hijo de 30 años y la esposa de su hijo, tiene un nieto de 10 años, José es divorciado está acompañado únicamente por su hijo, el nieto, la esposa de su hijo, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia hace 20 años, lo atiende todos los días de la semana casi siempre él solo realiza las ventas a los clientes.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales como frijoles, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, producto deseo personal, entre otros materiales necesarios para el hogar, esta inversion ayudará para que pueda fortalecer el inventario del negocio y mejore sus diversidad, así satisfacer  las necesidades de los clientes.
Su objetivo es tener mayores ingresos del negocio, para poder mejorar la vivienda arreglando el patio de la casa .
texts.en:
Jose is divorced and lives with his 30-year-old son, daughter-in-law, and ten-year-old grandson. He manages a store that sells basic staples. He started the store himself 20 years ago. He works attending the store every day of the week, usually by himself.

Jose is requesting this loan in order to buy items such as beans, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, and personal items, among other necessary household goods. This will help him to replenish and diversify his store's inventory to be able to satisfy his customers' needs. 

His goal is to increase his earnings from this business in order to be able to improve his home and repair the patio to his house.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, oil, sugar, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, tiene 45 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos los cuales tienen las edades de 18 y 21 años, actualmente es madre soltera, tiene cinco años de dedicarse totalmente a la venta de productos de belleza. Este negocio que aprendió con un familiar quien le enseñó a trabajar, atiende de lunes a sábado.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cremas para la piel, lociones, maquillajes, esta compra le ayudara para poder mejorar su negocio adquiriendo más productos para variar y que los clientes mantengan la preferencia.

El objetivo de María es fortalecer el negocio hacerlo más rentable para obtener mejores ingresos, ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria sells beauty products. She is currently a single mother, 45 years old, and lives with her two children, ages 18 and 21. For five years she has been fully engaged in selling beauty products.

She learned this business from a family member, who taught her how to do the work. She tends to her business from Monday to Saturday.

She is applying for a loan in order to purchase skin creams, lotions, and makeup. This purchase will help her to improve her business by acquiring more products. This is in order to offer variety and so that the customers will keep patronizing her business.

Maria's goal is to build up her business and make it more profitable, so that she can earn better income and provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy skin creams, lotions and makeup.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 34 years old. She is a stationery supplier and is married to Patrick. They are blessed with two children. She has been a business lady for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Charity will use the loan to buy books, pens and printing papers. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to expand the business and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of books, pens and printing papers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn  is 48 years old, married, and has children.  She is a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She together with her husband manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jocelyn operates a room rental business where rooms are leased on a monthly basis. As an additional source of income, she runs a junk shop. She earns a minimum of 10,000 PHP every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, Jocelyn is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to repair and maintain her rooms for rent. Jocelyn hopes to be able to have her renovation complete soon. She expects a boost in her business income as he expands her business. 

Jocelyn faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to repair and maintain of her boarding house.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Jorge is a 52-year-old married man who hails from Maribojoc, Bohol. He has four children. He has been in the coconut wine business for 23 years. Aside from the coconut wine business, Jorge has a hog raising business. He earns 5,000 PHP a month from the coconut wine business. He plans to use his loan to buy additional containers for the coconut wine, tungog (a bark of a certain kind of mangrove that adds nice color to coconut wine) and pig supplements. In the future, Jorge would like to expand his coconut wine business to support his family.

loans.use: to buy containers, tungog, and supplements for his pigs

loans.name: Wilman Antonio

texts.es:
Wilman, tiene 34 años de edad, la vivienda familiar, está acompañado con sus tres hijos de las edades de 3, 6, 9 años, y su esposa, él se dedica a la cultivación de granos básicos , aprendió con sus padres este trabajo y desde que está con su familia ha seguido realizandolos para ayudar a su hogar con el alimento.

Él solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abono, herbicida e insecticidas, que son los necesarios para utilizarlo en la producción y desarrollo del cultivo, espera tener una mayor capacidad con esta inversión y que sus cosechas sean sanas y abundantes.

Su objetivo con el crédito es tener una mejor solvencia para poder realizar la siembra fortaleciendo así el trabajo que realiza, con esto también quiere tener una fuerza de producción que les permita ayudar a su familia comercializando una parte, con sus hijos él quiere continuar apoyandoles en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Wilman is 34-years-old and lives in the family home with his wife and three children who are 3, 6 and 9 years old.  He works growing basic grains having learned from his parents.  Since he’s had a family of his own he’s continued doing this in order to provide food for his home.

He’s requesting a loan to buy manure, herbicide and insecticide that are necessary for the production and development of the crops.  He hopes to attain larger capacity with this investment and that his harvests will be healthy and abundant.

His objective for the loan is to have greater solvency in order to carry out the planting and strengthening the work he does.  He also wants to have a strong enough production so that he can help his family by selling part of it.  He wants to continue supporting his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide and insecticide..

loans.name: Luis Joel

texts.es:
Luis, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, tiene 26 años de edad, vive con sus padres quienes también son agricultores, de esta ocupación logran obtener sus ingresos y ayudar en los gastos del hogar, Luis aprendió junto con su padre este trabajo y tiene seis años de realizarlo de lunes a viernes.

Solicita un préstamo por qué se encuentra realizando la siembra y para esto necesita comprarse abono y pagar mano de obra que le ayuden a sembrar, será una gran ayuda para que él continúe realizando su trabajo en el campo y pueda tener una buena cosecha.

El manifiesta que su objetivo con el crédito es aumentar la capacidad productiva de sus cultivos, generando por sus cosechas buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Luis works growing basic grains.  He’s 26-years-old and lives with his parents who are also farmers.  They earn income from this occupation to help cover household expenses.  Luis learned it alongside his father and has been working Monday through Friday for six years.

He requests a loan because he’s starting a new crop and needs manure and to pay labor costs for help in planting.  This will be a great help for him to continue doing the work in the fields and to have a good harvest.  

He states that his objective with the loan is to increase his crops productivity so his harvests will generate good profits.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 56 years old and married to Wilson.  She supports a family of six members. She is a mixed crop farmer, and she also sells cereals. She has been in the business for the past six years, with a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is currently servicing her first loan from KADET:  KES 10,000 that will help her to put up a cereal stall. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her future dreams are to improve the living standards of her family

loans.use: to build a cereal stall.

loans.name: Jaqueline Del Carmen

texts.es: Jaqueline, se dedica atender una pulpería, habita en la ciudad de Granada, tiene 3 hijos. Desde hace 5 años tiene su pulpería la cual comenzó con muy pocos productos pero que le permitieron obtener ganancias, también los financiamientos han sido clave para el fortalecimiento de su negocio. Necesita surtir su pulpería de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, gaseosa, avenas, enlatados, café, papel higiénico, detergente, jabones. Pues son los productos que más buscan sus clientes. Pues desea tener bien surtido su pulpería con mucha más variedad de productos que son necesarios para el consumo familiar de sus clientes.  Su meta es convertir su mini pulpería en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Jaqueline runs a small general store. She lives in the city of Granada and has three children. She has had her general store for five years, which she started with very few products, but which has enabled her to earn profits.

The loans have also been key in building up her business. She needs to stock her general store with rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, oatmeal, canned goods, coffee, toilet paper, detergent, and soaps; these are the products that her customers look for the most. She wishes to have her general store well supplied with a much greater variety of products necessary for her customers' household use. 

Her goal is to convert her small general store into a variety store.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, oatmeal, canned goods, coffee, toilet paper, detergent, and soaps.

loans.name: Willer Davis

texts.es:
Willer, es agricultor, tiene 28 años de edad, está casado, vive con sus dos hijos de cinco años y el otro de un año de edad, junto con su esposa realizan los trabajos para el sostenimiento del hogar, tienen casa propia, él aprendió su trabajo en agricultura desde pequeño junto con su padre, lo realiza para consumo familiar desde hace siete años trabajando de lunes a viernes de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde.
	
Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cuatro sacos de abono, que son necesarias para aplicarlos a la milpa, el préstamo será un gran aporte generándole dinero para comprar los insumos y así aplicarlos a la siembra aumentando la producción.

Con el préstamo es a quiere crecer y mejorar la calidad en las cosechas, en su familia espera poder aportar lo necesario para que sus condiciones se mantiene estable.
texts.en:
Willer is a farmer, is 28 years old, is married, and lives with his two children who are five and one years old. With his wife, they work to support their home; they have their own house. He learned his job in agriculture since he was young with his father. He does it for family consumption for seven years, working from Monday to Friday from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm.

He is requesting a loan to invest in buying four bags of fertilizer, which are necessary for the crops. The loan will be of great contribution, providing money to buy supplies and use them for the crops, increasing production. With the loan, he wants to grow and improve the quality of his crops, and he hopes to contribute with the necessary for his family so the conditions stay stable.

loans.use: to buy four bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, administra una panadería, vive con sus nietos de 13, 15 y 7 años de edad, también un hijo de 29 años, todos trabajan en el negocio y todos dependen de ella, solamente le colaboran atendiendo la clientela y elaborando pan, este negocio lo administra con empleados que son parientes, lo realizan todos los días en la mañana, en la tarde y por la noche, lo aprendió de sus padres, tiene más de 12 años realizandolo.

Solicita un préstamo para invertir en los materiales necesarios para el negocio como lo es la harina, azúcar, levadura, y también ocupará una parte para remodelar algunas instalaciones de la panadería, este préstamo al ayudara con el dinero a mejorar la condición del negocio ya que necesita cambiar algunas cosas que le permita realizar un mejor servicio.

Su aspiración con respecto al préstamo es poder realizar la mejor inversión que le permita al negocio funcionar mejor, poder ayudar a sus nietos y a su hijo para que continúe con el negocio y le den vida.
texts.en:
María manages a bakery. She lives with her grandchildren who are 13, 15 and 7 years old and also with a 29-year-old son.  They all work in the business and all depend on her; they help only with tending to customers and with making bread.  She runs the business with employees who are relatives and they work every day morning, afternoon and night.  She learned it from her parents and has been doing it for more than 12 years.

She’s requesting a loan to buy the necessary ingredients like flour, sugar and yeast and will also use part of it to remodel some of the bakery’s installations.  The loan will help her with money to improve the business’ condition because she needs to make some changes in order to provide better services.

Her hope with respect to the loan is to be able to make a better investment that will allow the business to function better and to be able to help her grandchildren and her son to continue with the business and giving it life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Los Trabajadores Group

texts.es:
Mario, tiene 34 años de edad, está casado y vive en una aldea del municipio de Ceguaca, Santa Bárbara. Quien desde pequeño se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos de agricultura ya tiene una experiencia de 15 años. Actualmente tiene un terreno donde cultiva granos básicos como maíz y frijoles, esta actividad es una de las fuentes de ingresos en la comunidad. Las cosechas las venden en los mercados locales de la zona y a clientes fijos que llegan a comprar la producción a la comunidad. 

El préstamo que solicita es en forma grupal, el grupo se llama Los Trabajadores y está formado por 14 miembros y todos se dedican al cultivo de granos básicos,  el total del prestamo en grupo que han solicitado es por 88,000 Lempiras y lo utilizaran para comprar fertilizantes e insumos para los cultivos de maíz y frijoles de esta segunda temporada de cosecha. Don Mario espera sacar buenas cosechas para obtener buenos ingresos y lograr tener una mejor vida con su familia
 
Los miembros se identifican en la fotografía de la siguiente forma: A la izquierda de pie esta Alejandra de blusa rayada con negro, sigue Mario camisa verde con blanco, mayra blusa negra, Aracely blusa naranja con blanco, Fredis camisa verde sin mangas, Lourdes blusa blanca, agustina falda gris, atras esta Maria de blusa roja, Luisa de blusa amarilla, y los que estan agachados a la izquierda esta Carlos de camisa blanca y jeans, Rolando de camisa negra de sombrero, Ramon camisa azul, y Neryn a la derecha camisa gris, y Jose quien no sale en la foto.
texts.en:
Mario, age 34, is married and lives in a village in the Ceguaca municipality in Santa Bárbara.  He has been farming since he was little, and he has 15 years of experience.  He currently has land where he grows basic grains like corn and beans.  This business activity is one of the sources of income in the community.  They sell the harvests at the local markets in the area.  They sell to fixed customers who come to buy the community’s production. 

The loan he is requesting is a group loan.  The group is called ‘Los Trabajadores’ [The Hard-Workers], and it is comprised of 14 members who grow basic grains.  The group has requested a total of 88,000 lempiras.  They will use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies for the corn and bean crops in this second harvest season.  Mario hopes to yield a good harvest this season to make a good amount of money and provide a better life for his family. 

You can see the members in the photo in the following way:  At the bottom left is Alejandra with a black striped blouse, next is Mario with a green and white shirt, Mayra has a black blouse, Aracely has an orange and white blouse, Fedis with a sleeveless shirt, Lourdes with a white blouse, Agustina with a grey shirt, behind is Maria with a red blouse, Luisa with a yellow blouse, and those bending down are Carlos on the left with a white shirt and jeans, Rolando with a black hat, Ramon with a blue shirt and Neryn on the right in a gret shirt.  Jose is not pictured.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies for the corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida, 43 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Alegria, Aurora with four children. She earns an income from her transport service business. She started it almost two years ago and she earns 10,000 PHP a month. To improve her business, she is borrowing 35,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which she just joined in 2011 to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, vive con sus hijos e hijas, el negocio de María lo inició hace dos meses, es la crianza de pollos para el destazo, trabaja con sus hijos encargándose de la manutención y cuidó de los pollos.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de más pollos pequeños y también concentrado para alimentarlos, esto le ayudará para aumentar la granja y así tener más posibilidades de crecimiento, aumentando el número de pollos para el destazo y para distribuir a los clientes, su riesgo es que pueden enfermarse y muri si no se le aplica correctamente  medicamentos.

Su sueño es convertir su granja una producción fuerte en el área, expandir su venta del pollo al mercado y aumentar la clientela.
texts.en:
María raises chicks.  She lives with her sons and daughters.  She started her business two months ago.  She raises chickens to be butchered.  She works with her children feeding and caring for the chicks.

She’s asking for a loan to buy more chicks as well as feed for them.  This will help her increase the size of her farm and have more growth opportunities increasing the number of chickens available for butchering and for sale to customers.  The risk she faces is that they may become ill and die if medicine isn’t administered correctly.  Her dream is to become a strong production farm in the area and to expand the chicken sales in the marked and to increase her clientele.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Sindy Rossmery

texts.es:
La señora Sindy tiene 29 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 1 hijo y reside en compañía de sus padres en el sector de Chamelecón,  Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Desde hace 5 años inicio su negocio de venta de golosinas (churros, refrescos, confites, galletas y jugos)
Sindy decidió establecer su negocio con la idea de apoyar a su compañero de hogar en los gastos familiares.
Actualmente ha decido surtir mas con productos de mayor demanda, por lo que ha solicitado un prestamos por la cantidad de 16,000 Lempiras.
Ella espera invertir sus ganancias en el crecimiento de su negocio y en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Sra. Sindy is 29 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child.  She lives with her parents in the District of Chamelecón in the town of San Pedro Sula, Department of Cortés.

Five years ago, she started her business of selling snacks (chips, soft drinks, candy, cookies, and juices).  Sindy came up with the idea to establish this business because she wanted to help her partner with the family expenses.  

At the moment, she wants to restock with more products that are in great demand.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 16,000 HNL.  She hopes to invest her earnings in the growth of her business and in the expenses for her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, candy, and juices.

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалику 60  лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Сцелью обеспечения семьи со асеми не обходимыми средствами более  12 лет он занимается скотоводством. У него 2  коровы и  1 баран. У него большой фруктовый сад, где выращивает абрикос и собирает боле 2500 тонны урожая. Он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев, а также абрикос, как в свежем виде, так и в сухом виде. На рынке у него много клиентов. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму   10000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abdumalik is 60 years old, married and has four children. In order to provide for his family, for over 12 years he has been raising livestock. He has two cows and one sheep. He has a large fruit orchard where he grows apricots, harvesting over 2,500 tons of fruit. He resells livestock after raising it for several months, and he also sells apricots, both fresh and dried. He has many customers at the market. He would like to grow his business further but does not have sufficient means. He plans to use his revenue to provide good education and access to modern technology for his children. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a married woman with six children. She is 40 years old and resides in Taguitic, Kapatagan. Alicia makes and sells food to earn a living. She's been in this business for four years. Each month she earns 3,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products to sell. Alicia has been a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Alicia wants to expand her business and to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food to sell

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es: La Sra. Deisy tiene dos hijos de la edades de cinco y dos años, el se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Espejo,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. Deisy va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, la Sra. Deisy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida de la cliente y de su familia, la Sra. Deisy es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Deisy has two children who are five and two years old. She works in agriculture, cultivating a variety of vegetables as well as potatoes and yucca on her plot of land located in the community of Espejo. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. Deisy is going to use this loan to buy seeds to grow potatoes and for the preparation of her land. Her reason for requesting this loan is to obtain the necessary resources for cultivation and to be able to subsist (Deisy faces challenges in her business, such as inclement weather that in many cases ruin the crops) and use the profits to improve her and her family’s quality of life. Deisy is a responsible and hardworking person who feels grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Don Luis es un hombre de 52 años de edad el esta casado y vive en Sololá. Tiene 7 hijos de ellos 5 varones que trabajan con el y 2 mujeres que realizan oficios domésticos.
Es un hombre amable y sobre todo trabajador, el se dedica a fabricar prendas de vestir típicos que se utilizan la mujer indígenas de su región.
Junto a sus hijos se apoyan para realizar esta actividad usando como principal herramienta llamado  (telar) donde coloca el hilo para luego realizar estas prendas. El inicio este trabajo hace 24 años atrás cuando se dio cuenta que eran pocos los fabricantes de este tipo de  prendas y que mantienen precios buenos en el mercado, de esa manera obtener buenas ganancias y mejorar la economía de su familia.
Por la temporada del año ha visto que esta prenda tiene mejor demanda de esta manera desea invertir mas capital en su materia prima. De esta manera solicita un préstamo de                    Q 6,500.00 para comprar hilo tipo lana para fabricar mayor cantidad de prendas y tener mejores ganancias.
Tener un terreno mas es su sueño ya que quiere construirles una vivienda a sus hijos como también darles el apoyo necesario en los estudios académicos.
texts.en:
Luis is a 52-year-old, married man living in Sololá.  He has seven children, five boys who work with him and two girls who do domestic chores.  He’s a kind, hardworking man who manufactures traditional articles of clothing worn by indigenous women in the region.

With help from his children they support one another in this activity using the main work tools that’s called ‘telar’ (loom) where the yarn is placed to then make the clothes.  He started this work 24 years ago when he noted that there were few manufacturers of this type of clothing and that its market price remains stable which means good profits and improved family economy.

He’s noticed that demand for these clothes has increased this season and he wants to invest capital in more raw materials.  He’s thus asking for a 6,500 quetzal loan to buy wool yarn to manufacture a larger amount of clothes and earn higher profits.

His dream is to own a piece of land because he wants to build his children a house as well as give them the necessary support for their academic studies.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn to manufacture traditional women's clothes.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, esta con la intensión de comprarse más ropa en variedad para vender, por eso está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar la compra de blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, que son los necesarios para que su negocio funcione y continúe vendiendo, ademas hoy en dia esta fabricando accesorios de madera para vender, buscando las alternativas de generar mas ganancias.
Manifiesta que el crédito anterior le permitió comprarse mercadería en variedad, para poder vender, dándole la posibilidad de generar ganancias para su familia, considera que esta teniendo un avance en la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Miguel wants to buy more kinds of clothes to sell them, and for this reason he is asking for a new loan in order to buy blouses, skirts, trousers and underwear, articles he needs for his activity to work and to keep on selling. He is also currently making wooden accessories to sell, wanting to find new ways to earn money.
He says that the previous loan has helped him buying a wide variety of products to sell, thus giving him the chance to earn money for his family, and he thinks that his household’s economy has consequently improved.

loans.use: To buy  blouses, skirts, trousers and underwear.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, esta siempre realizando su trabajo en la barbería y peluquería, esta interesado en un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de materiales como tijeras, maquina de cortar pelo y tambien tapizara una silla especial de cortar cabello.
El manifiesta que estos préstamos le han permitido tener un negocio mas adecuado, con las condiciones mejor instaladas para que los clientes se sientan cómodos, ha ido surtiéndose de nuevas herramientas para realizar un buen servicio de peluquería.
texts.en:
Pedro keeps on running his hairdresser’s and barber shop, and he is interested in requesting a new loan to invest it in the purchase of tools such as scissors and hair clippers as well as to a special chair to do haircuts upholstered.
He says that the previous loans have allowed him to run a better shop, furnishing the best conditions for his customers’ comfort, as he has been providing himself with new tools to offer a good hairdresser’s service.

loans.use: To buy scissors and hair clippers and to have a chair upholstered.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
María, es una humilde joven de 26 años de edad, de oficio  comerciante, originaria de Granada  al igual que muchas otras jóvenes buscan como ganarse la vida y salir adelante con su familia, trabajan en el comercio informal. Vende cosméticos Avon, los distribuye de manera ambulante cada día lleva consigo su sombrilla o una gorra para protegerse del sol y un catálogo con productos para vender por los barrios, empresas, casas pues entre más venda mejores serán los bonos, ingresos por recibir. Cuando las ventas están bajas ella lava y plancha a domicilio siempre en busca de los ingresos para sustentar a su familia. 
Está solicitando el crédito para comprar cosméticos y perfumes, ya que tiene pedidos y necesitar cumplir para no perder  clientes. Una de sus metas es convertirse es una comerciante mayorista de cosméticos, perfumes y mercadería variada.
texts.en:
María is a modest, 26-year-old woman originally from Granada. Like many other young women, she seeks to make a living and help her family get ahead. 
María works as an Avon sales representative, so every day she sets out in different neighborhoods with an umbrella or a hat to protect her from the sun and an Avon catalog to take orders from people and businesses. The more she sells, the more money she makes in commission. When sales are down, María does housework, always looking to earn money to support her family. 

María is requesting a loan in order to buy cosmetics and perfumes because she already has some orders and doesn't want to lose potential clients. One of her goals is to become a sales representative of wholesale cosmetics, perfumes and other merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Don Pascual es un hombre de 57 años de edad, casado vive en Sololá, tiene 7 hijos quienes 5 de ellos ya casados y dos hombres la cual uno trabaja con el en el campo de la agricultura y un hijo mas estudia para ser maestro de Educación Primaria.
 Un hombre trabajador que ha sabido superarse con su familia, la cual ahora labora independientemente como trabajador de salud en su comunidad así mismo vende medicina general ya que nos cuenta que en su comunidad no cuentan con un medico al alcance de toda la gente.
Lleva 23 años haciendo este trabajo, esto lo aprendió a base de que estuvo 7 años como voluntario en un centro de salud del gobierno y entre algunas capacitaciones y talleres que ha recibido  durante años anteriores. 
El ve la necesidad y solicita un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para ampliar su negocio vendiendo variedad de medicinas a su comunidad, donde la misma gente lo pide pero no lo tiene a la mano así que el quiere invertir mas capital a su negocio así  atender mejor a sus cliente y pacientes que lo buscan.
Entres sus mayores sueños es seguir ampliando este negocio de la venta de medicina, ayudando a la gente de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Don Pascual is a 57-year-old, married man who lives in Sololá. He has seven children, out of which five are married and the rest are two sons. One of them works together with him in agriculture and the other one is studying to be a primary education school teacher.

He is a hard-working man who has found the way to progress with his family. He now works as an independent health-worker in his community. In this way, he sells general medicine. He mentions that they do not have a doctor in their community that could be useful for everyone.

He has been working in this line of work for 23 years. He learned to do this when he worked as a volunteer in a governmental health center for seven years, and because of additional training and workshops that he has received during the past years.

He saw this need and he is requesting a loan for GTQ 6000 in order to expand his business by selling a variety of medicines to his community. Here, people requests this medicine, but cannot find it, so he wants to invest more capital in his business in order to provide a better service to his customers and patients that come to him.

Among his biggest dreams is to keep expanding this business of selling medicine, helping people in his community.

loans.use: to buy general medicine in order to expand his business and support his community.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Don José es un hombre de 54 años de edad el esta casado y vive en Sololá. Tiene 10 hijos de ellos 4 varones que estudian y trabajan junto a el y 4 mujeres que también lo apoyan.
El es un hombre trabajador que quiere lo mejor para su familia trabajando siempre unidos, el se dedica a cultivar verduras como cebolla, papa, frijol y maíz las cuales vende en el mercado local y en otros lugares.
Junto a su esposa e hijos se apoyan para realizar los cultivos, el empezó este trabajo independientemente hace 20 años atrás siendo así la principal actividad que le enseñaron sus padres. El ve que el cultivo de estas verduras han dado buenos resultados con los precios mejorando la economía de su familia. 
Las cosechas que ha tenido han sido buenas el desea cultivar nuevamente en su terreno, la cual necesita un crédito de Q 4,000.00 para comprar semillas de papa y su respectivo fertilizante orgánico de esta manera cultivar y tener buena cosecha. El espera tener buenas ganancias y seguir mejorando los ingresos económicos para su familia.
Tener otras tierras y construirles vivienda a sus hijos es el mayor sueño junto a su esposa por eso seguirá trabajando mucho para que todo sea una realidad en su vida.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old. He is married and lives in Sololá. He has 10 children: of these, four are boys who go to school and work with him, and four are girls who also help him.

He is a hard-working man who wants the best for his family, with them always working together. He grows vegetables such as onions, potatoes, beans, and corn, which he sells in the local market and in other places.

He, his wife and his children help one another carry out the farm work. He began this work independently 20 years ago, this being the main livelihood that his parents taught him. 

He sees that growing these vegetables has given good results, with the good prices improving his family's finances. The harvests he has had have been good. He wishes to farm his plot of land again, for which he needs a loan of 4000 quetzales in order to buy seed potatoes and organic fertilizer. This way he can cultivate his land and have a good harvest. 

He hopes to have good earnings and to continue improving his family's income. His greatest dream is to have more land and to build a house for his children. This is why he will continue working hard, so that all this can come true in his life.

loans.use: To buy seed potatoes and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Don Pablo es un agricultor de 40 años de edad, casado, vive en Sololá con su esposa y sus 9 hijos 5 hombres y 4 mujeres  de los cuales el mayor de 18 años de edad  lo ayuda trabajando en el campo de la agricultura.
El se dedica al cultivo de remolacha, lechuga así como la siembra masiva de cebollines y cebolla que tiene a pocos kilómetros de su vivienda. Trabajan conjuntamente con su esposa he hijos ayudándolo con la siembra y la cosecha de estas verduras. 
El empezó trabajando en la agricultura con personas ajenas desde que tenía 10 años, al contraer matrimonio con su esposa y el pasar del tiempo se dio cuenta que el cultivo de estas verduras mantienen el precio en el mercado y dejan una ganancia aceptable para poder mantener su familia de este modo decidió cultivar independientemente y cosechar su propio producto con la ayuda de su esposa, ahora tiene 12 años de realizar esta actividad y el ve que la producción en cada siclo han sido buenas.
De este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 1,000.00 para la compra de  plantillas de cebolla para luego ser cultivadas en otros lugares y tener mejores ganancias en otros ciclos de producción.
Entre sus más grandes sueños es comprar un terreno, construir una vivienda  y darles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pablo’s a 40-year-old farmer.  He’s married and lives in Solalá with his wife and nine children, five boys and four girls.  The eldest is 18-years-old and helps him with the work in the fields.

He grows beets and lettuce and also massively grows scallions and onions a few kilometers from home.  He works with his wife and children; they help him plant and harvest these vegetables.

He started working in agriculture for third parties since he was ten-years-old and when he married his wife and time passed he realized that these vegetables retain a high market price and produce acceptable profits to support his family so he decided to start growing them independently and harvest his own products with help from his wife.  He’s now been doing this for 12 years and each cycle his crop yields have been good.

He’s asking for a Q 1,000.00 [1,000 Quetzal) loan to buy onion seedlings to plant in other places and earn better profits during other production cycles.  Among his greatest wishes is to buy land, build a house and provide better conditions for his children.

loans.use: to buy onion seedlings.

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.es:
Don Bartolo es un hombre de 46 años de edad esta en unión de hecho con su esposa  y vive en Sololá. Tiene 7 hijos de ellos 5 varones que estudian y trabajan con el y 2 mujeres.
Es un hombre trabajador prosperando siempre junto a su familia, el se dedica a cultivar verduras como alverja, papa y zanahoria las cuales vende en el mercado local y en otros lugares.
Junto a sus hijos se apoyan para realizar esta actividad el inicio este trabajo hace 25 años atrás siendo así la principal actividad que le enseñaron sus padres. El ve que el cultivo de estas verduras han dado buenos resultado con sus precios mejorando la economía de su familia. 
Después de cosechar papa el desea cultivar nuevamente en su terreno la cual necesita un crédito de Q 2,000.00 para comprar plantillas de alverja y su respectivo fertilizante orgánico de esta manera cultivar y tener buena cosecha. El espera tener buenas ganancias y seguir mejorando los ingresos económicos.
Ver a sus hijos terminando una carrera académica es su mayor sueño junto a su esposa por eso seguirá trabajando mucho para que todo sea una realidad en su vida.
texts.en:
Bartolo is a 46 year old man who is in a committed relationship with his wife.  He lives in Sololá.  He has seven children; five boys go to school and work with him and two girls.

He is a hard-working man who is thriving, always at his family’s side.  He grows vegetables like potatoes and carrots, which he sells at the local market and other places.

His children help him with this business activity.  He started this work 25 years ago because it is the main business activity that his parents taught him.  He sees that growing these vegetables has produced good results with the prices improving his family’s finances.

After harvesting potatoes he wishes to cultivate the land again.  To do so he needs 2,000 quetzales to buy young pea plants and organic fertilizer.  This way he will cultivate and have a better harvest.  He hopes to have good income and to continue improving his earnings.

Seeing his children complete an academic career is the biggest dream that he and his wife have.  Therefore, he will continue working a lot in order for this to become a reality in his life.

loans.use: to buy pea plants and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una señora que le gusta trabajar y luchar por su familia, con 26 años de edad casada, vive en Sololá con su esposo  y sus tres hijos. El más grande es un niño de 7 años que estudia el nivel primario en la escuela, una nena de 4 años que aun no estudia y el mas pequeño que apenas tiene 3 mese  de nacido. 
Ella se dedica a la agricultura conjuntamente con su esposo, cultivando papa y zanahoria cerca de su vivienda, este trabajo  lo aprendió  junto a su padre desde que tenía 13 años de edad, ahora lleva 15 años de cultivar estas verduras, ya que estos  mantienen sus precios en el mercado teniendo mejores ganancias. 
De esta manera ve la necesidad de invertir y aprovechar el terreno que ella y el esposo tienen, solicitando un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para comprar semillas de zanahoria y su fertilizante orgánico para luego cultivarlo. 
Entre sus metas quiere seguir ampliando sus cultivos, y poder darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos principalmente los estudios académicos, ya que ella en el pasado no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por la baja economía de su familia.
texts.en:
Catarina is a lady who enjoys working and striving for her family.  She’s 26-years-old, married and lives in Sololá with her husband and three children.  The oldest is a 7-year-old boy who attends elementary school.  A four-year-old little girl does not attend school yet and the youngest is barely three-months-old.

She works in agriculture with her husband growing potatoes and carrots near her house.  She learned this type of work alongside her father since she was 13-years-old; she’s now been growing vegetables for 15 years since they maintain their market price and profits have improved.

She, therefore, sees the need to invest and take advantage of the land she and her husband have.  She’s asking for a Q 8,000.00 loan to buy carrot seeds and organic fertilizer for later use.

Among her goals is to continue expanding the crops to give her children a better life, especially schooling since in the past she was unable to go to school due to her family’s low income level.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Gladys Esperanza

texts.es: Gladys esperanza de  49 años de edad, casada con dos hijos mayores de edad de  32, 27 años independientes económicamente. Gladys corresponde al departamento de león, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Lugar que  se caracteriza por tener gente muy acogedora, trabajadora  Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general  , la cual consisten en vender ropa variada como pantalones, camisas, uniformes, faldas, sabanas, ropa interior, ropa de niño, cosméticos, artículos plásticos, prendas de plata. en la foto se observa  a Gladys mostrando parte de su productos como son los cosmeticos. Tiene 4 años de tener el negocio. El negocio lo inicio con capital propio y en la actualidad fue creciendo gracias a su clientela fija  y las inversiones que realiza al negocio de las mismas ganancias. El este momento está solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con encargas elaborados por sus clientes. Gladys Esperanza ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 y ha demostrado responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. La Sra. Gladys agradece la ayuda que le brindan  los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos para tener un medio de vida digno en países pobre y con  limitantes de fuentes de trabajo como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Gladys Esperanza is 49 years old, married, and has two financially-independent adult children who are 32 and 27 years old.  Gladys lives in León department, in the west of the country.  León is known for its very welcoming, hard-working people.

Glady's business is selling general merchandise.  She sells a range of clothing such as pants, shirts, uniforms, skirts, underwear and children's clothing.  She also sells sheets, cosmetics, plastic products and plated jewelry.  In the photo, Gladys is showing off some of her products: the cosmetics. 

Gladys has been running her business for four years.  She set it up with her own capital and it has grown thanks to her established customer base and the investments that she makes with her profits.  Right now, she is requesting a loan to invest in working capital and to stock her business with products her customers have ordered.  Gladys has worked with Fundación León 2000 before and has shown herself to be responsible in making her loan repayments on time and in full.  She is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people of limited resources in poor countries with limited sources of work such as Nicaragua.  This help enables them to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business with a range of merchandise such as pants, shirts, uniforms, skirts, sheets, underwear, children's clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 38 years old and a farmer. She is married to Joseph. They are blessed with three children, ages 13, 9, and 4. She has been raising rabbits and poultry for the past 23 years and earns a monthly income of 19,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her fifth loan with KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Juliana will use the loan to buy a water tank. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own a rabbit farm.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Benito Martin

texts.es: Benito Martin de 66 anos de edad, casado con tres hijos de 34.32, 21 anos de edad del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La actividad económica en la que se desempeña es la venta de frutas y verduras ubicada en uno de los mercados de la localidad. El negocio consiste vender todo tipo de frutas y verduras como: bananos, naranjas, guayaba, limones, plátanos, papaya, pina cebollas. Benito Martin se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador, responsable, en créditos anteriores que ha tenido con fundación ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo  y forma. El financiamiento lo esta solicitando para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir sus ventas  con productos perecederos. Benito Martin agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Benito Martin is 66 years old, married, and has three children who are 34, 32 and 21 years old.  He lives in Chinandega department, in the west of the country.  Benito's business is selling fruits and vegetables in one of the markets in his area.  He sells fruits and vegetables such as bananas, oranges, guava, lemons, plantains, papaya, pineapple, and onions.  Benito Martin is noted for being a very hard-working, responsible man.  With the previous loans he has received from Fundación León 2000 he has shown himself to be responsible, making his repayments on time and in full.  He is requesting this loan to invest in working capital and to stock his store with products that are used by families every day.  He is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to people of limited means in poor countries such as Nicaragua as it allows them to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as bananas, oranges, guava, lemons, plantains, papaya, pineapple, and onions.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es: Gloria, de 25 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, madre de dos hijos, se dedica a trabajar en su pulpería. Esta actividad la empezó  con ayuda de su mama, quien la motivo a tener su propio negocio, sus primeros productos fueron, snacks y gaseosas poco a poco fue agregando más productos. Actualmente tiene 1 año de estar funcionando y ha resultado rentable pues no hay día donde no se vende, siempre tiene clientes. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar granos básicos, aceite, productos de limpieza, papel higiénico, pan, sopas, enlatados. Su propósito es convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea bien surtida donde además venda ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
Gloria, 25, lives in the city of Granada and is the mother of two children.  She works in her grocery store.  She started this activity with help from her mother who encouraged her to have a business of her own.  Her initial products were snacks and soft-drinks and gradually she added more items.  She’s now been in business for a year and has had profitable results because not a day goes by that she does not sell; she always has customers.

She needs the loan to buy basic grains, oil, cleaning supplies, toilet paper, bread, soup, canned goods.  Her goal is to turn her grocery store into a well-stocked variety store where she’ll also sell clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Upon the approval of an Accion Texas Inc. loan, Mark treated his four sons to a company dinner at Denny’s to celebrate. Through two decades, Mark worked various jobs to support his family. But when he and his wife divorced 12 years ago, he had to work harder as he became a single father.

“One day I was sitting down and I noticed for 20 years, I was working so much and I never made more than $20,000 a year,” he said. “I’ve always done side jobs and one day I was thinking about how to make more money.” That’s when his son suggested entering the music industry.

SolFear Records and Productions of McAllen, Texas, is a record label targeting musicians looking to sign a contract and produce music. In its two years of business, Mark and two of his sons have worked out of Mark’s bedroom with at least 80 bands and created shows to raise awareness of McAllen’s talents. 

Mark recalls: “My son, who we call Fuby, said, ‘You’re not doing one thing you love: your music. You should be around what you love, before you think about what you make.’” 

Thereafter, Mark opened a recording studio in his home. “I had the magic wand in my hand, which was my guitar and my talent, and honestly, everything fell in place. I felt accomplished,” he said.  “We don’t just record; we copyright every song. Our label is trademarked so we don’t have to worry about anything; we protect your music.”

Mark began his musical journey when he was nine. His grandfather noticed Mark’s interest and handed the guitar to him, and since then, guitar playing has been his passion.

When first seeing various TV commercials and web ads, Mark was skeptical about Accion because he has a negative relationship with banks. But when he learned Accion is a non-profit organization, he decided to apply for a loan. Mark said the loan helped him gain financial security. “I know how to make the loan work for us,” he said. As a natural hard worker, Mark said, “When you can’t do it yourself, you have to lean on something, and this Accion loan is what I have to lean on.” 

Uncomfortable with investing large amounts of what little he could spare, he said, “Accion is helping me get past those fears of risk.”

“Accion has helped me beat my two-year business goal,” he said. 

Mark will use the loan for his grand opening. He purchased advertisement, including banners, food, and paid for live music to raise community awareness about the studio. The rest of his loan will go towards working capital. “Honestly, now that we have this, I expect my business to increase 35 percent. People felt uncomfortable in our home. It’s going to help a lot. And we also purchased a coffee pot and microwave for the longer nights.”

“As far as money goes, I feel I make more than I ever would as an employee,” Mark said. “Sometimes I still can’t believe it.” 

Mark wants the business to be known as the SolFear Train. He said, “Those who want to be a part of the SolFear Train, it doesn’t mean you’re a musician, just that you’re a music lover, supporter, or one who uses music as a tool in life. As we move forward, you’ll learn more about our label through news feeds. But like a train, we only move forward.” 

The label also donated to the Make a Wish Foundation. Find out more on their website: http://www.solfearrecordsproductions.com/; Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/solfeartrain; and Twitter page: http://twitter.com/solfeartrain.

loans.use: for working capital and to advertize his new recording studio.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
When Eduardo (left) from Laredo, Texas, was looking for a new job, he and his business partner, Victor, (right) discussed several ideas, such as child or adult daycare, security and party rentals, until they eventually agreed on vending. Both Eduardo and Victor are 25 years old and were looking for something that didn’t require too much work. They strive to give the best customer service, which Eduardo credits with their success. "Wolf Vending Company" is currently running on its own by word of mouth.

Since the Laredo business began January 1, 2012, it has been growing monthly. Eduardo steadily obtained his first five machines and began approaching companies by March. His company now operates nine machines. “What we offer are canned sodas or bottled drinks. We also offer healthy to salty snacks – anything that has to do with snacks that’re not hot or cold,” Eduardo says. As a matter of policy, Wolf Vending Company keeps its vending machines well stocked and always completes repairs within 30 days. They also offer liability and workmen’s compensation, meaning that if Eduardo or Victor were hurt while on the job, they are covered and their customers won’t have to pay for any medical expenses.  

For now, Eduardo employs only himself and Victor. He says that when the demand for his machines eventually grows to at least three times as much as it is now, he will begin hiring others to offer more customer service to their clients.

Without a loan, Eduardo and Victor would have had to start their business with their own savings. The loan from Accion Texas Inc. was a blessing, he says.  “It took a load off our shoulders. Yes, we would have been able to afford it, but it would have been tight for our personal finances.” He discovered Accion through one of his former supervisors, who recommend that he and Victor attend seminars presented by the Small Business Development Center (SBDC) in Laredo. Coincidentally, the Accion offices were housed in the same building! So the young entrepreneurs found a great new path to realizing their dreams of business success.

Eduardo learned a lot in the beginning, such as how to properly interact and speak effectively with business owners. “We probably changed our repertoire about 15 times – I’m not exaggerating,” he says.  Eduardo and Victor also had to learn how to fix their machines themselves, since they haven’t yet found a business to do so.

loans.use: to pay for a new face plate for one of his soda machines and to repair the other machines.

loans.name: Santiago Noel

texts.es:
El Sauce está ubicado a 90 km del departamento de León, es un Lindo pueblo rodeado de una naturaleza bella, donde la mayoría de los clientes se dedican al comercio, se caracteriza por ser una zona donde se dedica al desarrollo municipal, también existen otros rubro como es la ganadería y a la agricultura. 

Santiago es nacido y criado en este municipio con buenos costumbre y amor al trabajo que desde muy pequeño le enseñaron a sobrevivir con su propias actividades como es la barbería. 

Empezó su negocio desde hace 4 años, el cual consiste en una pequeña barbería donde brinda servicios a los pobladores de la zona, hoy en día tiene su propia clientela, pero debido a la necesidad de su negocio él está solicitando crédito para la compra de: Cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para realizar mejoras al local donde tiene su negocio. 

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo con estos pequeños créditos que ayudan a mejorar muchos negocios que necesitan de capital de trabajo para salir adelante y ser estables en el mercado y de la misma forma agradece por la atención que se le ha brindado y por haberle ido a ofrecer el crédito a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
El Sauce is located 90 km from the administrative division of León. It is a nice town surrounded by beautiful nature, where the majority of clients make a living trading. It is characterized as a zone that is dedicated to municipal development, and there are other sources of income such as livestock and agriculture.

Santiago was born and raised in this town with good customs and a love for work. Since when he was very young they taught him to survive on his own economic endeavors, such as his barbershop.

He began his business four years ago, which consists of a small barbershop where services are offered to the residents of the area. Today he has his own clientele, but due to the needs of his business he is requesting a loan to purchase cement, sand, and to pay for labor to make improvements to the building where his business is located.

He thanks Kiva and Ceprodel for the support with these small loans that help improve many businesses that need working capital to move forward and become stable in the market, and in the same way he is thankful for the attention that has been offered to him and for having gone to his home to offer him a loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and wood to equip his barbershop with

loans.name: Tranquilino

texts.en:
Tranquilino lives with his long-time partner and his three children. He is a responsible and industrious man who is engaged in the livestock and farming business. With his patience, hard work, dedication, and resourcefulness, he is able to generate income for his family's expenses. Tranquilino really appreciates his long-time partner's effort and support in generating funds for their family.

Tranquilino aims to strengthen his livestock and farming business, and is doing his very best in order to attain this goal. For now, he would like to ask for a loan of 25,000 PHP, which would allow him to buy hog feed and two piglets to raise. He hopes that he can continually improve his livestock business with this loan. The income could support the needs of his family and let his three children finish their studies. He could also save some money for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and hog feed.

loans.name: Marvin Alonso

texts.es: Marvin Alonso, de 47 anos de edad, casado con tres hijos menores de edad de 23, 21,12 de los cuales dos están bajo su responsabilidad, ya que están estudiando. Él es originario de la ciudad de Managua, tiene por actividad económica la venta de accesorios de vehículo, como neumático, rin, grasa, espejos, forros de asientos. Experiencia en el negocio 25 anos. El negocio esta ubicado en un lugar especifico de su localidad. Marvin Alonso es un hombre, muy trabajador, responsable, en créditos anteriores ha demostrado ser buena paga en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pequeño negocio. para tener mas ingresos y poder brindarles mejores condiciones a sus  hijos ya que esta por cumplir uno de sus sueños como ver formado a uno de sus hijos en un profesional.  Marvin Alonso agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener  fuentes de trabajo digna.
texts.en:
Marvin Alonso is 47 years old, married, and has three children (ages 23, 21, and 12), two of whom are under his responsibility since they are studying.  He is originally from the city of Managua and manages a business in which he sells vehicle accessories such as tires, rims, grease, mirrors, and seat covers.  Marvin has 25 years of experience in running his business, which is situated in a specific location in town.  He is a hardworking and responsible gentleman.  With his previous loans, he demonstrated that he has a good record of paying on time and in the correct manner.  

The loan he is requesting will be invested as operating capital in order to restock his small business.  As a result, he will have more income and be able to provide better conditions for his children.  One of his dreams is to see at least one of his children become a professional.  Marvin Alonso is grateful for the assistance Kiva lenders have provided to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries, such as Nicaragua.  This enables them to have sources of decent work.

loans.use: to buy tires, rims, grease, mirrors, and seat covers.

loans.name: Alfredo Alex

texts.es:
Alfredo es un joven de 24 años de edad muy habilidoso y sobre todo carismático, si vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Alfredo esta estudiando la carrera de Odontología, con la ayuda de sus padres ya que a pesar de su condición humilde lo pudieron ayudar a estudiar, asimismo Alfredo trabaja medio tiempo para poder solventar los gastos adicionales de su profesión, es por ello que logro obtener el trabajo como asistente en un consultorio dental, en el cual trabaja actualmente alrededor de 8 horas; el cree que le va  bien en su trabajo porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene mucha paciencia.

Alfredo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar los trámites para obtener su bachiller y comprar materiales como resinas, instrumentos quirúrgicos, gasas, algodones, entre otros, de esta manera el podrá tener los implementos necesarios para realizar las curaciones a sus pacientes y de esta manera mejorar su ingresos , lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propio consultorio y ser el orgullo de sus padres”.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 24 years old and is a very humble and skillful youth. His housing is located in the city of Ica, which is characterized by having a warm and welcoming atmosphere, also agriculture is developed specifically in the farming of cotton, grapes, asparagus, etc. Alfredo is studying dentistry. With the help of his parents, in spite of their humble condition, they helped him to study. He is also working part time to be able to meet the additional expenses of his profession. It is in this way he was able to get a job as an assistant in a dentist office, in which he worked almost 8 hours daily. He thinks that it is going well because he is friendly with the clients and above all is very patient.

Alfredo is very appreciative for the Kiva loans.Thanks to the assistance they have provided he will be able to take the steps to get his degree and purchase materials like resins, surgical equipment, gauze, cottons, etc. In this way he will be able to have the tools necessary to treat his patients and improve his income. This will allow him to continue his struggle to make his greatest dream a reality: to have his own consultation and to make his parents proud.

loans.use: to take the necessary steps towards a bachelor's degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, plantains, milk, and other ingredients for preparing the food that she sells.

loans.name: Jeimy De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jeymi, 35 años de edad, soltera, originaria de Granada, comerciante. Vende repostería, negocio el cual inicio gracias a la  experiencia obtenida en una panadería para la cual trabajo, fue ahorrando poco a poco y le pido a su anterior jefe que le vendiera repostería más barata para así poder vender en su casa. Los clientes fueron llegando y probando la sabrosa repostería y su demanda aumento. Lleva dos con este negocio. Por lo cual está solicitando el crédito para comprar una vitrina de vidrio y  otra de aluminio y más repostería. Ya que podrá ofrecer más variedad y colocarlos en un sito visible y con mejor presentación. Uno de sus sueños es convertir su repostería en un sitio más amplio donde tenga el servicio de café y desayuno para todos los gustos.
texts.en: Jeymi is 35 years old, single, and is a merchant originally from Granada.  She sells desserts and started this business because of her experience in the bakery where she worked.  She saved up little by little and asked her former boss to sell her desserts at a reduced price so that she could sell them out of her home.  Her customers would arrive, taste the delicious desserts, and demand grew.  She’s been doing this for two years and she requested a loan so that she could buy one glass display case, one aluminum display case, and more desserts.  This will allow her to provide a greater variety and display her merchandise in a better location with better presentation.  One of her dreams is to expand her dessert business to include coffee and breakfast for all tastes.

loans.use: to buy display cases and inventory.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva tiene 60 años pero tiene una alegría y las ganas de vivir de una joven de 15 años, Primitiva vive al lado de su esposo y de sus 3 hijos a quienes ama muchísimo y a pesar de que sean mayores de edad para ella siempre serán sus retoños, Primitiva es una mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo le gusta mucho la agricultura y por ello ella trabaja en su parcela, actualmente ha sembrado los riquísimos pallares, el cual es un cultivo característico de su ciudad; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque le gusta lo que hace y sobre todo porque es muy cuidadosa.

Primitiva está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, realizar arado a la tierra y gastos de regadío; de esta manera el podrá tener una buena cosecha y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener más tierras de cultivo”.
texts.en:
Primitiva is 60 years old, but has the joy and zest for life of a young girl of 15. Primitiva lives with her husband and her three children, whom she loves very much: despite the fact that they are adults, for her they will always be her little ones. 

Primitiva is a very hard-working woman, and above all, she really likes farming. This is why she works on her parcel of land. Currently she has planted the very delicious butter beans, which is a characteristic crop of her city. She believes that her work is going well because she likes what she does, and  especially because she is very thorough.

Primitiva is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have offered her, she will be able to buy manure, fertilizers, plow the soil, and pay for irrigation expenses. In this way she will be able to have a good harvest and improve her income, and she will continue striving to make her greatest dream come true: "To have more farmland".

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers, plow the soil, and pay for irrigation costs.

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Sreypov is 23 years old and married. She has two children to take care of who are still in school. To feed her family, she grows cassava, mangoes, and cashews on a four-hectare area of farmland. She has been in this business for ten years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family needs. 

Sreypov’s group consists of three members who are all females and she has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loan has helped her better support the current business. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to have a healthy yield to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 41 años, hace 20 años convive con Rebeca. Tiene 5 hijos, pero solo 2 viven con él. Ellos habitan un hogar rústico ubicado en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Él nació en una zona agrícola y gracias al trabajo y enseñanzas de sus padres, ahora se dedica a la agricultura. Posee 7 cuadras de terrenos agrícolas, en ellos siembra café y plátanos. 
“La cosecha de este año fue buena, por eso tengo que limpiar todos mis terrenos para que el año que viene sea igual”, menciona.
A él le gusta su trabajo. Éste año obtuvo 55 sacos de café y cada uno lo vendió a 360 soles. “Éste año el precio de café bajó hasta casi la mitad, pero seguimos trabajando”, dice.
Siente que le falta mucho por lograr, especialmente educar adecuadamente a sus hijos. Espera verlos convertidos en personas responsables y sobresalientes. Es por eso que seguirá trabajando la tierra con el mismo ahínco que siempre.
Ahora se esforzará en realizar la limpieza de sus cultivos. Requiere de su poyo para realizar los pagos a las personas que contratará para esta labor. Éste es su segundo crédito con MFP. En el primero fue puntual y no duda en serlo esta vez. “Los productores Yaneshas”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, y es el presidente del grupo.
Con los 1500 soles solicitados podrá pagar a los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de su cafetal.
texts.en:
Miguel, 41, has lived with Rebeca for 20 years; he has five children but only two still live with him.  They live in a rustic home located in an indigenous community in the central jungle.  He was born in a farming area and thanks to his parents’ work and teachings he now works in agriculture.
