loans.use: to buy more items like  iron metals for making beds, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Hitira

texts.en:
Hitira is a 33-year-old married man with two children and one dependant. He is a farmer and mainly growing sugarcane. He started the business in 2000, and from it he has managed to provide his family with the basic necessities and has been able to construct a permanent house for his family. 

He wants a loan of 1,000,000 shillings to buy land for sugarcane growing and also buy manure for his plantation as it will enable him improve his sugarcane production.

His dream is to be the leading producer of quantity and quality sugarcane in the region. Inadequate land for sugarcane growing and pests that attack sugarcane, hence reducing its production, are his major challenges.

Hitira is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy land and manure for his sugarcane plantation

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is married with four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of an additional family member, a young sister. She has a business selling Cavendish bananas and has been in this business for 7 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of Cavendish bananas. She works six days a week at the market and sells on wholesale only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the transportation of bunches of Cavendish bananas from the villages to her stall in the market.

Leah aspires to see her business grow bigger so that she earns enough profits to buy a delivery van to ease her transportation challenges and to educate her children up to university.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because it is trustworthy. She resides in a rented house without access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of Cavendish bananas

loans.name: Berita

texts.en:
Berita is 26 years old and a businesswoman.  She is married to Patrick, a businessman. They are blessed with one child. Berita has been a tailor for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Berita will use the loan to buy textile materials. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more textile materials

loans.name: Marko Taban

texts.en:
Marko is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 9. All of them go to school.

Marko has run a dressmaking business for four years. He has no employees. He has no additional source of income.

He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase cloth and others materials.
 
In five years Marko would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high transportation costs. Marko says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying more materials like cloth

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 37 years old from Nyahururu and is married with three children who are between 14 and 17 years of age.

Monicah is a farmer and has been in the farming activity for many years. She has applied for a loan to enable her to buy pesticides and herbicides to use on her farm. Monicah is optimistic that her wheat farm will do well after the loan. She hopes to see her business do well and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and herbicides

loans.name: Kikumbo Mixed Farmers S&c Group

texts.en: Jennifer is a 37-year-old, married woman with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a drug shop and has been in this business for 10 years. She began the business with her own savings of 150,000 shillings and now her stock is worth 500,000 shillings. She has a challenge of customers not paying on time yet she has inadequate capital to purchase drugs. Her personal goal is building a permanent house for residence as she is currently living under a mud-wattled dwelling. Her business goal is expanding into new markets and owning a pharmacy. Jennifer intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell. She is a member of the above-mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan and that is why they are 16 people in the photo even if 15 took the loan.

loans.use: To buy drugs for resale

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a single mother of two children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother and young sister). She has a business of selling sweet bananas and has been in this business for 10 years.  She has applied for 10 years to buy more bunches of sweet bananas. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. She works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and seasonality. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she becomes a wholesaler, to start going to villages of Masaka for bunches of bananas, and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy  more bunches of sweet bananas

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en:
Jacklyne is 34 years old. She is married to James, and together, they have one child who is five years old. She has been in retail business for the past three years and the business is doing great.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to buy rice, sugar and flour for sale in her retail business.


She hopes to manage educate her children.

loans.use: to rice, sugar and maize flour and

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 40, is married and has two children. He is a clinicain at a medical clinic. Treating the sick has been a dream of his since childhood, and he is happy to have realized it. 

Peter also owns rental houses in which four tenants live who pay him on a monthly basis. His request for a 1,500,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM is for the purpose of renovating his rentals. By improving their condition, he hopes to be able to charge higher rental fees.

Peter has dreams of furthering himself through his studies.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 54 years old and has a business selling fruits and vegetables in Nakuru town. She is married to John and they have six children.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables including bananas, oranges, kale, cabbages and spinach to sell in her business.

Rachel hopes to expand her business, open a grocery store and sell cereals as well.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install electricity in his business premises.

loans.name: Keith

texts.en:
Keith is a thirty-three-year-old farmer in Nkubu County in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and 2-year-old child. His child has not yet started school. Keith is employed; as an additional source of income, he has been in farming for three years producing milk, tea and coffee, which he sells locally.

Keith is requesting for 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow, which will help him lift his standard of living. It will also help him raise money to pay for his child's education. He believes he will start exporting his product in future.

He says drought, pests and diseases are the challenges that he goes through.

Keith says he appreciates the way Juhudi Kilimo has affordable interest rates for small scale farmers.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Balibaseka Group

texts.en: Teopista is a 46-year-old woman with a refreshment business. She has a family of 5 children, one of whom goes to school. Teopista currently looks after her grandchild who lost a mother and goes to school too. She works at her business seven days a week and at times she sells fish to increase her income to meet her family needs. Her major clients are government officials. She hopes that this loan will help her buy fish, for which there is a market, and also increase her stock of refreshments. Her hard work and good customer service has helped her to attract many clients.

loans.use: To buy fish and increase refreshment stock

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a dairy farmer who lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She has been in the business for the last five years. She is married. 

Alice has a dairy cow which she kept till it gave birth and has been selling the milk since then. She also wants to diversify to poultry keeping to increase her income. Alice was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

The challenge in the current business is that some clients not pay on time. Her future ambition is to increase the stock of animals on her farm.

 
Alice has seen a potential in agri business and would like to diversify to poultry farming.

loans.use: To buy more animals for her farm.

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es:
El señor Apolinario  tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, reside en una comunidad del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortes.
La labor a que se dedicaba Don Apolinario era la agricultura, actualmente ofrece a la venta frutas y vegetales como: naranjas, sandias, papayas, mandarinas rambutanes, aguacates  y bananos.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 8,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de más producto para mantener surtido su negocio.
Sus metas a futuro es invertir en el crecimiento de su negocio y mantener en buen estado su vehículo.
texts.en:
Sr. Apolinario is 36 years old and has two children. He resides in a community in the town of San Pedro Sula, Department of Cortes.

Don Apolinario previously worked as a farmer, but now he sells fruits and vegetables including oranges, watermelons, papayas, tangerines, rambutan, avocados, and bananas. He is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 HNL which he plans to invest in the purchase of more products so that he can keep his business stocked.

His future goals are to invest in the growth of his business and to keep his vehicle in good condition.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as oranges, watermelons, and rambutan.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, de 45 años, es un hombre bueno y trabajador. Convive con su pareja, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia en donde comparte la alegría de criar a sus hijos, quienes son su motivo para seguir adelante. El trabajo de Cesar consiste en el transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, él se levanta muy temprano para alistarse y salir a las diversas calles de la ciudad en busca de los eventuales pasajeros quienes requieren transportarse de un lugar a otro. Gracias a los 12 años que lleva realizando este trabajo, ha aprendido a conocer a sus clientes y se ha ganado la confianza de muchos de ellos, eso le permite ser solicitado para brindar servicios particulares siendo contratado por largas horas de trabajo. Su carisma y alegría son su principal arma para sobrellevar el día a día laboral y relacionarse mejor con sus pasajeros. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que él puede disponer de su tiempo ya que trabaja principalmente en horarios de mayor demanda del público que son en horas escolares de entrada a los colegios y centros de labores de las personas, el resto del día trabaja transitando por las distintas calles de la ciudad. Le está yendo bien, ya que como su mototaxi es propio no tiene que pagar a alguien por el alquiler. Su plan a futuro es comprar dos mototaxis más para así ampliar su flota vehicular y poder alquilarlos. Este es el préstamo número 6 con MFP, por lo tanto agradece a todas las personas que siguen confiando en él para acceder nuevamente a este financiamiento que le ayudará a aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado 2,000 soles, comprará algunas piezas y enviará su mototaxi al taller para que le hagan algunas reparaciones. Otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en pagar la letra de pago de su siguiente mototaxi.
texts.en:
Cesar, 45, is a good and hard-working man. He lives to gether with his partner, witi which he has three children. They live together in their own house, where he shares the joy of raising his children, who are his motivation to get ahead. Cesar's work consists of transporting passengers in his mototaxi. He wakes up very early and gets ready to drive through the numerous streets in the city, looking for possible passengers that require transport from one place to the other.

Because he has been working in this for 12 years, he has got to know his clients and he has won the trust of many of them. This is why he is hired for private services during long periods of time. His charisma and joy are his main tools for working through the day and having a better relation with his passengers. What he likes about his job is that he owns his time, because he mainly works when the demand is higher: when schools and workplaces start their activities. The rest of the day, he drives around the different streets in the city.

He is doing well, because he owns the mototaxi, so he does not have to pay for hiring it. His plan for the future is to buy two additional mototaxis, in order to expand his fleet and to be able to hire them. This is his sixth loan with MFP, so he is very thankful with all the people that keep trusting him in order to be able to get this new loan, which will help him to increase his working capital.

With the requested amount, 2000 soles [PEN], he will buy some spare parts and he will get his mototaxi repaired. The remaining money, will be used to pay an installment for a new mototaxi.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories and to partially pay another vehicle.

loans.name: Gerbacio

texts.es:
Gerbacio tiene 44 años, está casado con la Sra. Nelly quien es  docente, tienen 4  hijos, todos menores de edad,  es de la ciudad  de Paraguarí.
Gerbacio es docente hace 12 años, enseña en varias instituciones y tiene una casa de material de construcción, el cual es el negocio que ayuda con los gastos de la casa, tiene muy buena clientela porque siempre tiene de todo en su negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, para poder abastecer su depósito, y de esa forma dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gerbacio is 44 years old. He is married to Nelly, who is a teacher. They have 4 children, all of them underage. Gerbacio is from the city of Paraguarí.

Gerbacio has been a teacher for 12 years. He teaches in various institutions and has a business selling construction materials. This business helps with the household expenses. He has good customers because he offers everything at his business. 

He is asking for the loan to buy construction materials to stock his business and in this way give his customers good service.

loans.use: to buy constructio nmaterials to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Meet 24-year-old Elizabeth from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married and a mother with one child aged 4 years old.  She has two additional dependents at home. In 2007, Elizabeth established her general merchandise business at Waterloo market. She began her business because her parents forced her to marriage at an early age without her completing her secondary school education. She works at the business 11 hours a day and 7 days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is transporting the goods from the purchasing place to her store. 

Elizabeth requires a loan in order to buy different kinds of general stock items like rice, salt and oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to give her child a quality education and improve her standard of living. In the future, Elizabeth plans to have her own transport facility for her business and open another store. She thanks you for your support.

The woman featured in the video is the credit officer for Elizabeth's loan.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Elizabeth from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy different kinds of general stock items like rice, salt and oil.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Massah from Kandeh town in the southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 9 years and 11 years .Her children are currently attending school. Since 2005, Massah has been in her bar and restaurant shop. She began her business because she wanted to raise income to support her children. She works at the business every day, 15 hours a day.  Her business hardships are insufficient power supply and a permanent business location.

Massah requires a loan in order to buy more soft drinks and stout. Her personal goal is to educate her children, build a permanent home and improve herself while her business goals are to build a permanent entertainment hall and increase her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and stout.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en: Nisreen is a 38-year-old married woman from Sahab, Jordan, who has 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to buy new furniture and to do maintenance on her home. In the future, she wants to repaint her home to create a comfortable space.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Joan

texts.es:
Joan, de 41 años, es un hombre dinámico y emprendedor, convive con su pareja y juntos tienen dos hijos de 20 y 17 años. unidos habitan en su casa propia que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. El trabajo de Joan consiste en la elaboración de perfumes artesanales. Para cumplir con esta función necesita contar con determinados ingredientes como raíces, hojas y flores de distintas plantas de la región que él considera “místicas” además de algunas esencias fragantes de otros elementos como capulí o canela. Realiza estos perfumes únicamente a pedidos previos por sus clientes, asimismo realiza baños curativos con hojas de plantas medicinales los cuales curan diversas enfermedades o mejoran el ánimo de quien se somete a este tratamiento. Sus servicios son muy bien remunerados, incluso lo solicitan en algunas ciudades hasta donde se traslada en cualquier época del año. La presentación de sus perfume lo hace e botellas de 1 litro previamente sellados y vendidos en cajas muy vistosas. Lleva en este negocio más de 20 años y le va muy bien trabajando solo. Le gusta todo de su trabajo ya que desde muy pequeño vio como lo realizaban sus abuelos y poco a poco el también fue aprendiendo, además trabaja muy tranquilo sin gastar mucho y recibiendo buenas ganancias, espera poder seguir creciendo poco a poco con su trabajo. Este es el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, siempre se caracterizó dentro de su grupo como una persona muy puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas y está seguro que esta vez no será la excepción, está muy contento y agradecido por el apoyo que le están brindando para multiplicar su inversión, está muy comprometido con el grupo al que pertenece y espera seguir trabajando junto a ellos.
Con el monto solicitado 600 soles, comprará raíces, flores y hojas de diversas plantas para elaborar los perfumes que vende, además comprará botellas y cajas para la presentación de su producto.
texts.en:
Joan is 41 years old. He is a dynamic and enterprising man. He lives with his spouse and together they have two children, aged 20 and 17. They live in the home they own that he was able to buy with much hard work and sacrifice. Joan's work is making artisanal perfumes. To do this he needs to have certain ingredients such as roots, leaves and flowers from different plants from the region that he considers mystical. Also, some essential fragrances from  other elements such as capulí or cinnamon. He makes these perfumes only to order from his customers. He also does curative baths with leaves from medicinal plants which cure different diseases or improve the spirits of the person who undergoes the treatment. His services are well paid. He is even sought after in other cities where he goes at any time of the year. He sells his perfumes in 1 liter bottles seales and sold in attractive boxes. He has had this business for more than 20 years and it is going very well for him working alone. He likes everything about his job because when he was young he saw how his grandparents did it and little by little he learned how. He works calmly without a lot of expenses and makes good income. He hopes to be able to keep growing little by little with his work. This is loan number 3 with MFP. He has always been described in his group as a person who pays on time and responisbly. He is certain this time will be no exceptino. He is very happy and grateful for the support that is being given to him to multiply his investment. He is very committed to the group he belongs to and hopes to keep working with them.

With the amount of 600 soles that he has asked for he will buy roots, flowers and leaves from different plants to make the perfumes he sells. He will also buy bottles and boxes to present his product in.

loans.use: to buy roots, flowers and leaves from different plants to make the perfumes she sells.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She buys & sells bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from banana farming and motorcycle transport. Melanie is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of banana to sell.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of banana to sell

loans.name: Abdulia       K

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Abdulia from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 1 year and 20 years. Two of his children are currently attending school. In 1991 Abdulia established his general store business in Waterloo. He began his business because he needed to have a permanent source of income to educate his children and support the home. He works at the business every day, 12 hours a day. He has more sales on occasion, 7 days per week. He says that the main challenges to his business are price inflation and transportation from the place of purchase to his store   .

Abdulia requires a loan in order to buy more bags of rice, flour and create soft drinks. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve their standard of living and educate his children. In the future, Abdulia plans to become a distributor. He thanks you for your support.


Update from Abdulia, The woman featured in the video is the credit officer for Abdulia loan.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Abdulia       K from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, flour and create soft drinks.

loans.name: Abdulia

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Abdulia from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is a father of one child, aged 3 years. He also has two additional dependents at home. He began this business because there is no medical center within the community. 

Abdulia runs a pharmacy store at Waterloo. He sells "blood syrup", malaria drugs, injections and tablets. He has been running this business for 7 years. He works at the business 12 hours per day, and 6 days per week.   His business is the only income he has. He says that the main challenges to his business are the drugs sometimes  expiring and transportation problem.

Abdulia has requested a loan in order to buy more drugs like "blood syrup", malaria drugs, injections and tablets. The extra income from this loan will allow him to send his child to private school and to improve his business. In the future, he plans to employ staff and open another branch. He appreciates your support. 

Update on Abdulia, The woman featured in the video is the credit officer for Abdulia's loan.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Abdulia from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more drugs like "blood syrup", malaria drugs, injections and tablets.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
Alie is 37 years old and married with four children, aged 1 year old to 17 years old. He runs a local food store at Waterloo within a busy market area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. Two of his children are currently attending school. He was a student but he had no family to support him so he decided to move into business.

He's been in this business over 10 years and sells palm oil, 'gari' (cassava couscous), groundnuts and beans at a store in his store. His business is the only income he has. He describes his major problem as shortage of local food and poor road networks in the village he uses to buy stock.  

 He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more goods like palm oil, 'gari', groundnuts and beans. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him to change his family's living conditions and also educate his children. In the future, he would like to be a supplier and build his own shop. He is grateful for your support.

Update from Alie, The woman featured in the video is the credit officer for Alie's loan.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Alie from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more goods like palm oil, 'gari', groundnuts and beans.

loans.name: Atico

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 34-year-old Atico from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He is married with two children, aged 3 months and 10 years old. One of his children attends school. 

Atico runs a general merchandise store;   he sells rice, onions, tomatoes and flour. He has been running this business for 12 years. He works at the business every day, 7 days per week. He came from a poor home. His business is the only source of income he has. Atico says that the main challenges to his business are insufficient capital to run his business and transportation problems from town to Waterloo.

Atico has requested a loan in order to buy more foods to sell such as onions, rice, flour and vegetable oil. The extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his child and expand his business. In the future, he plans to become a supplier. He thanks you for your support!

Update from Atico, The woman in the video is the credit officer for Atico's loan.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Atico from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more foods to sell such as onions, rice, flour and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es:
Lelis, de 42 años, es una mujer alegre y muy responsable, convive con su pareja y juntos tienen dos hijos mayores de edad. unidos habitan en su casa propia. Ellos se esfuerzan al máximo para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. El trabajo de Lelis consiste en la venta de golosinas como galletas, cereales, caramelos entre otros y de jugos envasados y naturales que prepara con las más ricas frutas de la región como papaya, piña y naranja. Todos los días vende desde muy temprano en la vereda de su casa en donde tiene instalado un puesto de ventas, su negocio es muy rentable gracias a que su vivienda está cerca a un jardín de niños y a un colegio los cuales se convierten en grandes aliados a la hora de vender, ya que muchas madres desean que sus hijos tomen un refrescante jugo para iniciar la mañana e ir a estudiar contentos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disponer de su tiempo cuando ella desea ya que es independiente y ella misma acondiciona sus días de trabajo de acuerdo a sus necesidades, así puede estar al lado de su familia y cumplir con las labores de su hogar. Con el paso del tiempo espera establecer un negocio formal en donde pueda trabajar con mayor comodidad. Este es el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP agradece a todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera, que es un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará mas frutas de temporada como naranja, piña, papaya y guanábana para seguir vendiendo refrescantes jugos y también comprará golosinas como galletas, caramelos entre otros.
texts.en:
Lelis is 42 years old. She is a cheerful and very responsible woman. She lives with her spouse and together they have two grown children. They live together in the home they own. They work very hard to offer their children a better quality of life. Lelis's work is selling snacks such as cookies, cereals, candies and more as well as bottled and fresh juice. She makes the fresh juice from delicious regional fruit such as papaya, pineapple and oranges. She sells everyday starting very early from the sidewalk in front of her house where she has a sales stand. Her business is very profitable because her house is close to a preschool and a high school. These become great allies when it comes time to sell. A lot of mothers want their children to drink refreshing juice to start their morning and study happily. What she likes about her job is that she can use her time as she likes because she is independent and she organizes her days according to what she needs. This way, she can be with her family and do the housework. Over time, she hopes to establish a formal business where she can work more comfortably. This is loan number 5 with the MFP institution. She is thankful to everyone who made this loan possible since this way she feels confident she can go forward in her business. She also likes her communal bank because she considers it to be a united and supportive group.

With the amount of 1,200 soles that she has asked for, she will buy more fruit in season such as oranges, pineapple, papaya and guanábana to keep selling refreshing juices and buy snacks such as cookies, candies and more.

loans.use: to buy fruit in season, such as oranges, pineapples, papaya and guanábana to keep selling refreshing juices. She will also include snacks such as cookies, candies and more.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell. She wants to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is a single mother with five (5) children.  Three (3) of the children are in school.  She has no additional family members.  It is ten (10) years since she started running a business of selling fruits and vegetables on a retail basis in the market.  She has another source of income from selling charcoal.  She works seven days a week.  

She owns a house where she stays.  She has no access to electricity or to piped water.  The greatest expenses Grace has are school fees and feeding the family.

Grace has requested a loan of Shs. 2,000,000 from MCDT SACCO.  She wants to buy charcoal and foodstuffs to sell like sweet potatoes, cassava and fresh beans.  Her business challenge is transporting charcoal and the food from the villages to the market. Her goal is to buy land and build a home.  She says she decided to work with MCDT SACCO because she gets loans in time.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and more foodstuffs like sweet potatoes, cassava and fresh beans.

loans.name: Mehbara

texts.en:
Mehbara is a 57-year-old mother with 3 sons in her care. She lives in her own house with her husband and children. She works at raising and selling small livestock such as sheep, and she has 20 years of experience with this work. For this purpose, she has constructed appropriate and spacious pens to raise her animals more effectively. When the animals reach the ideal size and weight, she sells them at the local market. 

Mehbara requested a loan from AqroInvest for 1,500 AZN, which she will use to buy small livestock to raise, as well as balanced feed for her sheep. In this way, she will achieve better development and will be able to sell them for a better price. 

She is a person who is very well-known and respected by the inhabitants of the area where she lives. The people who know her consider her a good-natured and very responsible person.

loans.use: to buy small livestock to raise.

loans.name: Qablah

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Qablah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, so the above photo is of her son. Qablah is a 57-year-old widow woman from Nao'or, Jordan, who has 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy materials for cheese and yogurt making to resell. She would like to expand her project. In the future she hopes to open a factory for making a cheeses and yogurt to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy materials for cheese and yogurt making.

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn is 52 years old and lives in Catarman, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 3 children. 

Alyn has a clothing business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase materials like thread and cloth, as well as labor.

Alyn has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Alyn hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase materials like thread and cloth, as well as labor

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is a female head of a family who provides for her household from her two-hectare area of rice-farming. She has three children who are still in school, and her entire family is living in the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. She has engaged in this business for two years. Her main challenge is flooding and pests which reduce her crop production. 

She has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has paid back with success. She has wisely managed her past loans to attain a better standard of living for her family. Satisfied with the past loan results, she wants to keep supporting her business and maintain this condition. Therefore, she formed a group of two to seek a new loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop. She hopes this purchase will double her yield and get her a high profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Sokna's Group

texts.en:
A mother of three children, Sokna is 44 years old and a citizen from Kampong Cham province's Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. For sustenance in her family, she grows rice with support from her husband as the main source of income. Additionally, she also runs a small food stall and works for others for a fee as extra income. With 20 years of experience in her business, she can earn about 23,000 KHR per day. 

Her first loan with VisionFund was in 2008 and this is her fifth-cycle loan. After the successful past loan that she has completely paid back, she has managed to buy a cow and additional farmland for supporting her rice-cropping business. 

Now, she has formed a group of two to seek a new loan. Her requesting amount is 1,400,000 KHR and her co-member is applying for 1,100,000 KHR. As a group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy additional cows for supporting her farmland. She hopes to earn more income so she can keep a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy additional cows for supporting her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Davgadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Davgadorj is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Tosontsengel, Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Handarmaa, is a secondary school teacher. Davgadorj has been operating his transportation business within the province with his brother. They built a 60 square meter house from their profits for his brother and his newly wedded wife. 

Davgadorj is planning to start his own transportation service back and forth to the capital city and his province. His estimated profit will be enough to cover his family's expenses and make his dream of building his own house for his family come true. He also grows vegetables, and this year he harvested 1.5 tons. He is a modest, helpful and hardworking man. He is requesting 4,600,000 MNT to buy a big truck to start his transportation service business back and forth to the capital city and his town.

loans.use: to purchase a big truck to start his own transportation service business

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn has been six years in a business of buying and selling fruits and vegetables. During those years, she had many hardships in achieving a good income. Now she wants to achieve a better living as well as to save for the schooling of her four children. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to use in her business. She could purchase more eggplant, squash and bananas. She hopes for your kind help to approve her loan.

loans.use: to purchase more eggplant, squash and bananas.

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en:
A rural citizen from the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, Sokhim is married and a 33-year-old mother of two children who are still in school. Together with her husband, she raises pigs, produces rice wine and provides a laundry service in order to cover her cost of daily living. She has been with this business for 10 years. Sokhim is a third-time borrower while her group member is a second-time borrower with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. 

Sokhim used her past loan in a smart manner to provide better support for her business and her family. Now she is the leader in her group of two. She is applying for 1,400,000 KHR and her co-member is seeking 1,200,000 KHR. For her portion, she is going to buy additional piglets for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs to a healthy condition so that she can sell at a high price and earn more income, so she can save some money to build a new house and expand her business gradually.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets for raising.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Soklay's Group

texts.en:
Soklay is a 27-year-old farmer who strives for a living through cassava growing. She is married and also a mother of one son, and is originally from the Dambae district of Cambodia. For the 5 years that she has been involved in this business, she can earn about 18,000 KHR per day. Soklay has been with VisionFund for the past three-cycle loans. She has used her loans with success in maintaining her household gradually. 

Now, she has formed a group of two-- her group member just joined VisionFund this cycle. The total loan amount for her group is 1,900,000 KHR. As a group leader, she is going to use her portion (1,400,000KHR) to buy fertilizer, insecticide and to pay labor fees. She hopes to gain more yield so that with the high price of her cassava, she can double her income for her family's sake.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Nellah

texts.en:
Nellah, aged 39, is the mother of four children. She is married and lives at West Point. Her children are between the ages of 4 and 22.  Two of the children  are attending school while the other two children are working.

For the past three years she has been selling soft drinks. She makes a profit when she sells because her soft drinks are always cold to quench the thirst of her customers, especially during the dry season. She also used the profit to assist her husband with the household expenses.

She has requested a loan to purchase more soft drinks for the business.  Her plan is to build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for the business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 30 years old. She lives in the Telavi District with her husband, Shalva, her 3-year-old daughter and her mother-in-law. Marina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is a small income of Shalva, taking wood from the forest and selling it in their village. It makes a total of 200 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for a four-member family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Marina requested a loan from Credo to re-start-up the family business, which was stopped recently because of financial problems. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Marina will purchase sheep. The family will breed sheep and sell lambs at a good price. This will increase the family income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and start an animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Lamia'a

texts.en: Lamia'a is an 18-year-old married woman from Sahab, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and some household items. She hopes in the future to repaint her home to improve her living standard. Since Lamia'a is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros, age 46, is operating a sari-sari store. Her problem is that she does not have enough funds to add more groceries to her store. For this reason, she is seeking a loan amount of PHP 13,000 to buy canned goods, cupcakes, biscuits, coffee, sugar, vinegar and oil so she can meet her customers’ requests. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and the number of her customers. She always hopes to offer the best product to her customers because this is a great way to gain their loyalty. Milagros hopes to be granted her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, cupcakes, biscuits, coffee, sugar, vinegar and oil

loans.name: Dolzodmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dolzodmaa lives with her husband, her mother and two children in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic felt housing tent) in Niseh district, Mongolia. Her husband, Ganbuureg, is 45 years old. He manages his private business. Her older daughter, Zolzaya, is 18 years old. She is a college student. Her son, Khansuren, is 8 years old. He is a secondary school student. Her mother, Tsendsuren, is 76 years old.

Mrs.Dolzodmaa graduated with a bachelor degree in clothing design and sewing from a Kirgiz university in 1992. She worked as a dressmaker in a private company for 15 years.  She started her business in 2009 to make bed sheets, blankets and cages. She has started producing felt blankets for insulating gers. She is well experienced within the industry. She is a hardworking and helpful woman.

She needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a raw materials for her business expansion of felt blanket production.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her business expansion of felt blanket production

loans.name: Lice

texts.es: Lice, de 47 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, esta casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija de 22 años, quien es una mujer profesional gracias al apoyo constante e incondicional que le brindaron sus padres. Lice se siente orgullosa de su familia y muy feliz por todos los logros que ha tenido en los últimos años. El trabajo de Lice consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi. Tiene un vehículo que pudo obtener gracias a créditos anteriores que le brindó la institución complementado con algunos ahorros que acumuló por cierto tiempo. Tiene un chofer experimentado que diariamente acude a su casa para recibir el vehículo en el que trabaja por las calles de la ciudad. Lleva en esta actividad más de 4 años y le va muy bien por que tiene un ingreso fijo diario que le ayudan a sobrellevar los gastos básicos de su hogar. Complementa esta actividad con la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años con la ayuda de su hija. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede organizar su tiempo y disponer de sus ratos libre como ella lo considere, afirma que de esta forma cumple su rol de madre y mujer de manera óptima, ya que se siente una mujer capaz e independiente. Espera continuar trabajando y desarrollando sus funciones a cabalidad. Su gran deseo es establecer un negocio formal y de mayor productividad en su propia casa orientada al sector alimenticio.  Este es el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, podrá montar su tienda de abarrotes, comprando productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Lice, 47 years old, is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married and lives in her own house with her husband and their 22-year-old daughter, who is also a professional, thanks to the unconditional love and support of her parents. Lice is proud of her family and happy about all of the success they've had in the last few years. 
Lice works renting a motortaxi. She owns a vehicle that she was able to buy with combination of previous loans and money she had been saving for years. She also has an experienced driver who arrives are her house each day to pick up that vehicle, which he uses to work in the city streets. She has been renting this motortaxi for over 4 years now and it has gone very well for her because she has a fixed daily income the helps her family to pay their basic household expenses. Lice has been supplementing this income by also selling clothing for the last three years with the help of her daughter. What she likes about her job is that she can organize her time and make herself available when she needs to attend to something else. This allows her to fulfill her responsibilities as a mother and wife, while remaining a capable and independent woman. Lice hopes to continue in this way to work and at the same time fully attend to her responsibilities at home. 
Her biggest dream is to establish a formal, productive business out of her own home and break into food sales. This is Lice's third loan from the MFP institution. She is very thankful to everyone who has made this financing possible to help her achieve her goals. Lice feels very comfortable with her communal bank and knows its members to be responsible and supportive people. With the 1000 soles she is requesting, Lice will be able to set up her grocery store and buy staple food items.

loans.use: to buy staple food items.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 49 years old, married and has 4 children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a sari-sari (convenience) store business and has been operating for 30 long years.

Merlita is asking a loan of 9,000 PHP through ASKI to purchase more groceries such as snack foods, noodles, breads and spices. The more stock of groceries she has, the more sales she could earn. She hopes that through this loan, plus her hard work, she could earn more profit for the success of her business as well as for their living.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as snack foods, noodles, breads and spices

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en:
Vuqar is young single man. He is an honest and kind person. He is involved in buying and selling food products. He owns a store in a well-populated location of the city center of Agsu city. He sells candies, cookies, juices, drinks, etc. Vuqar always tries to satisfy the demands of his customers.

He wants to expand his business and add a new assortment of food products. Vuqar requested a loan in the sum of 1,000 AZN for the purchase of a new assortment of food products. He thanks all of you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of food products

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu, age 35, resides with her husband at West Point. She has three children who are between the ages of 3 and 19. All of them are currently in school. 

Musu has been involved in her own business for the past 15 years. She has a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells food six days a week. She prepares fufu, soup, potatoes, grains and cassava to meet the demands of her customers. Because of the good service that she renders, her customers prefer her cook shop to other cook shops.  

Musu has requested a loan to purchase more ingredients to meet the demands of her customers. Her plan is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to  purchase more ingredients to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, con visión de negocio y muy trabajadora, casada y madre de dos hijos ya  mayores de edad. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo de Lita, consiste en el alquiler de vehículos de transporte público. Tiene 4 mototaxis los cuales alquila diariamente a sus choferes que acuden a su vivienda para solicitar la herramienta de trabajo. Recibe un pago por bridar este servicio y las ganancias que percibe le permiten cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Algunas veces son sus hijos o hermanos quienes conducen los vehículos y en ocasiones amistades. Todos sus vehículos están en buen estado aunque la documentación de dos de ellos ya está por vencerse. Lleva en esta actividad más de 10 años y empezó desde cero, poniéndole siempre optimismo y mucho ahínco a todo lo que hace. Eventualmente complementa esta actividad trabajando con la ayuda de su hijo en la venta de pescados que envía a otras ciudades. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede compartir el tiempo a lado de su familia y dedicarse a otras actividades de su hogar, además de poder generar ingresos económicos que necesita para enfrentar el día a día en su vivienda, le va bien hasta ahora, espera poder seguir así para que  flota de vehículos se incremente. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además está convencida que seguirá siendo la socia buena y responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente, le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará el seguro contra accidente para dos mototaxis y renovará alguna piezas y repuestos de uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Lita, 47, is an enterprising, hard-working woman with a good vision for business. She is married and has two adult children. They all live together in their own house.

Lita's business consists of a public-transport vehicles rental. She has four mototaxis, which she rents out everyday to drivers that come to her house looking for a means to work. She gets paid for this service and the profits make it possible for her to cover the basic needs at home. Sometimes, it is her children or siblings who drive the vehicles, and sometimes friends. All her vehicles are in good shape. However, the legal documents of two of them are close to their expiration date.

She has been working in this line of work for ten years, and she started from scratch, with optimism and commitment in everything she does. Sometimes, she complements this activity, with her son's help, selling fish that she sends to other cities. What she likes about her job is that she has time left to spend close to her family and to take care of the household chores. Besides, the economic income she generates makes it possible to cover everyday needs at home. 

She is doing well so far. She hopes to continue this way, so that her vehicle fleet increases in number. This is the second loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she has the financial support needed in order to continue increasing her workng capital. Besides, she is convinced that she will continue to be a good and responsible member, as with the previously obtained loans. She likes to be part of the communal bank in which she works, because everyone is responsible and solidary to each other.

With the requested amount, 1000 soles [PEN], she willl buy the accident insurance policies needed for two mototaxis and she will change some components and spare parts in one of them.

loans.use: to pay for an accident insurance policy and to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Twiyubake Ii Group

texts.fr:
Espérance fait partie du groupe  Twiyubake II et  habite à Ngozi. Elle a 25 ans et mariée à J.Pierre, un commerçant de boutique. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants, le cadet a 2 ans et l’aîné a 6 ans. 

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique depuis  7ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  des articles de sa boutique (maïs, pomme de terre, haricot,…) à  revendre,  pour gagner plus. 

 Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter  des terres cultivables, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Espérance is a member of the Twiyubake II group and lives in Ngozi. She is 25 years old and married to J. Pierre, a salesman of boutiques. They have two children aged 2 and 6 years old. She has been selling products from her store for the past 7 years. This is her first request for a laon from Turame. She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise to sell in her store (maize, potatoes, beans, etc) that she will re-sell. She hopes in the future to purchase farm land and see her children attend school.

loans.use: purchase articles to sell in her boutique (maize, potatoes, beans, etc)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 54 años, es una mujer encantadora, muy alegre. Es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Ambos laboran para ofrecerles educación y alimentación a sus hijos. El trabajo de Carmen consiste en la venta de ropa y productos por catálogos, este trabajo lo realiza hace 11 años en el interior de su casa. Cuando no hay muchos clientes durante el día, sale a vender sus productos por la calle entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, además en algunas ocasiones se va a los centros poblados ribereños en donde intercambia por algunos productos que posteriormente vende en los mercados o en su barrio. Ahora quiere incursionar en la venta de abarrotes ya que en su barrio no hay ninguna tienda y ha visto la posibilidad de mejorar sus ingresos. A Carmen le encanta su trabajo, le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, su alegría y picardía le permite atraer clientes continuamente. En el futuro desea establecer una tienda de exhibición de prendas de vestir mejor implementada, ya que ha pensado dedicarse por completo a su trabajo con la venta de ropas sin descuidar sus actividades del hogar. Este es el préstamo número 16 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de saber que le brindan el acceso a una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para continuar en el futuro. Asegura que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo responsable  y unido.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará ropas para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Carmen, 54 yearls old, is an enchanting woman, very joyful. She lives together with her partner, with which she has two adult and independent children, who work in order to given their children education and food. Carmen's work consists of selling clothes and products on catalogues. She has been doing this for eleven years now at her house.

When there are not many customers during the day, she goes out and sells her products among friends, neighbors and relatives. She also goes sometimes to some villages close to the river, where she exchanges some products that she sells later on, either at the market or in her neighborhood. She now wants to start selling groceries, because in her neighborhood there are no shops and she has seen the opportunity to improve her income. 

Carmen loves her job. She likes to have contact with people, and her joy and cleverness make it easy for her to continuously attract customers. In the future she wants to open a shop where she can display the garments more properly, since she has been thinking of selling clothes full time, although leaving time for the household chores.

This is her sixteenth loan with MFP. She feels happy of knowing that she has access to a line of credit with which she can progress with her business. This is why she promises to be responsible with the installments' payment so she can continue in the future. She mentions that she likes her communal bank's work, and that she considers it a responsible and united group.

With the requested amount, 2000 soles [PEN], she will buy clothes in order to sell them.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Gaanjuur

texts.en:
Mr. Gaanjuur is 30 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a little house in the Niseh district of Ulaanbaatar. His wife helps him with his business. He has been working as an assistant at a retail stall for three years and now he owns a clothes retail store in the trading center. He chose to open his retail store there because this trading center is located in the center of the city. 

Mr. Gaanjuur has many customers from his previous store he used to work at. He is very experienced in this business sector. 

Mr. Gaanjuur's goal is to expand his business to generate enough money to cover his family's expenses and save some money for his daughter's future. He is a diligent man who says, "Today's hard work pays for tomorrow." He is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase insulation materials for his house to prepare for the harsh Mongolian winter.

loans.use: To purchase insulation materials for his house.

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en:
Nizar is a 24-year-old single man. For the past two years, Nizar's father has had a store where he sells hand and wall clocks to customers. Nizar works in the store with his father, which has been a profitable project. However, he also needs more support to cover his costs.

Nizar is requesting a $1,000 youth loan from FATEN to share the costs with his father of purchasing hand and wall clocks to provide a better selection to their loyal customers. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Nizar is photographed in the store.

loans.use: To purchase wall and hand clocks for sale.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is from the Gurjaani district in the Kakheti region. She is 60 years old and lives with her son and daughter-in-law. Her daughter-in-law has an income from commercial space rental. Makvala runs a small dairy farm and produces cheese, which is sold in her village and nearby villages. She purchases foodstuffs and miscellaneous household items in the wholesale market in Tbilisi (capital of Georgia) and sells them in the village. Makvala works hard to save some of her earnings and improve her living conditions.

With the requested loan, Makvala will purchase turkeys and maize to feed them. She will raise turkeys and sell them in the new year at a good price. A turkey is the main ingredient for the Georgian traditional new year’s meal, Satsivi. This will increase the family's income and all members will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase turkeys and maize to feed them.

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1982 à Bamako, Madame Kadidiatou est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Kamalen Sirakoro, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso.   
Madame Kadidiatou mène cette activité d’achat et de vente des vêtements “friperie” il y a environ trois ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commande surtout en saison froide. Ainsi, elle décida il y environ deux années d’adhérer au programme de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel commerçant, les 2 prêt précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle compte acheter avec ce 3ème prêt  4 balles de friperies de qualités différentes (Pull-over, T-shirt, Chemises et Chaussettes) auprès des grossistes. Elle les revendre de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée généralement des chefs de famille de sa localité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 190 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Kadidiatou was born around 1982 in Bamako. She is a married woman and mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in Kamalen Sirakoro, a peripheral neighborhood of the city of Sikasso.

Kadidiatou has been buying and selling used clothing for about three years now. She has a strong reputation in this line of business and receives lots of orders, especially in the cold season. So, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso program about two years ago. This is her third individual loan through Soro Yiriwaso. The two previous loans were both correctly repaid. With this third loan, she plans to buy 4 bales of various types of used clothing (sweaters, T-shirts, shirts, and socks) from wholesalers. She travels around, reselling her goods to a clientele made up of mostly heads of families in her town.

With this loan, she plans to earn a monthly profit of 190,000 FCFA, which she will mainly put towards family expenses and paying off the interest of her loan. She will invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is 26 years old, a vigorous, married woman who lives in the town of Raiwind. 

She has been in the business of hand embroidery for the past five years. She began during a time when her husband’s income was not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of his family. She took initiative and started doing the work of hand embroidery. 

She makes beautiful embroidery patterns for the people of her community. Through all her hard efforts she is able to contribute to the family income to support her family well.

She is a dedicated mother of three children. She needs to fulfill the basic necessities of life such as food, clothing and education. For this she requires growing her business and requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. 

Amjad hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en:
Gansuh is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small house in Niseh district, Mongolia. Her husband, Naranmandah, works as a security officer in a private company. Her son, Tsagaantogoo, is 22 years old. He is a disabled. Her daughter, Otgontogoo, is 20 years old. She studies in a university. 

Gansuh started her business in 1994 to make traditional children's shoes. Shoemaking is a skill she picked up from working in a shoe factory. 

She is planning to repair her own house. She is asking 2,500,000 MNT to buy vacuum windows and a smokeless stove in order to be warm during the harsh winters in Mongolia.

loans.use: To buy vacuum windows and a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh, 21, is single, a worker with a low salary that is not enough to cover the his costs and expenses. 
Hamzeh is studying at the university, specializing in accounting. He wants to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover them. This will ensure a better future for Hamzeh and improve his living conditions. Hamzeh's photograph appears above.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Annetta

texts.en:
Annetta D., 32, graduated from high school, but did not further her education. She is married and has three children, age 1 to 16, who are currently in school.  

She has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) for the past four years. She started the business with the initial capital that she received from her husband. She sells different kinds of food every day. She prepares palm butter, palava, potatoes, grains, and cassava leaves to meet the demands of her  customers and render good services to them. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more ingredients and increase her sales. Her plan is to give her children a higher level of education since she herself did not complete her education.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients and increase her sales.

loans.name: Intahemuka Group

texts.fr:
Joachin fait partie du groupe  Intahemuka et  habite à Ngozi. Il a 42 ans et est marié à Hasfa,une cultivatrice. Il  a 5 enfants, âgés de 2 à 15 ans, dont  3 étudient.
Il prend soin d’un enfant qui étudie.

Il  fait le commerce de légumes, de bananes, de tomates,… depuis  10 ans. 

Il est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes, de légumes, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  avoir des  champs à cultiver et avoir un habitat décent. Il voudrait en outre voir ses enfants étudier et terminer les études.
texts.en:
Joachin is a member of the Intahemuka group and lives in Ngozi. He is 42 years old and married to Hasfa, a tiller. He has five children aged 2 to 15 years old, three of whom attend school. He is also responsible for caring for another child who attends school.
Joachin has been selling vegetables, bananas, tomatoes, etc, for the past decade. He is asking for his twelfth loan from Turame. This loan will allow him to purchase a large quantity of food products to re-sell. In the future, he homes to own farm land and proper home. He would also like to see his children attend and finish school.

loans.use: purchase a large quantity of bananas and vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 30 years old, a vigorous, married woman. The woman shown with covered face in the photo is Sajida as she usually uses a veil in front of men. 

She has been doing a business of hand embroidery for the past two years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. 

Before starting her business, their family situation was not very good. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well. It forced her to initiate her own business in order to bear the burden of daily expenses with her husband. 

Sajida’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. To help her to continue operations, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy more frames, reels of threads and dozens of pearls and sequins to accomplish her orders beautifully on time. 

In addition to repaying the loan, Sajida will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy more frames, reels of threads and dozens of pearls and sequins to accomplish her orders beautifully on time.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Haneen prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Haneen is a 22-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture such as bedrooms, guest room and living room. 

In the past, she was selling a clothes for her friends. In the future, she wants to do maintenance and repainting her home to provide a good environment to live in.

Since Haneen is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fall/winter used clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Athab

texts.en: For cultural reasons, Athab prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet. The above photo is of her mother. Athab, 32, is a married woman from Madaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy foodstuffs to sell in her small store. She would like to increase her product offerings by expanding her store. Athab started her business some years ago, selling a small variety of products. In the future she hopes to start a project to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell in her small store.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra  is a 41-year-old active, married woman.  

She has been excellently doing the work of hand embroidery at her home for the last five years. She has exceptional skills for doing it. She has gotten a lot of admiration from her community members. The demand for her collection is increasing day by day, and she is contributing to the family income. 

Her husband is employed in a small bicycle repair shop and one of her sons operates a food cart. However, their income is very unpredictable and not enough to cover everyday expenditures. 

She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors to meet the increasing demand of her embroidery designs as her customer base is varied and diverse.  

She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of threads in different colors for her embroidery.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Raiwind. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She has been doing the work of stitching for many years and is a well known tailor in her community. She stitches clothes for ladies, gents and children. The number of her customers is increasing day by day.  

She has requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy reels of threads and packs of buttons in different colors to complete the orders on time. She is hopeful to earn more by fulfilling the demands of her customers consistently. 

According to Zareena, she is very satisfied with the support of Kashf foundation. She shared that she always advises others to use their loans in a productive manner that ultimately generates more cash to support their families well.

loans.use: To buy reels of threads and packs of buttons in different colors to complete the orders on time.

loans.name: Diqqat

texts.en:
Diqqat is a 56-year-old father and husband, who is devoted to his three children and his wife. Fifteen years ago, he decided to go into business for himself and opened a small grocery store near his home in Agsu. His business has grown and provides his customers with a tremendous variety of high quality goods. Diqqat and his wife are very attentive and offer such a wide range of goods that they have won over their customers.

This is the first time Diqqat is applying for a loan with AqroInvest and Kiva. He will be using the loan to buy groceries and beverages to expand his product inventory. Diqqat expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. He is very thankful and promises to pay his loan back responsibly.

loans.use: to buy groceries and beverages for his store.

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaikhan is 45 years old and lives with his three children and his wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. His two older children are university students and his younger daughter is a secondary school student. His wife helps his business. 

Jargalsaikhan started to drive a taxi at their local hometown in 2008. He is planning to expand his business in the future and he purchased a mini-truck for 8,000,000 MNT for his transportation service business. He is a hardworking, diligent and friendly man who says, "If I take care of my car very well, this will be good source of my family income." 

He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to pay for his two children's university tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay two children's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 36-year-old farmer in Nkubu county In Kenya, where she lives with her husband and one child, who is schooling.

She has been in farming for 10 years, producing fruits and vegetables that she sells to the people around her local area,  She also runs a grocery shop as an additional source of income.

She is requesting aloan of KES 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry.  That will help in increasing her income so she can educate her child and better her standards of living.  She also aspires to start selling cereals in the near future.   Poor prices for farm produce,pests and diseases,high costs of labour are her main challenges in farming.

Faith says Juhudi Kilimo is a very reliable institution when it comes to lending loans.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. He was photographed in his store.

Hala is a 28-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to two sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed, but the low salary he gets is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past two years, Hala's husband also has had a store for selling electrical goods and extensions. The store is located in a busy area and has a lot of loyal customers. This has been a profitable project and the second source of income to the family.

Hala wants to improve her family's living conditions, so she is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing necessary missing items such as electrical goods and extensions. Taking this loan will increase the variety of goods in the store and will meet more customers' demands to purchase their needs, which will increase sales and contribute to improving the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical goods and extensions for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys was born in 1971 and she is married and has five children. She lives in Bamenda North West region of Cameroon with her five children.

She has encountered a good number of challenges in her life. She dropped out of school because there was no money to continue paying for her school fees. Ill health has also been a serious problem in her family, even to the extent of her losing family members. Notwithstanding the above mentioned difficulties, she also suffers from inadequate capital to start and run a small business of her own, which will enable her to pay for her children’s school fees, rents, bills and other things. 

With this loan she intends to buy oil, plantains, potatoes, and cooking ingredients and other small items. Her activity will assist her community by providing them quality food and a relaxation corner.

With the proceed from this loan she will educate her children and pay for her children’s hospital bills, plough back profit and expand her business and increase her savings for difficult days. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the gradual installment payments and the low interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase oil, plantains, potatoes, and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
Melita, de 41 años, es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, convive con su pareja con quien tiene seis hijos de 20, 18, 16, 7, 4 y 1 año de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan  en una casa propia, donde hacen todo lo posible por mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de Melita consiste en la venta de ropas usadas, sus puntos de ventas se ubican en los centros poblados asentados a lo largo del tramo de la carretera principal de la ciudad. En épocas de mayor demanda vende por las comunidades ubicadas en las riberas de los ríos en donde también realiza intercambio de prendas de vestir con animales domésticos los cuales destina luego para su crianza, alimentación o posterior venta. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 11 años y desde que se inició le va muy bien. Sin embargo, la necesidad de cuidar de sus hijos menores le han llevado a pensar en establecer algún negocio que le permita estar todo el día en su casa generando ingresos económicos, es por eso que ahora desea dedicarse al alquiler de videojuegos. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre tiene clientes que necesitan de alguna prenda de vestir, lo que no le gusta es que tiene que viajar por horas transportando pesadas bolsas conteniendo su mercadería, ahora todas sus esperanzas están puestas en la nueva actividad que desea emprender, aunque afirma que de todas maneras continuará vendiendo ropas pero está vez en su casa y para ello necesita contar con una buena infraestructura, para la exhibición de las prendas de vestir. Este es el préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP, siempre se caracterizó dentro de su grupo como una persona responsable, está feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan para poder realizar una buena inversión, además está segura de que seguirá cancelando sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo hasta ahora, esta muy comprometida con el grupo al que pertenece y no desea dejar una mala impresión ni a ellos ni a la institución.
Con el monto solicitado 600 soles, comprará cierta cantidad de prendas de vestir usadas,
texts.en:
Melita, age 41, is an enterprising and responsible woman.  She lives with her life partner and their six children, ages 20, 18, 16, 7, and 4.  They live in their own house, where they do everything possible to improve their quality of life.

Melita sells used clothes at the settlements along the length of the main road in her city.  During the seasons when demand is high, she sells in the communities on the riverbanks, where she also exchanges clothing for domestic animals.  She raises, feeds, and sells the animals.  She has been doing this work for over 11 years.  It has been going very well for her ever since she started.

Nevertheless, the need to care for her minor children has caused her to think about establishing a business that would allow her to be at home all day and to generate income.  That is why she now wishes to rent video games.

What she likes about her work is that she always has customers who need an article of clothing.  What she does not like is having to travel for hours transporting the heavy bags of merchandise.  Now, she is putting all of her hopes in the new business activity that she wishes to undertake.  Although, she confirms that, in any event, she will continue selling clothes.
