However, this time she will sell at her house.  In order to do so she needs to have a good area to display the clothes.

This is her 12th loan with MFP.  She has always been known in her group as a responsible person.  She is happy for the opportunity given to her in order to make a good investment.  Also, she is sure that she will continue making her payments on time, like she has done so far.  She is very committed to the group she belongs to, and she does not want to leave a bad impression with them or the institution.

She will use the requested 600 soles to buy used clothes.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida has a motorcycle, which is her source of income. She is 59 years old and blessed with four children. Her son is the one who travels, but she takes care of repair and maintenance. This is fine with her; her son could not find a better job, because of low educational attainment. She is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy paint and new tires, and to use for repair and maintenance. She hopes that, through this loan, her son will be able to produce more income. Thus, they could improve their poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy paint, new tires and oil for the motorcyle used in her transport business.

loans.name: Ayoub

texts.en:
Ayoub, photographed next to his taxi, is a 25 year old young man. He is married and a father to two sons and one daughter.

For the past seven years, Ayoub has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family. He is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi capacity to work extra hours and enable Ayoub to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for the taxi.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is single and has a rope making business in the Philippines.

Helen has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her rope making. She has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope making.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with five children. Only two of the children are in school.  She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  It is five years since she started a little food stall in the market, selling on a retail basis.  She works seven days a week. She generates additional income through selling charcoal.  

Christine has applied for a loan of  800,000= Uganda shilling from MCDT-SACCO to   buy more charcoal,  cooking oil, baking flour, and cow peas.  Her business challenges are transportation and increasing prices of cooking oil and baking flour.  Her goals and aspirations are to  own a fully stocked stall  and also to buy additional land and build some rooms for renting.  

Christine decided to work with MCDT-SACCO because the interest charges are fair.  She owns the house where she stays. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more  charcoal, cooking oil, baking flour, and cowpeas

loans.name: Totu

texts.ru: Тоту –участница группы «Озгоруш», ей 51 год, вдова, имеет 6 детей. Тоту работает в Службе скорой медицинской помощи и в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Тоту в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова в приплодом, орошаемая земля с картофелем и фасолью, а также придомовой сад с яблонями. В целях развития своего бизнеса, Тоту обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку мелкого рогатого скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Тоту планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Totu is a member of the “Ozgorush” group. She is 51 years old and a widow, with six children. She is an ambulance worker, and, as an additional source of income, raises livestock and grows produce. Thanks to Totu’s hard work, her farm now includes one dairy cow with her young, arable land where she grows potatoes and beans, and also an apple orchard near her house. In order to develop her business further, Totu turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” in the amount of 20,000 KGS in order to buy small livestock for fattening and resale. Totu plans to use the revenues from her loan into expanding the size of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Ms Nargis is a 29 year old married woman. She efficiently runs a beauty parlor in her community. She works hard day and night to make her parlor famous so she may be able to provide for her family a better living standard. 

Ms Nargis is contributing a lot to the income that supports her family. However she is facing difficulties these days to cater all her customers at the same time. So, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy more cosmetics, streamers and a hair dryer. She is hopeful to attend to more clients at the same time, which ultimately will generate more cash for her. She is very thankful to Kashf and Kiva. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, streamers and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four (4) children, three (3) are in school. She also cares for additional family members.  

It has been two years since Mariam started the business of selling cosmetics. She sells by wholesale basis in a shop, six (6) days a week. Mariam has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 to enable her to buy boxes of cosmetics like vaseline, weaves and braids. Her challenges in business are thieves and bad debtors. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business and start another branch. She decided to work with MCDT SACCO because services are brought nearest to the member. Mariam owns her home and she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her greatest monthly expense are school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cosmetics and weaves, braids and vaseline.

loans.name: Myrlina

texts.en:
Myrlina is a 61 year-old widow with 2 children. Myrlina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Myrlina has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming rice and selling dried coconut meat.

Myrlina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery and food items to sell.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Ms Riffat is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory but earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en: Marriam is a 30-year-old single woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy clothes and blankets to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She would like to expand her project in the future to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy clothes and blankets to resell

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsend-Ayush is 42 years old, a widow with two children who lives in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her daughter, Bolorchimeg, is 19 years old. Her son, Boldhet is 14 years old. Her daughter is a college student. Her son is a secondary school student. 

Mrs. Tsend-Ayush started her business in 2002 making leather shoes with two children. She is making a product by order. Now winter is coming and the number of orders has increased. All shoes she produces are made with authentic leather and it is considered organic production. They also are essential to go through the harsh winter of Mongolia. She is a hardworking and responsible person. She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy raw materials and an electric sewing machine in order to increase production of her business

loans.use: To buy raw materials and an electric sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Siyavush

texts.en: Siyavush is 45 years old. He is married with two children. His wife is a housewife. For the past ten years, Siyavush has made a living selling vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, cucumbers, apples, and beans. His eldest son helps Siyavush with the business. He buys vegetables and fruits from the local farmers and sells them in the market. He sells in a market that is known for attractive prices. All this allows Siyavush ’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for his family. Today he is planning to purchase new, fresh fruits and vegetables to sell in order to increase the range of goods he offers. With this goal in mind, he has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. Siyavush has a good credit history with AqroInvest and promises to repay the current loan as promptly as he has done in the past. Siyavush and his family need some help and hope you will become a part of his business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Toktobubu

texts.ru: Токтобубу –участница группы «Озгоруш», ей 64 года, имеет 5 детей. Токтобубу в качестве основного дохода для семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Токтобубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова в приплодом и орошаемая земля с картофелем и фасолью. Месячный доход составляет 1,700 сом (KGS). В целях развития своего бизнеса, Токтобубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойной коровы для увеличении прибыли от продажи молока.  Доходы от кредита Токтобубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Toktobubu is a member of the group "Ozgorush." She is 64 years old and has 5 children. As the main breadwinner of the family, Toktobubu grows crops and raises cattle. Thanks to her persistent hard work, Toktobubu's farm has 1 dairy cow and calf, as well as irrigated land with potatoes and beans. Her monthly income is approximately 1,700 Som (KGS). Toktobubu has now approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS for the purpose of further developing her business. She wants to buy a dairy cow in order to increase her profit from selling milk. Toktobubu plans to use the extra income the loan generates to further increase the number of cows she owns.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ritag Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ritag. It consists of four ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They would like to take out a loan of 190,000 YER.

Jalila is a 36-year-old single woman. She is a tailor. She works hard to help herself in earning a living and providing for her needs. She started her business with a small amount of capital.

Jalila has applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to buy sewing materials for her business. This loan will affect her business greatly. This is why she needs this loan so she can respond to customers' needs quickly. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions and expand her business. 

Note: Jalila is the woman who is holding a book in the photo.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is 50 years old. He lives in Telavi District with his mother and 31-year-old son. Paata requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The source of income for the family is the monthly pension of Paata’s mother. Besides, he owns a vineyard and has a small seasonal income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Paata requested a loan from Credo to re-start the family business, which was stopped because of financial problems. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credit with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the credit received, Paata will purchase pigs and calves to start an animal husbandry business. He will place cattle in a shed located in their yard, raise them and sell them for a higher price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and calves for starting an animal husbandry business

loans.name: Tamari

texts.en:
Tamari is from the Gurjaani district of East Georgia. She is 32 years old and lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two children (13 and 15 years old). Her children go to the local school. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, Tamari owns four pigs and a milk cow, whose milk is used in dairy production. Tamari sells cheese and milk locally. They also own a vineyard and pick grapes in the late summer. Besides, they have a plot of land where maize is grown. The family does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested product is used for feeding cattle. Tamari works hard, but she still doesn’t have enough income to save and improve the living conditions of her family.

With the received loan, Tamari will purchase pigs. She will place the pigs in a shed in their yard, raise, fatten and sell them at a higher price. This will increase the family income. With the increased income, Tamari plans to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise for resale.

loans.name: Jelena

texts.en:
Jelena lives in southern part of Kosovo in minority community. She is married and has one, one-year-old child. Her husband doesn’t work. Jelena is a hardworking woman who helps her family to improve their life. She loves her child very much and he is her reason to keep going. Jelena is an enthusiastic and hardworking person, who puts all her effort in her business. To earn for living she has started her business of a food shop for the last three years.

She sells different food stuffs for her local customers. For the first time Jelena is requesting a loan to buy an inventory rack for her business. She is expecting that the loan assistance will help her to meet her business needs. 
In the future she hopes to expand her business. 
Her goal is to save money for her family’s future. 

She is very happy to have this support and she wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy an inventory rack for her business

loans.name: Alla

texts.ru:
Алла – предприниматель, который работает на рынке – она продает женскую одежду. В ассортименте ее товара -  женские свитера, блузы, кофты, толстовки, штаны, джинсы. Торговая точка расположена в уданом для покупателей месте. 
Кредит КИВА ей понадобился для поездки в Харьков для закупки осенней женской верхней одежды.
texts.en: Alla is a businesswoman who works at the market selling women's clothing. The range of goods she offers includes women's sweaters, blouses, shirts, hoodies, pants, and jeans. Alla's sales outlet at the market is very conveniently located for her clients. Alla will use the Kiva loan to travel to Kharkov to stock up on autumn outerwear.

loans.use: to buy autumn outerwear

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна торгует на так называемом рынке для малоимущих, где в основном представлены товары, по своей цене доступные населению, чей доход – ниже среднего. Она реализует женскую одежду: свитера, гольфы, футболки, майки, леггинсы. 
Дополнительные средства понадобились Татьяне для поездки в Одессу за осенним товаром, для закупки толстовок и утепленных кофт. Татьяна - порядочная, вежливая, всегда обновляет свой товар, всегда находится на своем торговом месте. 
Пометка: кредит - краткосрочный, только на 4 недели, так называемый экспресс кредит.
texts.en:
Tatyana does her business at the market known as the "low-earners' market," where goods are sold at a price affordable to a population whose income is lower than average. She sells women's clothing: sweaters, knee socks, t-shirts, tank tops, and leggings. Tatyana is in need of extra funds to travel to Odessa and buy autumn wear, like sweatshirts and warm cardigans. 

Tatyana is respectable and polite. She always keeps her stock up to date, and you can always find her hard at work in her stall.

loans.use: to buy sweatshirts and warm cardigans

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman is a 51-year-old man on pension, married with two children. He is a market vendor and sells different kind of food products in the central bazaar. Elman has 20 years of experience in this field, so he is considered a knowledgeable and skilled person.

He usually sells rice, pasta, yogurt, ketchup, sugar and other items. The products he sells are in very high demand amoung local people, and they use them in everyday life.  His monthly profit is 120 AZN. His spouse helps him update merchandise in his shop. 

This business bring sufficient financial income because his pension is only 60 USD per month. Elman would like to cover market demand and increase his sales. Because of this, he applied for 1000 AZN.  He will use this loan to purchase more products.  He has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy more food products to resell.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Enhtuya is 25 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic felt housing tent) in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her husband, Bat-erdene, is 23 years old. He works as an assistant worker in a mining company.

She is starting her own clothing and other goods retail business in the black market from this month. Rental counter payment is 45,000 MNT monthly and her business profit is 300,000 MNT per month. She purchases products form China and sells at retail price at the black market.

She is planning to buy a counter from her newly started business's profit at the black market in order to save on monthly rent. She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more goods to offer.

loans.use: to invest in her newly started business of clothes retailing

loans.name: Liezyl

texts.en:
Liezyl is 34 years old, single, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Liezyl runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years.  She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, and other groceries.  

Leizyl is requesting a loan for 19,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more grocery items to sell.  In the future, Liezyl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Manchita

texts.en:
Manchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional inventory for her general store. Manchita has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from raising pigs and providing motorcycle transportation.

Manchita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, de 59 años, es una mujer amable y muy responsable, esta casada y tiene seis hijos quienes ya son mayores y solo dos viven con ella, un hijo de 31 años y su hija de 27 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia.  El trabajo de Nilda consiste en la venta de abarrotes al por menor, es decir compra los productos en grandes cantidades y de ahí se encarga de venderlos al menudeo. Tiene una pequeña tienda instalada en un espacio de su casa la misma que pudo construir gracias al apoyo de su esposo. Entre los productos que ofrece tiene arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite, enlatados, bebidas gaseosas, condimentos y otros. Su horario de atención se inicia desde muy temprano y culmina por la noche. Este trabajo lo esta haciendo desde hace 15 años, gracias a esta actividad pudo educar a sus hijos e implementar su casa con algunos artefactos, por lo general trabaja sola y en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hija mientras su esposo, hijo y nieto trabajan fueran de casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para realizar múltiples actividades dentro de su casa, le está yendo muy bien ya que siempre tiene clientes que atender, sus ganancias son considerables y eso le permite realizar la compra de sus productos de manera continua. Por ahora ella prefiere mantenerse con lo que tiene comprando con frecuencia la misma cantidad de productos pero más adelante espera implementarlo y realizar algunos cambios en la infraestructura de su local de atención. Este es el préstamo número 6 con MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal en donde la quieren mucho por ser muy responsable y solidaria, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir aumentando su negocio, está convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo en todos los préstamos que tuvo hasta ahora.
Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes como arroz, pan, azúcar, huevos, verduras entre otros, además mejorará la infraestructura de su tienda con la compra de maderas y clavos.
texts.en:
Nilda, 59 years old, is a nice and responsible woman. She is married and has six children who are now grown and only two that now live with her: one boy who is 31 years old and her daughter who is 27 years old. Together, they live in their own house. Nilda's work consists of retail selling of groceries, that is to say, she buys the products in great quantities and from there she sells them in small units.She has a small store installed in a space in her house, which she was able to construct due to the support of her spouse.

Among other products that she offers, she has rice, sugar, eggs, oil, canned goods, soft drinks, condiments, and others. Her schedule starts very early in the morning and ends at night. She has been in this line of work since she was 15 years old. Thanks to this job, she has been able to educate her children and outfit her house with some fixtures. In general, she works by herself and in some cases receives the help of her daughter while her spouse, son, and grandson work outside the home.

What she likes about her work is that she has time to do multiple activities inside of her home. It is going very well for her, since she always has customers to attend to, her income is considerable, and this allows her to purchase her products on a continual basis. For now, she prefers to continue with what she has, frequently purchasing the same quantities of products, but later she hopes to implement some changes in the infrastructure of her store.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. She was always a very good member in the community bank, where she is highly valued for being a responsible and supportive member. She thanks those who fill the loan that she requires to continue improving her business. The community bank is convinced that she will continue to be a punctual client and pay her payments on time, like she has in all of the loans she has had to date. With the 2500 soles (Peruvian currency), she will purchase a large quantity of groceries like rice, bread, sugar, eggs, and vegetables, among others, and she will also improve the infrastructure of her store with the purchase of wood and nails.

loans.use: To buy rice, bread, sugar, eggs, vegetables, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Olia

texts.en:
Olia is 51 years old. She lives in Martvili district, West Georgia, with her husband Oleg. Olia requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was always rejected, because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is involved in a small-scale agricultural business. They run a family-owned dairy farm with two milk cows. Olia produces cheese and sells it in the village. In addition, they grow nuts on family-owned land. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Olia has requested a loan from Credo to start up her family business. Her loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit for business start-up and re-start-up, with fewer conditions, to the country's rural poor. This population is often considered "high risk borrowers" because of low income, and they often do not have access to credit. 

With the credit, Olia will rent commercial space and start a general store. She will buy the necessary goods and food to sell, and do some decorations for her general store. Olia hopes that this loan will help her improve her income and thus her financial situation. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to rent commercial space and start a general store

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en:
Dodo is from the small village of Vani district. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband, two sons and a mother-in-law. Her mother-in-law is a pensioner. The children go to the local school. Dodo’s husband works as a builder and gets a monthly income. 

The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, Dodo runs a small dairy farm. She has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides, Dodo owns a vineyard and a nut garden. She sells her agricultural products -- cheese, wine and nuts -- at the local open market. In addition, Dodo is involved in clothing trading and sells clothes from her house. She is a very hardworking woman, with a rich experience in her work.

Dodo requested a loan to roof the house. With this credit she will purchase building materials and repair the roof. It is old and the water drops in during the rainy weather.  A new roof will improve the living conditions of the family. Dodo hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair the roof.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира обратилась в МДО "Арванд" за поддержкой проведения свадьбы дочери.  Ей 39  лет, у нее трое детей.  Замира работает поваром в университете, но сумму которую она получает не хватает на проведение этого мероприятия.  Ее муж также работает, он занимается торговлей краской.   Они вместе накопили на приданное дочери, а недостающую сумму  решили получить в МДО "Арванд". Замира благодарна, что существуют такие организации, которые могут помочь и поддержать в трудную минуту.
texts.en: Zamira has come to MVO Arvand for support to pay for the costs of hosting her daughter's wedding. She is 39 years old and has 3 children. Zamira works as a cook at a university, but she cannot afford to pay for the wedding expenses on her salary. Zamira's husband works selling paint. Together they have saved up some money to pay for the wedding, and are asking for a loan from Arvand to cover the shortfall. Zamira is thankful that there are organizations that can help and support people in their times of need.

loans.use: to buy wedding accessories

loans.name: Chumagul

texts.ru: Чумагул проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет среднее - специальное образование. Чумагул портниха. Она четыре года как предоставляет услугу. Чумагул у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она просит кредит для ремонта имеющейся швейной машинки и приобретения новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Chumagul lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 49 years old, married, and has 4 children. She received a vocational education at a polytechnic high school. Chumagul is a seamstress and for the last four years, she has been providing sewing services. She works from her home sewing national dresses. Chumagul is now seeking a loan to repair her current sewing machine and to buy a new one as well.

loans.use: to repair her current sewing machine and purchase a new one

loans.name: Areen

texts.en:
Areen is a conservative young lady, she asked her dad to take her place in the photo.
Areen is a 21 year old single lady who lives in Madaba. She started her own business becoming a bee keeper and honey production business. In addition to helping her family with cattle farming and the small number of livestock they own. Being a responsible member of her family, Areen would like to get a youth loan so she can help support her 3 younger brothers and help with the house expenses by increasing the number of goats they have as a preparation for the upcoming Islamic holiday, and make more bee houses to enlarge the business.

loans.use: increase the number of goats and make more bee houses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has lived in the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi for 35 years, where she has raised her 7 children and 20 grandchildren. She would like to open two Fresh Life toilets because she wants to help her community by providing a sanitary toilet option and improving the cleanliness of the surrounding environment. Mary has trouble walking to the proposed toilet location because of a disability, so she has enlisted her youngest born (John, pictured above) to operate the toilet.

Mary used to manage a restaurant, but it eventually closed due to lack of capital. She is interested in Fresh Life toilets because they do not require water, are healthy and hygienic, and are easy to maintain and operate. She hopes that this business will bring her enough profits to feed her family and someday even buy more toilets.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Jesus Jose

texts.es:
El señor Jesus Jose esta casado, tiene 52 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando,se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este negocio como operario y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al tricotado de hilos.

Solicita un préstamo, que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos con el fin de incrementar su producción de tejidos, espera en el futuro tener mas operarios, y contribuir al desarrollo de cada familia.
texts.en:
Jesus Jose is married, 52 years old, and never had the opportunity to study. He has three children, of whom 2 are studying. He works as a weaver. He started in this business as an operator, and at this point has 8 years of experience. He relies on the support of his spouse, who works knitting thread.

He is asking for a loan which he will use to purchase thread with the goal of increasing his production of fabric, and hopes in the future to have more machine operators, and contribute to the development of each and every family.

loans.use: to buy thread for his knitting business

loans.name: Damba

texts.en: Mr Damba is 23 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a small house in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife, Munhtuya, is self-employed.  His daughter, Azzaya, is in kindergarten.  Mr.Damba started a taxi service in 2009 in his town. His wife runs a business selling vegetables and fruit from a rental counter. His wife's business is not doing very well lately and they are planning to expand her fruit selling business to make more profit and buy a hybrid car for his wife. He is a hardworking and honest man. He needs 1,500,000 MNT to buy hybrid car for his wife and business use.

loans.use: To buy a hybrid car

loans.name: Aslam

texts.ru: Аслам житель города Вахдат. Он женат. Ему 47 лет. У него двое детей. В семье он один зарабатывает. Аслам занимается торговлей. У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает детские игрушки, хозяйственные товары и бытовую технику. В этой области Аслам работает четыре года. Он берет кредит для покупки хозяйственных товаров.
texts.en: Aslam lives in Vahdat. He is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children. He is the sole breadwinner in the family. Aslam works in retail and has a sales outlet where he sells children's toys, household goods, and appliances. He has been working in this field for four years. Aslam is seeking a loan to buy household goods.

loans.use: to buy household goods

loans.name: Proyectando Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Proyectando al Futuro” está conformado por 22 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; almacén, botillería, peluquería, artesanía, venta de sopaipillas y empanadas, venta de productos de belleza, tejidos, ropa, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Villarrica.
Manuela, integrante del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un pantalón de color gris, chaqueta de color lila, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto, en sus brazos sostiene a su hijo.
Ella se dedica al rubro de gastronomía, desde hace 6 años. Se desempeña en sus labores en su cas de lunes a domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, realiza eventos, comidas, celebraciones de cumpleaños, cóctel y lo que su clientela le solicite.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando las compra en distribuidoras, supermercados y algunas veces compra en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará carne, cebollas, mote, servilletas, vasos, accesorios para tortas.
Una de las metas de Manuela es tener un restaurant, con estilo rustico, con comidas tradicionales de chile y algunas tendencias mapuches, así con esto generar mayores ingresos familiares.
Manuela vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos de 17, 12 y 1 año de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su propio restaurant, y tener familiares trabajando en él y dar la mejor atención al público.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que existe respeto.
Villarrica es una  ciudad al sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de La Araucanía. Es una ciudad pequeña, pero cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y turísticos, siendo uno de los principales centros de servicios del área cordillerana y principal centro turístico de la región, junto con Pucón. Durante los meses de verano se realizan numerosas actividades y eventos culturales, artísticos y deportivos, Además de las innumerables alternativas de Ecoturismo, Turismo Aventura y Etnoturismo.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Proyectando al Futuro” has 22 members who do a variety of work: running a store, bar, or hair salon; selling handicrafts; selling fried pumpkin dough and empanadas; selling cosmetics, weaving, or clothing; and providing other services. All the members live in the city of Villarrica.

Manuela is the member of the communal bank who is standing in the first position from right to left in the first row, wearing grey pants and a purple jacket, wearing her dark brown hair down, and holding her son in her arms. She has been a cook for six years. She works from her house Mondays to Sundays, depending on her availability, overseeing events and preparing food and cocktails for birthdays and whatever her clients wish. She must buy her supplies and merchandise from dealers and supermarkets, and sometimes she buys in Santiago. She will use the loan to buy meats, onions, wheat mote, napkins, glasses, and cake stands. One of Manuela's goals is to have a traditional Chilean restaurant with some Mapuche influence where she can generate more income for her family.

Maanuela lives with her husband and three children, ages 17, 12, and 1. She dreams of having her own restaurant, having more relatives working there, and garnering more attention from the public. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity to invest in her business through Fondo Esperanza. She is also comfortable with her group, and they respect one another.

Villarrica is located in southern Chile in the La Araucanía region. Though the city is small, it has all the basic and tourism services because it is one of the main service centers for the mountain area and is the region's main tourist destination besides Pucón. During the summer, there are many activities and cultural, artistic, and sporting events. There are numerous ecotourism, adventure, and ethnotourism alternatives.

loans.use: to buy meat, onions, wheat mote, napkins, glasses, and cake stands.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER”  iniciará el decimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de vidriería, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, mercachifles, venta de ropa, macramé, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de plantillas y cuadros; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que ella les ayudaba a la comercialización de estos productos, posteriormente decidió emprender su propio negocio de comercialización de estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumento de capital (compra de plantillas y cuadros) que adquirirá de la feria de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que la institución le ofresca muchos beneficios.
texts.en:
“Amanecer” (Dawn) is a Communal Bank that will start its tenth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Community Center. It is composed of eight members, guided by a directive board presided over by Silvia. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different activities such as running a glasware store, selling vegetables, running a neighborhood store, working as a street seller, selling clothes, weaving macramé and selling vegetables.

Silvia is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. Leonora says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one year, and that she has been invited to enter by her mother who is a member of the institution. She currently engages in selling stencils and paintings. She says that she has learned this activity form her parents while helping them selling these products, and that then she has decided to start her own activity and sell this products on her own.

The loan she in now requesting will be used to increase her working capital by buying stencils and paintings in the fairs of the town of La Paz. She will then sell them in her stall. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically provide for her family as much as she can, as she is a single mother of one child.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the many benefits they offer.

loans.use: To buy stencils and paintings.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a widow and has six children.  She works hard to support her family.  Paz sells vegetables and spices in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Paz is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more vegetables and spices to sell.  Paz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru:
Махмадали житель района Рудаки. Он 26 - летний женатый мужчина. Махмадали является отцом троих детей. Он работает таксистом. В этой области Махмадали три года. 
Махмадали просит кредит для приобретения новой автомашины. Он намерен продать свою старую машину и сверху положив деньги (полученный заем), приобрести новую.
texts.en: Mahmadali lives in the Rudaki region. He is 26 years old, married, and is the father of 3 children. For the past 3 years, Mahamadali has been working as a taxi driver. He is now seeking a loan to help him buy a new vehicle. Mahmadali intends to sell his current vehicle and to combine the profit he gets from the sale with the loan money to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Ara Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres de nombre Ara Pyahu se formo gracias a que varias señoras de este grupo ya formaron parte de otro grupo anteriormente,, y en la actualidad son  20 señoras que se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 13º ciclo, conjuntamente dentro del programa.
La presidenta es Francisca, y ella vende frutas y verduras para poder tener los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Se hizo de buena clientela y con el apoyo de su grupo está saliendo adelante.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras de todo tipo, ya que quiere poder surtirse y seguir dando buena calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee of women named “Ara Pyahu” was formed thanks to several women from this group who were previously part of another group.  The group currently has 20 women who are very comfortable working together in this program.  They are already in their 13th loan cycle.  

The group president is Francisca.  She sells fruits and vegetables so that she will have income to help her family.  Francisca has built up a good clientele and the support of her group has helped her move forward.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy all types of fruits and vegetables.  Francisca wants her business to be well-stocked so that she can continue offering good-quality products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní, son 11 mujeres donde todas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser cerdos, cabras, ovejas y gallinas.
Cuentan que cada una se esfuerza al máximo y quiere salir adelante para tener los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a sus respectivas familias.
Josefina solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceado para sus animales, ya que así podrá seguir dando una buena alimentación a sus animales.
texts.en: The "San Cayetano" group formed with the union of various neighbors in the city of Santaní. The members are 11 ladies who are all engaged in raising and selling small animals, such as pigs, goats, sheep, and chickens. They each work their hardest, and want to get ahead to have the means to help their respective families. Josefina is asking for this loan to buy animal feed, so that she can continue to give good nutrition to her animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé se unieron con las ganas de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder dar a sus hijos y demás familiares todo lo que desean. Son mujeres jefas de familia, que vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de la fundación paraguaya y es por ello que decidieron unirse y salir adelante.
 Nora es parte del grupo y también es la presidenta, ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de comestibles y cuenta que le está yendo muy bien y que ya tiene muy buena clientela. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos que necesita para poder seguir haciendo sus alimentos, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, harinas, huevos y demás.
Agradece el grupo por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que por medio del programa salen adelante.
texts.en:
Thirteen women from the city of Caacupe united with a desire to work together, so that through this work they could give their children and other members of their family everything they want.  These women are heads of households, and they saw a great opportunity to make progress with this program in the Fundacion Paraguaya.  This is the reason that they decided to unite to get ahead.

Nora is part of this group, and she is also the president.  She has a business selling all types of prepared food.  She says that her business is going very well, and she has a good customer base.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies that she needs so that she can continue to make her dishes, such as vegetables, meats, condiments, flour, eggs and other products.

This group appreciates the opportunity that they are receiving, because through this program they are getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, flour, eggs and other products

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 56 years old. She is a widow and lives in a small village district of Akhaltsikhe with her family: two sons, a daughter-in law and a grandchild. The family earns money through an agriculture business. In particular, she runs a small dairy farm of 3 calves and 4 milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products.  Besides, the family grows potatoes and haricots on family-owned land. They also have walnut trees and pick walnuts in autumn. Natela sells the agricultural production in the local district.
Natela requested a loan for purchasing a car. The family will use it for sales of their products. With the car, she will be able to move comfortably and easily. This will save the costs related to renting a car and the family's monthly income will increase. She will spend the biggest portion of her income to develop the agricultural business. Natela plans to buy a mini-bus and increase the sales. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food businesss.

NWTF is relisting Cirila's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Annabella works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns income from raising pigs. Annabella is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to purchase more items such as bread, soft drinks and other groceries for her general store

Annabella has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her handicraft work.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 59 years old and a widowed mother of three children. 

Eva is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eva has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité 8 de Diciembre, está en el primer ciclo, todas ellas son mujeres de escasos recursos que se esfuerzan para dar todo lo mejor a sus familias.
Todas las miembros se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, chanchos, cabras, ovejas, y demás tipos de animales. Ellas cuentan que con la ayuda de la fundación esperan salir adelante y cambiar el futuro de ellas y de sus familias.
Silvia solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados con lo cual podrá seguir alimentando a sus animales y teniendo una buena cantidad en stock.
texts.en:
The 8 de Diciembre communal bank is in its first cycle.  All of the women have few resources, and they put forth great effort to give all of the best to their families.

All of the members raise and sell farmyard animals like chickens, pigs, goats, sheep, and other types of animals.  They say that with the help of the Fundación, they hope to get ahead and change their future and that of their families.

Silvia is requesting a loan to buy balanced feed with which she will continue feeding her animals and having a good amount on hand.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Venchita

texts.en:
Venchita is 56 years old and lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin.  Venchita is single without children. 

Venchita has a dress shop that sells assorted ready to wear items.  Venchita has had this business for five years.  Venchita requested a loan to purchase additional ready to wear dresses.

Venchita has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Venchita hopes to save money in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready to wear dresses.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is married, has two children who attend school and lives in Kampala, Uganda. She has two additional family members. Three years ago she started selling milk in a shop on wholesale basis. She works seven days a week in this business, also selling doughnuts and samosa. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to enable her buy more milk and a deep freezer. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goals are to buy land and build a home and own a dairy plant. She decided to work with MCDT SACCO because the interest rate is fair. She is renting the house where she stays. She has access to electricity and to piped water. Her biggest monthly expense is rent.

loans.use: to buy more milk and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Rosenda works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from growing fruit trees. Rosenda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Rosenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Tagred

texts.en: Tagred is a 32 year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan, who has one family member. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy women's and children's clothes for her friends and neighbors.  She would like to increase her products. In the future ,she hopes to open a shop to expand her project to improve her family income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Margarita Beatriz

texts.es: Margarita Beatriz de veintiocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos; ella posee una sala de belleza y tiene varios años con el negocio, ha ganado una amplia experiencia en el rubro y realiza un trabajo excelente en cortes, peinados y otros adicional a esto para complementar los gastos del hogar Margarita vende cosméticos, ropa y otros productos varios que las personas le solicitan, esta ubicada en su residencia, es muy conocida y ya tiene mucha clientela quela prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y el servicio excelente; es una mujer que se caracteriza por su amabilidad y honestidad, es totalmente dedicada a su labor, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, cada dia se esfuerza al máximo por encontrar esas oportunidades que le permitan llegar al éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda en el negocio y quiere aprovechar a una nueva inversión para no decepcionar a los clientes por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos de belleza, ropa, golosinas, papeles de regalo etc. Margarita Beatriz tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Margarita Beatriz, 28, lives with her life partner and her two children. She runs a beauty salon and has had this business for many years. She’s gained a wealth of experience in her job and gives excellent hair cuts and styles. In addition to this business and in order to cover her household expenses, she sells products from home, like cosmetics, clothing and other various items that people request. She’s well-known and already has a lot of clientele who prefer her for the quality, good prices and excellent services she provides. What sets her apart is that she’s kind and honest, committed to her work, enterprising and filled with the desire to get ahead. Every day she makes the maximum effort to find opportunities that will lead her to success. In the last weeks, there’s been an increase in demand for her products and she’d like to take advantage of this by making a new investment in her business in order to serve all of her clients. That’s why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy beauty products, clothing, candy, gift wrap, etc. Margarita Beatriz has good payment references and is very responsable. She is certain she can pay back the loan, and at the same time, she confides that she can take home some financial security.

loans.use: buy beauty products, clothing, candy and gift wrap.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, de 31 años, es una mujer joven muy trabajadora y responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 6 años quien es su razón de vivir y por quien trabajan día a día para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos habitan en casa de sus suegros quienes le ayudan en el cuidado de su niño. EL trabajo de Olga consiste en la reparación de electrodomésticos de línea blanca, además de vender repuestos de los mismos, ella trabaja junto a su pareja quienes forman una equipo de trabajo muy bueno, antes ella se dedicaba a otras labores y su pareja trabajaba como soporte en una tienda de artefactos de electrodomésticos lo cual le sirvió para conocer futuros clientes. Pero ahora salió de ese trabajo y desde hace 1 año emprendieron este negocio solos y son muy solicitados. Actualmente arreglan lavadoras, hornos microondas, ollas arroceras y otros. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo a disponible para trabajar tranquilamente sin descuidar a su hijo, además que trabaja junto a su pareja y eso es muy satisfactorio para ella, tiene buenos ingresos ya que siempre solicitan sus servicios, espera mantener su actividad hasta que pueda establecer un local en donde atienda a sus clientes con mayor comodidad sin dejar de brindar servicio a domicilio. Este es el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, es por ello que agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito financiero para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará repuestos de lavadoras además comprará algunas herramientas para desarrollar mejor su servicio de reparación de electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Olga, who is 31 years old, is a very hardworking and responsible young woman who lives with her partner.  Together they have a 6 year old child who is her reason for living and for whom she works daily to give him a better quality of life.  Together they live in their in-laws' house who help them in taking care of their son.

Olga's work is in the line of repairs on home appliances from White Line, and also in the sales of parts for the same products.  She works together with her partner, and they make really good team of workers.  Before that, she worked in another line of work and her partner worked as a helper in a home appliance parts store, in which he worked to find new customers.  But now they have left these jobs and for the past year they have been working in their own business and they are well received.  They do repairs on washers, ovens, microwaves, rice cookers, and other appliances.

What she likes about her work is that she has time free to work quietly without being unable to care for her son, and also that she works with her partner, and this is very satisfying for her.  She has a good income now that people are always asking for her services.  She hopes to continue in this work until she can establish a storefront where she can wait on her customers in greater comfort while maintaining home delivery services.

This is her 10th loan with MFP, and for this she thanks all the people who have given her the opportunity to have access to a financial credit so that she can make her plans happen.  Additionally, she says its a pleasure to work with her community bank, since she has gotten to know the members and considers them to be responsible and sympathetic people.

With the amount that she is asking for, 1,500 Soles, she will buy replacement parts for washers, and she'll also buy some tools to develop better services in repairs of home appliances.

loans.use: to buy parts for washers and also tools.

loans.name: Judith Adelina

texts.es: Judith Adelina de veintisiete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida José y sus hijos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife y  por las tarde trabaja en su sala de belleza realizando cortes de cabello, decoración de uñas y planchados, tiene varios años trabajando y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener siempre las mejores ganancias; esta ubicada en su vivienda y es muy conocida por todas las personas de la comunidad, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Judith se caracteriza por su amabilidad y honestidad, es una mujer muy humilde y dedicada a su labor siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino al éxito , se esfuerza todos los días pues sabe que solo así logrará su objetivo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos Herbalife y productos de belleza. Judith Adelina tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Judith Adelina, 27, lives with her life companion, José, and their children in a house of her own.  She works selling Herbalife products and in the afternoons works in her beauty salon cutting hair, decorating fingernails and straightening hair.  She’s been working for several years and has gained much experience that allows her to always earn the best profits.  She’s located at home and very well known by the people in the community.  She’s acquired a large clientele that prefers her for the quality, good prices and above all excellent service.

Judith is noted for her kindness and honesty.  She’s a humble woman who is dedicated to her work and always on the lookout for new opportunities that will open a path towards success.  She strives daily because she knows that’s the only way to reach her objective.  

In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment but does not have the capital to do so which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy Herbalife products and beauty products.  Judith Adelina has good payment references and is very responsible.  She assures that she will be able to repay the loan and trusts that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products and beauty products.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun and his family are still farming. Thanks to his farming, Harutyun is able to provide for his family.  

Harutyun used a prior Kiva loan to buy five calves for his farm. Now he needs a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of fodder for his farm animals to stock his feed supply for winter.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of fodder for his farm animals to stock his feed supply for winter.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs. Victoria is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell at her business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Khadeja

texts.en:
Khadeja is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Nassr appears in her Kiva profile photo taken in his workshop.
Khadeja is a 46 year old woman, she is married to Nassr and has no children.
For the past two years, Khadeja's husband has been operating a carpentry workshop, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family, but also it needs more support to cover the cost.
Khadeja wants to participate in the improvement of her husband's quality of work, so she is requesting a 1000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing a new carpentry kit to ensure that. This will satisfy customers and increase their requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: To purchase new carpentry kit

loans.name: Saul Humberto

texts.es: Saúl de 46 años de edad, es un señor muy alegre y trabajador, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. Saúl se dedica a la elaboración de zapatos para hombres y mujeres, los cuales comercializa en su puesto en el mercado Central, en donde ofrece sus productos a muy buenos precios, por lo que cuenta con varios clientes. Como todo hombre responsable Saúl desea lo mejor para su familia por lo que solicita un préstamo con el cual pueda realizar algunos arreglos a su casa de habitación, mejorar las paredes, repara los techo para poder pasar un invierno tranquilos, resguardados de las fuertes lluvias. Él es una persona muy agradecida quien desea lo mejor para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Saúl, age 46, is a cheerful and hardworking gentleman. He lives with his wife and two young children. Saúl makes shoes for men and women and then sells them from a stand at the central market. He offers his products at very good prices and has many customers.

Like all responsible men, Saúl wants the best for his family, so he is requesting a loan so that he can make a few renovations to his house. He plans to improve the walls and repair the roof so that he can have a peaceful winter and be protected from the strong rains. Saúl is a person who is very appreciative because he wants the best for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home repairs.

loans.name: Alonso Fernando

texts.es: Alonso Fernando de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su vive junto a su compañera de vida Francisca y su hija en casa propia; él se dedica al transporte de carga tiene varios años con el negocio y es muy conocido por las personas del lugar, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque es muy confiable, tiene excelentes precios y un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Alonso se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y honestidad es muy humilde y siempre esta dedicado a su labor, le gusta luchar por lo que desea por eso se esfuerza dia a dia para ganarse un futuro mas prospero y así obtener el éxito que se merece, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda del trasporte y necesita hacerle unas reparaciones para no decepcionar a la clientela, pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para el mantenimiento del vehículo. Alonso Fernando tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Alonso Fernando, age 55, lives with his life partner, Francisca, and his daughter in his own house.  He has been in the cargo transportation business for several years.  He is very well-known by the local people, and he has a lot of customers.  People prefer him because he is very reliable, has excellent prices, provides unparalleled service, and is always at his customers’ service.  

Alfonso is known for his great kindness, honesty, and humility.  He is always devoted to his work.  He likes struggling for what he wishes.  That is why he works hard day to day in order to obtain a more prosperous future and to get the success he deserves.

In the past weeks the demand for transportation has increased.  He needs to make repairs so that he does not disappoint the clientele.  However, he does not have enough capital to do so.  That is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

Alonso Fernando has good payment references, and he is very responsible.  He is sure that he will be able to repay the debt, and he has faith that he will bring financial security to his household.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Monaira

texts.en:
Monaira is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Monaira has been in this business for three years.  She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell in her fish business.

Monaira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of  loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 45 años, es una mujer valiente y trabajadora, casada y madre de  tres hijos de 24, 23 y 17 años, Juntos habitan en su casa propia y trabajan mucho para salir adelante. El trabajo de María consiste en la venta de bebidas al por mayor, tiene una pequeña distribuidora que se encarga de dejar a consignación sus productos para las diferentes actividades que se realizan en su comunidad los fines de semana, tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde acondicionó un pequeño espacio para poder atender a sus clientes, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y su pareja. Además de vender gaseosas, también vende hielos y chupetes que son del agrado de sus clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede trabajar a lado de sus hijos y disponer del tiempo necesario para hacer otras actividades. Su negocio le brinda muy buenas ganancias ya que es muy conocida en su sector por la actividad que realiza, espera mantener el mismo ritmo de trabajo. Mas adelante desea ampliar con mayor cantidad de productos que son solicitados por los clientes. Este es el crédito número 5 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento programado, además está muy decidida a cumplir con sus pagos como lo hizo hasta ahora en sus créditos anteriores, le agrada mucho pertenecer al grupo del que forma parte ya que todos sus integrantes son muy puntuales y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado 300 soles, comprará más bebidas para tener en stock  y así poder cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
María, 45, is a brave and hardworking woman.  She's married and the mother of three children, ages 24, 23, and 17.  They live together in their own home and work a lot to get ahead.

María's job is selling beverages wholesale.  She has a small distributorship and leaves products on consignment for the various weekend activities in her community.  She has a small place in her house where she fixed up a space to be able to serve her customers.  She has the help of her children and her husband.  In addition to selling soda, she also sells ice pops and lollipops, which the customers like.

What she likes about her job is that she can work with her children and have the time she needs for other activities.  Her business gives her very good profits because she's well known in her area.  She hopes to maintain the same level of business.  In the future she wants to expand with more products that her customers request.

This is her fifth loan with MFP and she hopes for your help to continue with her objectives and desired growth.  Also, she's determined to make her payments punctually as she did with her previous loans.  It pleases her a lot to belong to her group because all the members are very punctual and responsible.

With the loan for 300 soles [PEN] she'll buy more beverages to have in stock so she can fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy beverages to have in stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour at wholesale, sugar, milk, eggs and sweets.

loans.name: Marlene Concepcion

texts.es: Marlene Concepción de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a sus hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, pantalones, camisas, vestidos entre otros y electrodomésticos planchas, licuadoras y otros, tiene varios años con este negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia desde su vivienda y de forma ambulante en las cercanías de la comunidad donde reside, es muy conocida y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y el excelente servicio; Marlene es una mujer que se caracteriza por su amabilidad, honestidad y por ser muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por las metas que desea alcanzar y sabe que con esfuerzo y amor a su trabajo podrá lograr el éxito que tanto desea, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor y electrodomésticos. Marlene Concepción tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marlene Concepción, 42, lives with her children. She sells clothing and household appliances, like pants, shirts, dresses, irons and blenders among other things. She’s been in this business for many years and has gained much experience in sales, which has allowed her to improve her financial gains. She works from home and also by foot around the community where she lives. She’s well-known and has gained a large clientele who prefer her for the quality, good prices and excellent service she provides. What sets Marlene apart is that she’s kind and honest. And because she’s so dedicated to her work, she’s always fighting to reach her goals. She knows that by putting in much effort and loving her job she’ll attain the success she so desires. In the last weeks, there’s been an increase in demand for her products and she’d like to take advantage of this by making a new investment in her business, but she doesn’t have enough capital to do it. That’s why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy wholesale clothing and household appliances. Marlene Concepción has good payment references and irreproachable morals. She is certain she can pay back the loan and at the same time, she has the hope of giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy wholesale clothing and household appliances.

loans.name: Koe Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El comité  Ko´e Pyahu, está en el primer ciclo, y todas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y se ayudan en todo lo que pueden para poder salir adelante.
Todas las miembros se dedican a la cría y venta de chanchos, gallinas, y demás animales. Cuentan que es un trabajo muy duro, pero ellas se esfuerzan porque quieren poder ayudar a sus familias.
Mirian, una de las miembros solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz, afrecho y mandioca para dar de comer a sus animales, ya que quiere tener un buen stock de alimentos para dar a sus animales.
texts.en:
The “Ko´e Pyahu” committee is in the first cycle.  They are all learning how to work together and they help each other out in every way possible in order to get ahead.

All the members work raising and selling pigs, chickens and other animals.  They relate that it’s very hard work but they strive because they want to be able to help their families.

Mirian is one of the group members and she’s asking for the loan to buy bran, corn and cassava to feed to her animals because she wants to have a good stock of food on had to give her animals.

loans.use: to buy bran, corn, cassava, etc.

loans.name: Kueña Kuera Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Kuña Kuera Katupyry, tiene 10 miembros, donde todas crían animales de corral, una de ellas es la Sra. Toribia, quien cuenta que su trabajo es muy duro, ya que todo el tiempo debe de estar  pendiente de sus animales, que es de tiempo completo.
La meta de Toribia es algún día tener una gran granja y así poder tener muchos animales. Solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de gallinas para la cría y así seguir aumentando su número de animales.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Kuera Katupyry” committee has ten members; all raise corral animals.  One of them is Toribia who relates that her work is very demanding because she must be watching over her animals at all times; it’s a full-time job.

Toribia’s goal is to have a big farm one day in order to have many more animals.  She’s requesting this loan to buy chickens to raise and thus continue to increase the number of her animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 48 years old and married with eight children.  Perlita works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells dried coconut meat in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Perlita has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dried coconut meat buying and selling business for 30 years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Perlita aspires to saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy dried coconut meat to resell.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comite Mujeres Luchadoras es del Chaco, son 13 mujeres muy capaces, que se esfuerzan día a día por salir adelante. Gracias al trabajo de todas ellas ya están en el tercer ciclo del programa.
La Sra. Gladys se dedica a la venta de carbón, y cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y está ayudando a su familia con todo lo que ella puede.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carbón, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y surtirse para dar un buen producto para su clientela.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Luchadores” (Women Fighters) Committee is from Chaco. They are made up of 13 very capable women, who work hard day to day to get ahead. Thanks to everyone’s hard work, they’re already in the 3rd cycle of the program.
Gladys sells charcoal and puts in a great deal of effort. She’s getting ahead and she’s helping her family with all that she has.
She is requesting this loan to stock up on charcoal so she can continue working and continue offering a good product to her clients.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres compartiendo todas las dependencias, ella cuenta con un ambiente el cual es su dormitorio, la casa es de  adobe y el piso es de madera, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada en una imprenta grafica realizando trabajos de impresión donde percibe un salario mensual que cubre sus necesidades de transporte y alimentación. Ella actualmente esta estudiando para convertirse en profesora de primaria en la normal Simon bolivar de la ciudad de La Paz donde se encuentra en el tercer año. El crédito quiere para la compra de una computadora para realizar y mejorar sus estudios.
El sueño de Silvia es culminar sus estudios y así poder trabajar como profesora y poder independizarse de su familia..
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Silvia is single and has no children. She lives at home with her parents and shares in all of the expenses. Silvia has a space that is set aside as her bedroom. The house is made of adobe and has wood floors. Her home is located in the District of Villa Nuevo Potosi in the city of La Paz.

Silvia currently works as an employee at a graphic design firm where she handles the printing jobs. She receives a monthly salary that covers her transportation and food costs. Silvia is also studying to become an elementary school teacher at the Simon Bolivar Teacher’s College, where she is in her third year. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a computer so that she can complete and improve her studies.

Silvia’s dream is to finish her education so that she can work as a teacher and become independent from her family. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for her studies.
