loans.name: Lorenzo Isaac

texts.es: Lorenzo Isaac de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida María Luz y sus hijas en casa propia;  él se dedica a la venta de ropa, camisas, pantalones, faldas, blusas entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia  en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia desde su vivienda y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren por la calidad los buenos precios y el servicio excelente; Lorenzo  mes un hombre activo, dedicado a su labor, honesto y sobre todo luchador, para él lo mas impórtate es nunca rendirse aunque existan adversidades pues tarde o temprano siempre se abren las puertas al éxito, en la ultima semana aumentaron las ventas y desea realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Lorenzo Isaac tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le  dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Lorenzo Isaac is 44 years old and lives with his life partner María Luz and his daughters in their own home.  He sells clothing, including shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, and other goods.  He has been in this business for years and has gained lots of experience in sales, which allows him to get a better income.  He works out of his home, and he already has a large customer base, since people prefer his business for the quality, good prices, and the excellent service.

Lorenzo is an active man, dedicated to his work, he is honest and overall a fighter.  For him, the most important thing is to never give up, ven in the face of adversities because sooner or later the door to success will always open.  In the last week, he's increased his sales and wants to make a new investment, so he is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL that would allow him to buy clothing in bulk.

Lorenzo Isaac has good loan references and a strong moral character, ensuring that he will pay his debts and at the same time give his family a satisfying life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa actualmente se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo el comité demuestra mucho interés con todos los programas que la Fundación ofrece, ya que reciben capacitaciones y así están saliendo adelante.
Iluminada es parte del grupo, ella tiene un comedor muy conocido, donde tiene muy buena clientela y es gracias a eso que está saliendo adelante. Ella es una persona con ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a los suyos. Cuenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que luego con su trabajo fue creciendo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, legumbres, verduras y demás productos para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que ofrece a sus clientes en el comedor.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” group is in the fourth cycle.  The group has shown much interest in all the programs the Fundación offers because they receive training and are moving ahead this way.

Iluminada is part of this group.  She owns a very well-known eatery with a very good clientele and thanks to this she’s getting ahead.  She’s a person who very much wants to get ahead and help her loved ones.  She relates that she started out with very little but in time her work has been growing.

She requests the loan to buy meat, vegetables and other products to continue preparing the dishes she sells to her customers in her eatery.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetbles, legumes and other products.

loans.name: San Paulo Group

texts.es:
14 son las mujeres emprendedoras que decidieron formar parte del grupo San Paulo de la ciudad de Luque, ellas vieron una gran oportunidad de crecimiento en el grupo y por eso decidieron unirse.
La Sra. Cristina tiene una despensa,  esta casada con el señor Mariano, tienen  2 hijos. Ambos se esfuerzan y se ayudan mutuamente para poder salir adelante y dar a sus hijos una buena educación, para que el día de mañana sean personas útiles para la sociedad. Cristina solicita el crédito para la compra de productos  para su despensa, como ser panificados, bebidas, golosinas, yerba, etc. Cristina tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y agregar mas cosas para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fourteen enterprising women decided to form the “San Paulo” group in the city of Luque.  They recognized a great growth opportunity in the group and that’s why they decided to join together.

Cristina has a grocery store.  She’s married to Mariano and they have two children.  They both strive and help each other out to be able to get ahead and provide their children with a good education so that they can become people who are useful to society in the future.

Cristina requests the loan to buy merchandise like baked goods, beverages, snacks, tea, etc. for her store.  Her goal is to gradually enlarge her store and stock more products to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, beverages, snacks, tea, etc.

loans.name: Sharaf

texts.ru:
Шараф родился в 1960 году в городе Вахдат. Он живет с женой. Шараф является отцом пятерых детей. Он имеет среднее образование. 
Шараф на протяжении пяти лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где занимается оптовой продажей лука и картошки. Шараф просит кредит для покупки картошки и лука.
texts.en: Sharaf was born in 1960 in the city of Vahdat.  He lives with his wife.  Sharaf is a father of five children.  He has a secondary education.  Sharaf has been involved in sales at a market for five years.  He leases a retail outlet, where he sell onions and potatoes wholesale.  Sharaf is requesting this loan to purchase potatoes and onions.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and onions

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза студентка 1 курса. Она учится в Таджикском  Национальном Университете. Она учится на отлично и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Шахноза является секретарем студенческого Совета, а также получает стипендию. В будущем она хочет стать хорошим специалистом. Она запрашивает займ  для оплаты учебного договора в 2012-2013 учебного года. Так как ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за учебу Шахнозы, Вы являетесь единственными людьми, кто может подержать ее. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shahnoza is a first-year student.  She attends the Tajikistan National University.  She studies with excellence and actively participates in the university's public life.  Shahnoza is a secretary of the student union and also earns a stipend.  In the future, she wants to become a good specialist.  She is requesting this loan to pay for her 2012-2013 school-year contract.  Because her parents are unable to pay for Shahnoza's education, you are the only people, who can support her.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university education

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo rosa mistica es muy numeroso, son 20 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que se unieron con la esperanza de salir adelante y trabajar juntas.
La Sra. Lilian, es parte del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, tiene 2 hijos por quienes lucha incansablemente, ya que ella es madre soltera. Lilian solicita el préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir, y otros accesorios que les pida sus clientes.Ella quiere abrir una merceria y de esa forma seguir dando un buen estilo de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Rosa Mística group has many members. It is composed of 20 hard-working and enterprising women that got together hoping to progress and work together.

Mrs. Lilian is part of this group. She sells clothes. She has two children, and she works tirelessly for them, because she is a single mother.

Lilian is requesting the loan to buy garments and additional accessories that her customers might order. She wants to open a sewing supply shop and in this way continue providing her children a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with six children, and all of the children are in school.  She also cares for additional family members (old parents).  

Nulu is running a charcoal business.  It is two years since she started it. She sells charcoal on a retail basis from the market.  She is also a tailor.  She works seven days a week.  

Nulu has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.  Her challenges in business are seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations are to highly educate her children.  She decided to work with MCDT SACCO because the loan criterion is low income.  

Nulu owns the house she stays in. She also has access to electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ruzhdi

texts.en:
Ruzhdi is an Egyptian man from one of the two most vulnerable ethnic communities of Albania. He is married and has three children, with one of them still attending school. In spite of the fact that the majority of people live in their community, Ruzhdi settled himself in a village twenty years back where no other persons from his ethnicity reside; this way he and his children will integrate better, he thought.

Ruzhdi and his wife, at the same time of relocation, started a farming business and have been successful ever since. With the income they generated, they made a better life for their family and now they want to save for their youngest daughter’s university tuition fees.

The loan they request this time is for farming: buying seeds, plowing,  and other services.

loans.use: to pay for farming activities: buying seeds, plowing the fields, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and married with three children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of mineral water, soft drinks, and snacks to sell in her general store.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elizabeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as soft drinks and mineral water to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Flordeliza requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 40 years now.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Dúo El Calvario Group

texts.es:
Dúo el Calvario.
Doña ligia es originaria de San Martin Jilotepeque, es propietaria de un moto taxi, nos comenta que desde hace varios años se dedica a esta actividad ya que es una forma de ayudar a su familia por medio de las ganancias que obtiene de su moto taxi, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo, espera que por medio de ustedes ella y su familia puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
“The Cavalry” Duo.
Ligia is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque and is the proprietor of a mototaxi. She tells us that she’s had this business for many years as it’s a way to earn income in order to help her family. She’s requesting this loan to buy spare parts for her mototaxi. She hopes that with your help, she and her family can get ahead.

loans.use: buy spare parts for the mototaxi.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 58 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.
Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional food stuff and general supplies to sell.
Helen has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, sugar, canned goods, and soap.
In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 61 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising ducks and chickens in the Philippines. Herminia is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase feed for her business.  Herminia has been raising ducks and chickens for 10 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her business.

loans.name: Hysen

texts.en:
Hysen is from Kosovo and lives in the Roma community. He is married and has seven children between the ages of one and thirteen years old. Because he doesn’t have enough money, he is unable to afford to send his children to school. Hysen works in manual labor as a helper.  When people need to carry things, they hire and pay him to do it, which serves as the main income for his family. 

Currently they live in an old house and they need a repair for his old toilet. Hysen is requesting a loan in order to renovate his toilet. The loan will help him to improve the living conditions for his family. 

His goal is to find a regular, stable job and secure money for his children to go to school. He appreciates all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to renovate his toilet.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Jacob Town. She is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a security man. They both have six children between ages 13 and 29 years old. 

For the past seven years, she has been selling coal and ice in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal and ice for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coal and ice for her business.

loans.name: Ajrije

texts.en:
Ajrije lives in a minority community in Kosovo. She is married and has three children. Based on family tradition, she works in the agricultural business. Her husband works in construction with a very low salary. 

Ajrije has one cow and a calf. She uses them to sell milk and other milk products in her village, which has a huge demand, and she is able to earn a lot of money this way. 

Ajrije is requesting a loan to buy food for the cow and calf and in order to buy another cow, which will increase her income and expand her business. 

This loan will positively affect her business. Ajrije thanks all of the lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy food for the cow and calf and to buy another cow.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is a 48-year-old married woman from Jubeiha in Jordan. She has four children. She has requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for home improvement expenses. In the future she would like to purchase new furniture and install a heating system.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the poultry house and to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Johaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Johaida works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the buying and selling of scrap. Johaida is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance, used for her motorcycle transport business.

Johaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Daniel Santos

texts.es: Daniel de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa de habitación; él se dedica a la venta de leña desde hace ya varios años, ha ganado mucha experiencia valiosa en las ventas y eso le ha regalado muy buenas ganancias, comercia desde su hogar y también de forma ambulante en diferentes zonas de la comunidad donde vive, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque siempre tiene leña de calidad, a muy buen precio además de servicio excelente; Daniel se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y honestidad, es un hombre emprendedor dedicado a su labor, siempre esta buscando las mejores alternativas que le ayuden a encontrar un futuro mas prospero, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo pues sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, últimamente han aumentado las ventas y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar leña por mayor. Daniel tiene venas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Daniel is 45 years old and lives with his life partner in their house.  He has been selling wood for many years and has gained a lot of valuable experience in sales and this has given him a good income.  He sells from his home and also on foot in the different neighborhoods of the community where he lives.  He already has a large clientele and people prefer his products because the wood is of good quality and price and he provides excellent service.  Daniel is known for his friendliness and honesty, and he is a entrepreneurial man, dedicated to his work.  He is always looking for better alternatives to get himself a more prosperous future.  

Every day, he works as hard as he can because he knows this is the only way to achieve what he wants.  Lately, he has increased his sales, and he wants to take advantage of this with an investment in his business, for which he is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL that would permit him to buy wood in bulk.  Daniel has good references and is very responsible, assuring that he will be able to repay his debt and still be assured of a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Ronaldo y su hijo; ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de cerdo, gallina y chipilín, además  para complementar los gastos del hogar elabora ricos almuerzos, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en la preparación de comidas, gracias a eso obtiene las mejores ganancias, comercia desde su hogar y  ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio; María es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y con muchas metas que desea lograr, quiere ganarse un futuro mas prospero y trabajara duro hasta alcanzar el éxito que tanto desea, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, carnes, verduras, hojas, etc. María del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is 54 years old and lives with her life partner, Ronaldo and her child.  She works selling tamales stuffed with pork, chicken, and chipilín (a local herb).  Another way she helps with the household expenses is by making delicious lunches.  She has been working for several years in the business and has a great deal of experience in food preparation.  Thanks to this work, she has a good income, works from her home, and already has a large customers base.  People prefer her food because everything she makes is of the best quality, at very good prices, and she has good customer service.

María is a hardworking woman, dedicated to her work, and with many goals she hopes to achieve.  She wants to make a future that is more prosperous and works hard to achieve the goals she wants so badly.  In the last few weeks, the demand for her goods has increased and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment, so she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL allowing her to buy corn, meats, vegetables, and leaves, etc.  María del Carmen has good references and a steady moral character which ensures that she will be able to pay back her loan and give her family a satisfying lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy corn, meat, vegetables, and leaves.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquín vive junto a sus hijos, él se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras piña, mango, pepino, naranjas tomate, entre otros, comercia de forma ambulante a través de un puesto mobil, es muy conocido en toda la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque el producto es fresco, de calidad, aun buen precio y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Joaquín se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre dedicado a su labor, enérgico y con muchas metas por alcanzar, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, su mas grande secreto es el esfuerzo y el amor al trabajo sabe que así logrará su objetivo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Joaquín tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Joaquín lives with his children.  He sells fruit and vegetables: pineapple, mango, cucumber, oranges and tomatoes, among others.  He sells from place to place by means of a movable stand.  He’s very well-known in the entire community and has gained a good clientele that prefers him because the products are fresh, top quality and at affordable prices with unequalled service; he’s always at his customers’ disposal.

Joaquín is noted for his great kindness.  He’s an energetic man dedicated to his work who has many goals to reach.  He’s always on the lookout for new opportunities that will make it possible for him to attain success.  His greatest secret is effort and love of work.  He knows that he’ll reach his goal this way.

In recent weeks demand has increased and he wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment which is why he’s asking Integral for a loan to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale.  Joaquín has good payment references and assures that he will be able to repay the loan while trusting that he will provide his family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Reina tiene 49 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposo, es madre de 4 hijos. Reside en el área suburbana del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Reina hace 4 años que estableció su negocio de venta de alimentos los cuales que ella misma prepara. En su negocio vende desayunos, almuerzos, pollo con tajadas de banano, baleadas (comida típica: tortilla de harina de trigo con frijoles y queso) y refrescos.
En la actualidad ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de  10,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de materia prima: carnes, frijoles, arroz, aceite, harina de trigo y refrescos.
Considera que con el préstamo le ayudara para ofrecer variedad de alimentos, en el futuro ella piensa agradar su negocio a través de la instalación de una cafetería.
texts.en:
Reina, age 49, is in a common-law marriage with her husband, and she has four children.  She lives in the suburban area of the San Pedro Sula municipality in the Cortés department.

Four years ago Reina established her business of selling food, which she prepares herself.  In her business she sells breakfast, lunch, chicken with banana slices, “baleadas” (typical food:  a wheat flour tortilla with beans and cheese), and soft drinks.

She is currently requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy raw materials like meat, beans, rice, cooking oil, and soft drinks.

She feels that the loan will help her to offer a variety of food.  In the future she is thinking of expanding her business by setting up a cafeteria.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, flour, cooking oil, and to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Leydi Cristina

texts.es: Leydi Cristina de veintidós años de edad vive junto a sus padres, ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, huevos, leche, pan, jabones, entre otros, adicional a esto para complementar los gastos del hogar atiende un pequeño molino, el negocio esta ubicado en el lugar de su residencia y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; Leydi se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y honestidad, es una mujer joven dedicada a su labor, emprendedora y muy luchadora siempre esta buscando las mejores alternativas que le abran camino a un futuro mas prospero, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo con amor y constancia porque sabe que así logrará el  éxito que tanto desea; en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas y mantenimiento de molino. Leydi Cristina tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leydi Cristina, 22, lives with her parents.  She has a store where she sells basic staples like basic grains, eggs, milk, bread and soap, among others.  In addition to this, she earns extra income to cover household expenses with a small mill.  The business is located at home and she’s acquired a large clientele that prefers her because of the quality, good prices and above all good service.

Leydi is noted for her great kindness and honesty.  She’s a young, enterprising, tenacious woman who is dedicated to her work.  She’s always on the lookout for better alternatives that will open a path to a more prosperous future.  She strives to the maximum degree with love and constancy every day because she knows that’s how she’ll attain the success she so desires.

Demand has increased in recent weeks and she wants to make a new investment which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy basic grains, instant products, snacks, beverages and to service the mill.  Leydi Cristina has good payment references and spotless morals.  She assures that she will be able to repay the loan while at the same time trusts that she’ll provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, snacks, beverages and to service the mill.

loans.name: Lyndiza

texts.en:
Lyndiza is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children. One of her children is in school.

Lyndiza is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lyndiza has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lyndiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is a married mother of one school-going child. Lilian is a food vendor. She bought the premise from another business person and began by purchasing assets which she now uses in the business. The business has been in operation for five years. Apart from this business, she also sells groceries.

Lilian is applying for a loan of 52,300 Kenya shillings to purchase food for the café and grocery stall. Her business faces the slight challenges of seasonal business climate and inflation. 

She would like to own a large hotel in the future through the savings she expects from this loan in the likes of major players in the field in Changamwe.

loans.use: To purchase food for her café and grocery stall.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is 55 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nelida is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nelida has been raising pigs for 8 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling scrap and feed.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 58 years old and married with 5 children.

Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Nida has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Nida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nimfa is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nimfa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nimfa requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other materials for her business.  Nimfa has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Nimfa would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 63 years old and married with four children.

Pilar works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Pilar has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Pilar aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 56 years old, married, and has 4 children. 

Rosalinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, oil, yeast, and baking powder.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca Lidia de cincuenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su nieto en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzado, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en la venta que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia en una zona muy transitada de personas y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Blanca es una mujer dedicada a su labor, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le  ayuden a alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda del producto y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar calzado por mayor. Blanca Lidia tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Blanca Lidia, 56, lives with her life companion and grandson in her own house.  She sells shoes.  She’s been in business for several years and has gained much sales experience that allows her to earn the best profits.  She sells in an area with many passersby and has acquired a large clientele that prefers her because of the quality, good prices and above all excellent service.  

Blanca’s an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s always on the lookout for new opportunities that will help her attain success.  Demand has increased in recent weeks and she wants to take advantage of this making a new investment which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy shoes at wholesale.  Blanca Lidia has good payment references and is very responsible.  She assures that she’ll be able to repay the loan while at the same time has faith that she’ll provide economic security for her home.

loans.use: to buy shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Surmakan

texts.ru:
Сурмакан 56 лет, воспитала 5 детей. После развала Союза, Сурмакан в качестве основного дохода начала занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Сурмакан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова с приплодом, 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 2 лошади, ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 5,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сурмакан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Сурмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить средства на обучение младшего сына, которому сейчас 16 лет.
texts.en: Surmakan is 56 years old and raised five children.  After the breakup of the Union and to provide the primary source of income, she became involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som.  Thanks to Surmakan's hard work, today her business contains one dairy cow with offspring, ten heads of small livestock and two horses, and the monthly income from the business amounts to about 5,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Surmakan requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities in order to save money for her youngest son's education, who is now 16 years old.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
MARIA ELENA tiene 20 años de edad de estado civil unión lire tiene una hija, vive con los suegros y la hija en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

MARIA ELENA se dedica a la crianza de animales, además también vende salchipapas. Solicita el crédito para comprar papas, cebolla, aceite, mayonesa, salchicha, un cilindro de gas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para atender a los clientes en la venta de salchipapas. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprarse una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión, hacer deporte y realizar los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
María Elena is 20 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has a daughter. She lives with her parents-in-law and her daughter in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos province. She is a member of the communal bank 16 de Agosto. located in Recinto de Agua de Mocache, which belongs to the Mocache canton. They perform farming and stockbreeding activities.

María Elena raises livestock, and she also sells salchipapa [a mix of sausages and fries]. She is requesting the loan to buy potatoes, onion, oil, mayonnaise, sausages and a gas cylinder. With the loan's help she will be able to buy the things she lacks in order to better serve her customers in her salchipapa stall. She will buy the supplies in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to buy a house. The challenge she faces is competition. During her free time, she likes to watch television, play sports and take care of the household chores.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onion, oil, mayonnaise, sausages and a gas cylinder.

loans.name: Señor De La Agonia De Taray Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha ella es conviviente y tiene 43 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de artesanía,la socia vende artesanías como muñecas,mantas,mochilas y tejidos,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria en las calles de la distrito de Taray,ella vende a los diferentes turistas nacionales y extranjeros,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene en este negocio 10 años y le va muy bien y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el seuño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender las artesanías. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mantas, muñecas, tejidos y mochilas.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de joyeria, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de ropa y negocio de venta de aretes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These associates are members of the “SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of both the province and department of Cusco.
This member’s name is Martha, 43, and she’s in a common-law relationship and has 4 children. This member’s business is selling crafts. She sells dolls, blankets, back packs and woven items. She sells her merchandise by foot in the streets of the district of Taray. She sells to the different national and international tourists. She works from 8am to 5pm. She’s been running her business for 10 years and it’s going well; with this business she’s been able to get ahead with her children. Her dream is to have a place to sell her crafts. She is requesting a loan to buy blankets, dolls, woven items and back packs.
The members whose photos have been pasted onto the group photo asked permission to have their photos taken later, because of a work conflict. 
The other members are in sales too. They sell jewellery, groceries, clothing and earrings. 
This member is grateful to those who are a part of this dream and she promises to make all of her payments on schedule.

loans.use: buy blankets, dolls, woven items and back packs.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline lives in Mombasa in Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two school-going children. Pauline owns a clothing business, which she has been operating for five years.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are some customers not paying on time and the high cost of inventory.
 
Pauline is applying for a loan of 32,550 KES to purchase additional inventory of second-hand clothes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay for her children’s school fees/education requirements. Her dream is to open a larger boutique/wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Taysir

texts.en: Taysir is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. He is the main income provider of the family and works very hard to be able to handle their expenses. He has been working in the construction field for the past 19 years. He specializes in painting, installing drywall, and completing aluminum work. He is well known in his town and has gained a fair number of clients so far. Today, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase an electrical generator for his business, in addition to some aluminum supplies. This will allow him to do his work competently and present good quality services to his clients. He works on a freelance basis and hopes to take on bigger projects and increase his earnings in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator and aluminum supplies

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children. Both children are in school. She cares for two additional family members, her mother and niece. She sells groundnuts and beans in the market on a retail basis. She has run the business for more than twenty years and she works six days a week. She owns a second stall in the market and she earns some income from people who rent it. Madina has applied for a loan of UGS 500,000 to buy more bags of groundnuts and beans for sale. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. She aspires to buy a delivery van for ease in transportation. She decided to work with MCDT SACCO because they serve low income women. She owns the house where she stays and the family has access to electricity but has no access to piped water. The greatest monthly expenses are paying for electricity and  school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Sino

texts.ru: Сино родился 1991 года. В 1999 году поступил в школу и в 2010 году успешно окончил. В 2012 году он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет факультет Экономия и управления. Данное время он является студентом 1 курс. Он очень способный молодой человек. Сино увлекается спортом и в свободное время читает классическую литературу. Его родители простые рабочие и не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу в этом году. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте вместе поможем молодому специалисту окончить университет и реализовать свои знания в будущем.
texts.en: Sino was born in 1991.  He started school in 1999 and successfully completed it in 2010.  He was accepted to economics and government department of the Tajikistan State University in 2012.  At the present time, he is the first-year student there.  He is a very capable young man.  Sino likes sports and reads classical literature in his free time.  His parents are simple workers and are unable to pay for his education this year.  Sino is requesting this loan to pay for his university education.  He awaits your kindness.  Let's help the young specialist together to finish the university and apply his knowledge in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his university education

loans.name: Flordelyn

texts.en:
Flordelyn is 28 years old, married, and has two children. Flordelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell.

Flordelyn has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Flordelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is 24 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angelica runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Angelica has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Angelica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mirna Manuela

texts.es:
La  Señora Mirna tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Reside en el área urbana del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortes.
Doña Mirna inicio su negocio de pulpería hace 20 años, ella vende leche, huevos, granos básicos, carnes, productos de aseo y limpieza, golosinas, dulces y refrescos.
En la actualidad doña Mirna ha solicitado un crédito por la cantidad de  22,000 Lempiras los que invertirá adquiriendo  mayor inventario para surtir su pulpería.
Considera que con el préstamo le ayudara a aumentar sus ventas ya que dispondrá de variedad de productos alimenticios.
Sus metas a corto y largo plazo son: cancelar sus deudas, ampliar su negocio y remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirna is 60 years old and a single mother of two children. She resides in an urban section of the town of San Pedro Sula, Department of Cortes.

Doña Mirna started her business 20 years ago. She sells milk, eggs, basic grains, meat, cleaning and hygiene products, snacks, candy, and soft drinks.

At the moment, Doña Mirna is requesting a loan in the amount of 22,000 HNL that she will invest in more merchandise to restock her store. She believes the loan will help increase her sales by allowing her to offer a variety of food products. Her goals (both short-term and long-term) are to repay her debts, expand her business, and remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy eggs, meat, dairy products, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Olga Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Olga tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 7 hijos. Reside en el Barrio San Miguel del Municipio de Siguatepeque, Departamento de Comayagua.
Doña Olga es comerciante desde hace 18 años, su negocio es una pulpería donde ofrece a sus clientes alimentos de la canasta básica familiar como: granos básicos, manteca, aceite, pan, azúcar, condimentos y refrescos.
Actualmente ha solicitado  su primer préstamo por la cantidad de  21,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de: carnes, fríjoles, arroz, productos de higiene, aceite, harina de trigo, medicinas de uso común y refrescos.
Considera que el préstamo le ayudara para abrir un historial crediticio con la institución y de esta manera obtener capital de trabajo para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga, 61, is a single mother of seven children.  She lives in the municipality of Siguatepeque’s San Miguel neighborhood in Comayagua Department.

Olga has been a merchant for the last 18 years.  Her business is a grocery store where she sells basic staples like basic grains, lard, oil, bread, sugar, condiments and soft-drinks to her customers.

She’s asking for her first loan, 21,000 Lempiras to buy meat, beans, rice, hygiene products, oil, wheat flour, common use medicines and soft-drinks.

She believes that the loan will help her establish credit history with the institution so that she can get working capital to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Iván Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Iván tiene 44 años de edad, es soltero, reside en una comunidad del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortes.
La actividad económica de Don Iván es Zapatero, confecciona zapatos para caballeros, damas y niños, fabricación de botas y botines para hombre.
Él inicio su oficio desde hace 16 años.  Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima para la confección de calzado como: cuero, hilo, pegamento y suela.
Don Iván piensa que este préstamo le servirá para sacar puntualmente algunos pedidos que tiene encargados.
Sus metas a futuro es invertir en el crecimiento de su negocio y contratar  personal de apoyo.
texts.en: Iván, 44, is single living in a community in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes Department.  Iván is a cobbler.  He manufactures shoes for men, women and children and boots and ankle boots for men.  He started his occupation 16 years ago and is asking for a loan at present for 15,000 Lempiras he plans to use to buy raw materials like leather, thread, glue and soles to make shoes.  Iván believes that this loan will be useful for him to fill pending orders on time.  His future goal is to invest in his business growth and hire support staff.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Justo Leonel

texts.es:
JUSTO LEONEL tiene 22 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene una hija, vive con la conyugue y con la hija.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

JUSTO LEONEL se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, liquido para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprarse un carro. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en las plantas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Justo Leonel is 22 years old. He lives in a common-law marriage and has a daughter. They all live together.

He is a member of the communal bank 16 de Agosto, located in Recinto Agua de Mocache, which belongs to the Mocache canton. They perform stockbreeding and farming activities.

Justo Leonel works in agriculture and stockbreeding. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea and weedkiller.

With the loan's help he will be able to buy everything he needs for his fields. He will buy the supplies in the city of Ventanas.

His dream is to buy a car. The challenge he faces is the plague in his crops. During his free time, he likes to play indoor football.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea and weedkiller.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida is 48 years old and married.

Armida is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Armida has been in business for six years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Armida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mariame

texts.en:
Mariame is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of two school-aged children. Her husband is the one responsible for everything concerning the family and the children’s study fees. He has been employed since the year 2000.  

As for Mariame, she started her own business in 2005. She works as a hairdresser from her house, where she welcomes customers to provide them with beauty services such as hairdressing, makeup, laser, etc. 

Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her inventory of new beauty products and hairdressing supplies. She wishes to earn a higher income to be able to expand her business operations, and open her own hairdressing salon the soonest.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of new beauty products and hairdressing supplies.

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell for her general store business.

Evalyn has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Evalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 19-year-old engaged Lebanese woman living with her parents and three siblings. Wafaa faced bad financial conditions, although she worked hard to show that she is able to enhance her family’s way of living and support her father with their expenses. 

In 2009, Wafaa started to work as a hairdresser. She works from home and visits customers wherever they are located to provide them with her high-quality beauty services. 

This will be her first Kiva loan and she is very thankful for the results she has attained so far. Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew her old tools and purchase a new collection of brushes, hair products, and many other items. In this way, she will be able to improve her business operations and follow up on the new fashions.

loans.use: to renew her old tools and purchase a new collection of brushes, hair products, and many other items.

loans.name: Lelianita

texts.en:
Lelianita is 45 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lelianita has been raising pigs for 9 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
Las 10 integrantes de este grupo cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas se esfuerzan por salir adelante y dar a sus familias lo que necesitan, y es Maura una de estas mujeres, ella tiene un comedor y cuenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día y con mucho sacrificio está saliendo adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, verduras aceite, condimentos, etc, con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y sirviendo comidas de buena calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 10 women in this group engage in various business activities. Each one strives to move forward and provide their families what they need.

Maura is one of these women. She has a diner and works every day starting in the early morning hours. Through great sacrifice, she is able to move forward. Maura is requesting a loan so that she can buy meats, vegetables, oil, condiments, and other supplies that she needs to continue working and serving good-quality food to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meats, vegetables, oil, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Helga Osiris

texts.es:
La señora Helga tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada, tiene hijos. Reside en el área urbana del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Doña Helga se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de alimentos a través de una pulpería. En su negocio dispone de alimentos de la canasta básica como: granos básicos, manteca, aceite, pan, azúcar, medicinas, golosinas, dulces, condimentos y refrescos.
Actualmente ha solicitado  préstamo por la cantidad de  15,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de: carnes, fríjoles, arroz, harina de maíz y refrescos.
Considera que el préstamo le ayudara para surtir bien su negocio y aumentar sus ventas.
Sus metas a futuro consisten en la compra de vitrinas para poder vender achinería, y ofrecer más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Helga, 40, is married and has three children.  She lives in an urban area in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes Department.  Helga has been selling foodstuffs in a grocery store for the past five years.  She stocks basic staples like grains, lard, oil, bread, sugar, medicine, snacks, candy, condiments and soft-drinks.

At present she’s requesting a 15,000 Lempira loan to buy meat, beans, rice, corn flour and soft-drinks.  She believes that the loan will help her better stock her store and increase sales.  Her future goals consist in buying display cases to sell low-cost novelty items and to offer a wider selection of goods.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marvin Arcenio

texts.es:
El señor Marvin tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, reside en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Barbará.
Marvin se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 7 años, específicamente a la siembre de maíz, fríjol y café. Para la producción de fríjol y maíz, él alquila tierra, el café lo ha sembrado en una parcela de tierra propia.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 3,500 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizante y pago de mano de obra en la limpieza de sus cultivos.
Marvin piensa que el préstamo le ayudara a obtener un buen rendimiento en sus cultivos. El planea en el futuro comprar animales de carga (caballos).
texts.en:
Marvin, 22, is single living in a rural community in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara Department.  Marvin has been working in agriculture for the last seven years, specifically growing corn, beans and coffee.  He leases land to grow the beans and corn but has the coffee planted on land of his own.

He’s asking for a 3,500 Lempira loan at present to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs involved in clearing his land.  Marvin believes that the loan will help him obtain good crop yields.  He plans in future to buy beasts of burden (horses).

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: José Arturo

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 44 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos reside en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Taulabe, Departamento de Comayagua.
Don José se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, específicamente a la siembra y producción de café.
Para obtener más ganancia él vende su cosecha de café en pergamino seco. 
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 20,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizante y pago de mano de obra en el trasplante de una hectárea de café.
Don José es muy optimista, piensa seguir aumentando su área de producción de café para obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan apoyar a sus hijos en la educación universitaria.
texts.en: José, 44, is married and has three children; he lives in a rural community in the municipality of Taulabe, Comayagua Department.  José has worked in agriculture for the last 20 years, specifically growing coffee.  To earn higher profits he sells his coffee crops in the dry parchment stage.  He’s currently asking for a 20,000 Lempira loan to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs to transplant one hectare of coffee.  José is very optimistic and plans to continue expanding his coffee growing acreage to earn higher profits so that he can support his children’s university education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs to plant an hectare of coffee.

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es:
CARLOS MIGUEL tiene 50 años de edad de estadio civil soltero no tiene hijos, vive  con la mamá en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

CARLOS MIGUEL se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, ranger, insecticidas, urea, liquido para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar sin ningún problema los fertilizantes. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es tener un negocio donde tenga mayores ingresos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en las plantas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Carlos Miguel is 50 years old. He is single, he has no children and he lives with his mother in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the communal bank 16 de Agosto, located in the rural community of Agua de Mocache, which belongs to the Mocache canton. They perform stockbreeding and agricultural activities.

Carlos Miguel works in agriculture and grows corn. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, herbicide, insecticide, urea and weedkiller.

With the loan's help he will be able to buy fertilizers easily. He will buy the supplies in the city of Ventanas.

His dream is to have a business that gives him a higher income. The challenge he faces is the plagues in his crops. He likes to play football during his free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicide, insecticide, urea and weedkiller.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres Vencedoras. Doña Roselia es originaria de lotificación de Nuevo San Carlos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace varios años, es una persona muy trabajadoras y responsable está solicitando este crédito para la compra de maíz para la elaboración y venta de tortillas, ella espera que por medio de ustedes y por medio de los crédito ella pueda salir adelante.
texts.en: The Winning Women Duo:  Ms Roselia is native of subdivision of Nuevo San Carlos, she works making and selling tortillas for several years now. She is a hard working and responsible person. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of corn for the production and sale of tortillas. She hopes that with your help and this loan, she can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy corn for the production and sale of tortillas.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He owns a café in his town where he welcomes customers from different areas and villages to rest and enjoy their time. He also possesses computers in his café on which people can play games and have fun. He has one full-time employee who benefits from a sufficient salary which helps him improve his way of living. Hasan cooperates financially with his father who owns a car repair shop so as to be able to pay the high costs of living. With his youth loan requested from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will increase his inventory of goods, raw materials and supplies in order to increase his business productivity and therefore his profits. In the future, he plans to expand his business and add a corner into his café where he will start to serve food plates and sandwiches.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of goods, raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 42 years old, married, and has three children.  She works hard to provide for her family. Nida runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years.  She earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Nida is requesting her eighth loan for 20,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy stock to sell in her general store.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes, viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Achumani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente Hernán trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada trabajando por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de la cubierta de su vivienda ya que en tiempos de lluvia gotea mucha agua y por eso quiere cambiarlo y con eso mejorara su calidad de vida. Necesita comprar calaminas, que son láminas de un metal especial que se usa mucho en Bolivia, para cubrir los techos de las casas.
El sueño de Hernán, es construir más habitaciones para poder acoger a sus hijos y brindarles comodidad.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Hernán’s married and has two children who are independent now.  They live in his own, three-bedroom house located in the city of La Paz’s Achumani zone.

Hernán is currently employed by a private firm and works more than 8 hours per day because he must cover food and basic utility costs for his family.

He needs the loan to repair his roof because when it rains much water comes in because there are many leaks and that’s why he wants to replace it to improve his quality of life.  He needs to buy ‘calaminas’ which are sheets of special metal widely used in Bolivia to roof houses.  

His dream is to add more bedrooms to house his children and provide comfort for them.  This is his second Impro loan request and first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to repair the leaking roof.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 63 años de edad, está casada, tiene 8 hijos. Reside junto a su esposo y un nieto en sector Chamelecon del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento del Cortés.
Doña María desde hace 37 años que se dedica a la venta de alimentos que ella misma prepara como ser: desayunos, almuerzos, pollo con tajadas de banano verde, pastelitos, golosinas y refrescos.
Actualmente ha solicitado  préstamo por la cantidad de  20,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de materia prima: aceite, verduras, carnes, condimentos y refrescos.
Considera que el préstamo le ayudara a desarrollar más el negocio y a mantener su clientela satisfecha.
Su meta personal es sentirse útil a la sociedad, ser un buen ejemplo a su familia y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María, 63, is married and has 8 children.  She lives with her husband and a grandson in the city of San Pedro Sula’s Chamelecon sector, Cortés Department.

María has been selling food like breakfast, lunch, chicken with fried plantain, turnovers, snacks and soft-drinks she prepares herself for the last 37 years.  

At present she’s requesting a 20,000 Lempira loan to buy raw materials like oil, vegetables, meat, condiments and soft-drinks.

She believes the loan will help her develop the business more and keep her customers satisfied.

Her personal goal is to feel useful to society, to set a good example for her family and to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like chicken, beef and oil.

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Kadiatou a plus de 49 ans mariée et mère de sept  enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Madame Kadiatou après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité de commercialisation des  céréales il y a environ quatorze ans. Elle dispose une place au marché de Sanoubougou I à Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est est à son troisième prêt individuel, le deux prêt précédents ont été correctement remboursé.  
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 20 sacs de riz et 25 sacs de Mil. Elle achète  les céréales auprès des grossistes de Sikasso avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes de ménages et des chefs de famille.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Kadiatou is more than 49 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children. She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional extended family in Sanoubougou I, one of the popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso.

After having tried many businesses without success, Kadiatou began her current business of selling cereals around 14 years ago. She operates a space in the market of Sanoubougou I in Sikasso. In order to be able to meet the growing needs of her customers, she decided to work with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her third individual loan, the first two having been fully repaid.

Kadiatou plans to use this loan to purchase 20 bags of rice and 25 bags of millet. She purchases the cereals from wholesalers in Sikasso and then resells them at retail to a customer base made up generally of housekeepers and family cooks. She estimates she will earn a monthly income of 200,000 francs CFA with this loan, which will be used to increase her business capital, to contribute toward her family's expenses, and to pay off the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1970 à Nimporodioula préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur Issa est polygame avec 4 épouses et père de six enfants. Il réside avec ses quatre femmes et leurs enfants à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture, il s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage et commercialisation du poids sucré, noix de karité et de céréales depuis plus de 10 ans. 
Issa jouit d’une forte réputation et reçoit beaucoup de commandes de l’extérieur, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ses besoins font défaut. Alors, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quatre années  et a déjà bénéficié de quatre prêts qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il sollicite ainsi ce cinquième prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter 20 sacs de poids sucré, 4 tonnes de maïs, 15 sacs de mil et 15 sacs de noix de karité. 
Il s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso pour ensuite les stocker dans son magasin, afin de les ramène à Abidjan et à Bobo Dioulasso (respectivement les république de Côte d’Ivoire et Burkina Faso) sur commande des usines de fabrique de jus de poids sucré et de beure de karité. Pour les céréales, elles sont vendues sur place à la fois en gros et en détail.    
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 275 000 FCFA. Avec le bénéfice réalisé, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in the Nimporodioula district of Sikasso, Issa is polygamous with 4 wives and 6 children. He lives with his four wives and their children in Medine, one of the more popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso. After having tried several other businesses, such as agriculture, without success, Issa quickly immersed himself in the business of stocking and reselling bulk quantities of sugar, shea nuts, and cereals, has been doing so for the last 10 years.

Issa has a solid reputation and receives many orders from outside the region, but he lacks the necessary resources to be able to meet all these requests. As a result, he began working with Soro Yiriwaso around four years ago and has already received four loans, all of which were fully repaid.

In order to better meet his growing customers' needs, Issa is requesting his fifth loan which will allow him to purchase 20 bags of sugar, 4 loads of corn, 15 bags of millet and 15 bags of shea nuts. He stocks up in the surrounding regions of Sikasso to be able to stock his store, and to eventually send the supplies to Abidjan and Bobo Dioulasso (located in Côte d’Ivoire and Burkina Faso, respectively) upon orders from sugar and shea butter factories. The cereals are sold on site at both wholesale and retail.

With this loan, Issa plans on earning a monthly profit of 275,000 francs CFA. With the profit earned, he hopes to take care of his essential expenses, those of his family, paying off the interest on his loan, and investing the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Irma Elena

texts.es: Irma de 55 años de edad, es una mujer responsable, alegre y muy querida por las personas que consumen sus productos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, las cuales están elaboradas a base de maíz y que son fundamentales en cada comida, por lo que este es un negocio estable y retribuyente. Irma vive junto a su madre, una hija, su nieto y yerno, su hija le ayuda con la venta de tortillas, permitiéndole entregarlas en menos tiempo lo que llama la atención de más clientes. Irma solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar leña, maíz, cal para lavar y cocina los granos básicos y así de esta manera contar con más clientes y por ende mejorar notoriamente sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Irma, age 55, is a responsible and cheerful woman. She is well-liked among the people who consume her products. Irma makes corn tortillas which are a staple in every meal. For this reason, her business is stable and profitable. Irma lives with her mother, her daughter, her grandson, and her son-in-law. Her daughter helps her with selling tortillas, which enables her to devote less time to attending to her customers.

Irma is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy firewood, corn, and lime powder for washing and cooking the corn. This will help her gain more customers and significantly improve her earnings in the end.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, and lime powder.

loans.name: Mirvate

texts.en:
Mirvate is a 39-year-old single Lebanese woman. She lives on her own. 

Mirvate works as a private teacher and has almost five years of experience. She likes her occupation and wishes to help her students get the necessary education. She has arranged a special room in her house where she teaches her students. Mirvate also works in parallel at a local company to supplement her income.

Today, Mirvate is looking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate the teaching room at her house and equip it with the needed tools and supplies. She notes that these changes will increase her probability of receiving additional students, which will therefore increase her income and thus improve her way of living. She might get married in the near future and have a family and children. This is one of her greatest dreams.

loans.use: to renovate the teaching room at her house and equip it with the needed tools and supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Chuchie

texts.en:
Ma. Chuchie is 49 years old and married with seven children.

Ma. Chuchie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Ma. Chuchie has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending and raising chickens.

Ma. Chuchie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and a general store. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
Yola es casada y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos están en etapa escolar y uno ya es independiente, viven en casa de su suegra ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas al día en una empresa pública como abogada y con lo que gana debe aportar en los pagos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que le será de mucha ayuda en su trabajo y también en los estudios a sus hijos.
El sueño de Yola es mejorar sus ingresos para adquirir una casa en anticrético para dar más comodidad a sus hijos.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Yola’s married and has three children two of which are school age and one who is independent already.  They live in her mother-in-law’s house occupying two bedrooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s 14 de Septiembre zone.

She’s currently employed as a lawyer in a public firm working more than 8 hours daily.  She must cover food, education and basic utility costs for her family with her salary.

She needs the loan to buy a computer that will be of great help for her work and also for her children’s school work.

Yola’s dream is to improve her income so that she can get a house in the ‘anticrético’ [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] to provide more comfort for her children.  

This is her second Impro loan request and second with Kiva too.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Matilde Cecibell

texts.es:
MATILDE CECIBELL tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con los hijos y el esposo en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

MATILDE CECIBELL se dedica a la agricultura, además se dedica a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, liquido para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es tener un pequeño terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y pestes en las plantas y animales.

En el tiempo libre le gusta ver novelas y cuidar a los animales.
texts.en:
Matilde Cecibell is 39 years old and has 3 children with her common-law husband. She lives with her children and her husband in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She belongs to the 16 de Agosto communal bank which is located in the Recinto Agua de Mocache in the canton of Mocache. The bank's members work in agriculture and livestock. 

Matilde Cecibell works in agriculture, but she also works rearing animals. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea and weedkiller. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for her crops. She will buy these supplies in the city of Ventanas. 

Her dream is to own a small plot of land. The main challenges which she faces are plagues and pests in her plants and animals. In her free time, she likes to watch soap operas and look after her animals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea and weedkiller.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Zaida  posee un negocio de venta de verduras en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace ocho años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia que está compuesta por su esposo y dos  hijos de edades siete y tres años.

Doña Zaida  se traslada a su puesto de trabajo desde las 4:30 am para abrir a las 5:00 am  y cierra su negocio a las 2:00pm. Labora de lunes a domingo  en este mismo horario Ella compra su producto a mayorista que viajan a la ciudad de Managua dos veces por semana. 

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo quiere para comprar papa, cebolla, chiltoma, chayote, zanahoria y cálala para ser comercializados en  su negocio,  y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de productos y precios más accesibles para satisfacer la demanda, lo cual tendría mayores ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida tanto de ella como de su familia. Su sueño es que continúe creciendo  su negocio para ayudar a la formación de sus pequeños Hijos.
texts.en:
