Zaida owns a business selling vegetables in a market in the city of León. She has been working there for eight years. This business helps Zaida to support her family, which includes her husband and their two children, ages 7 and 3.

Zaida arrives to work each day at 4:30 a.m. in order to open at 5 a.m. and close at 2 p.m. She works Monday-Sunday with this schedule. Zaida buys her vegetables in bulk from wholesalers who come to her city from Managua twice a week. 

The loan that Zaida is requesting from CEPRODEL will help her to buy potatoes, onions,  chiltoma (sweet peppers), chayote (pear squash), carrots, and other vegetables that she will be able to sell. With this loan, she hopes to offer her customers a wider variety of produce at more competitive prices to meet the demands of the market. This will help her increase her earnings and improve the quality of life for her family. Her dream is to continue expanding her business in order to help raise her small children.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, sweet peppers, pear squash, carrots, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela de 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar y por las tardes a ayudarle con el negocio. Ángela posee una tienda de productos varios como granos básicos, sopas, jugos, sodas, pan, huevos, camisas, shorts y otros más, Con mucho esfuerzo ella ha ido invirtiendo poco a poco en el crecimiento de la tienda con el fin de obtener mayores ganancias. Ángela solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de contar con el dinero para comprar productos por mayor y de esta forma poder obtenerlos a menores precios, lo cual sería de mucho beneficio para el negocio debido a que podrá ganar más por productos y al mismo tiempo surtir la tienda y contar con más clientes. De esta forma Ángela espera mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Ángela, age 31, lives with her husband and two children who are in school. In the afternoons, her children help with the business. Ángela has a store where she sells various products such as basic grains, soups, juices, sodas, bread, eggs, shirts, shorts, and other items. With the great amount of effort she has invested, Ángela has been able to expand her store gradually and generate more income in the end.

She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she will have the money to buy products in bulk and at a lower price. This will be a great benefit for her business because she will be able to acquire more products, keep her store stocked, and gain more customers. As a result, Ángela hopes to improve her family’s finances.

loans.use: to buy food products for her store.

loans.name: Danessa Elizabeth

texts.es: Danessa Elizabeth de veintiséis años de edad vive junto a sus padres, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cortinas, de muchos diseños que ella misma crea, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en la venta que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, su negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda y es muy conocido por las personas de la comunidad donde viven,  tiene mucha clientela y la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos  precios y sobre todo por  un buen servicio; Danessa es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a  su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños ,  todos los días trabaja duro para poder alcanzar el éxito y no piensa rendirse hasta lograrlo, quiere acrecentar el negocio y para ello necesita de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas por mayor. Danessa Elizabeth tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y  la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Danessa Elizabeth is 26 years old and lives with her parents.  She works making and selling curtains of many designs which she herself has created.  She has been doing this work for several years and this has given her a lot of experience in sales, allowing her to make a better income.  Her business is located in her home and it is very well known by people in the community where she lives.  She has a good customer base who prefer her shop for the quality, the good prices, and above all for the good service.

Danessa is a hardworking young woman who is dedicated to her work and really wants to get ahead and achieve her dreams.  Every day she works hard to be able to gain success and she never considers giving up before she's gotten there.  She wants to expand her business and for that she needs capital to back her, so she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL which would allow her to buy fabrics in bulk.  Danessa Elizabeth has good references and a good moral character, assuring that she will repay her debts and at the same time be able to bring her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Paulina

texts.es: Maria paulina de 29 años de edad, es originaria de San Martin Jilotepeque, ella se dedica a la venta de medicina natural y a la venta de cosméticos desde hace varios años, está contenta porque poco a poco su negocio a ido creciendo, es por eso que está solicitando este crédito para la compra de medicina natural y cosméticos,  ya que necesita más capital para negociar ya que su mayor anhelo es superarse y tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en: Maria Paulina is 29 years old and is originally from San Martín Jilotepeque.  She has worked for several years selling natural medicines and cosmetics, and she is satisfied because her business continues to grow little by little.  This is why she is asking for a loan to buy natural medicines and cosmetics since she needs more money to do business with and her greatest dream is to have a larger storefront.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 34-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children at their modest house located in one of the beautiful Lebanese villages. Ahmad spent the last ten years in installing electricity. But he’s not the only one covering the family expenses; his wife, who prepares homemade food, is considered a good source of income for the family as well. Ahmad has also a parallel job; he works as an electrician at a local company. Ahmad always wanted to better develop his business and improve his work, but until now he has earned a barely fair income. For that reason he decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase an electrical generator for his business. He confirms that the loan will help him increase his projects and thus his income by 15%. And as Ahmad works independently, he wishes to have his own electrical equipment shop the soonest in order to keep on responding to his family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator for his business

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 45 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Victoria has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Ma. Victoria is borrowing 19500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is 32 years old and married with two children.

Remelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery stock to sell.

Remelyn has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Remelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy groceries and food stocks to sell.

loans.name: Ardita

texts.en:
Ardita is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs and chickens in the Philippines. Ardita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins.

Ardita has been raising pigs and chickens for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia works hard to support three children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Cecilia has requested a loan of 4600 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours, even after nightfall. Ma. Cecilia is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing the health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a blacksmith business in the Philippines.

Ponciana is borrowing 1800 PHP through NWTF to buy an envirofit cookstove. She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Ponciana is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing the health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, una residente de la ciudad de Barranquilla, tiene 48 años y trabaja en la venta de almuerzos, cerveza y ron, un negocio que ha tenido desde hace 20 años. Ella inició su negocio en el municipio de Soledad, al sur de Barranquilla, comprando un enfriador para vender cervezas, almuerzos, y licor, pero después de 9 años ella y su familia se mudaron a un barrio de Barranquilla que se llama La Playa. Esta ubicación es mejor porque es un lugar turístico donde la gente se acerca a bañar en La Ciénaga, una laguna costera. Ahora vende sus productos a vecinos y visitantes desde un lugar fijo que logró comprar después de muchos años de venta. 
Ahora, María está aplicando a un préstamo de Kiva para comprar un congelador y almacenar sus  productos. También quiere comprar un mayor número de cervezas directamente al camión, que es más barato y no usar la intermediación. Ella piensa que va a poder vender más cervezas si puede refrigerarlas, porque la gente siempre busca cervezas bien frías. María  espera que, con el aumento de ingresos por este crédito, pueda arreglar su casa, donde vive con su esposo, un hijo de 34 años y una hija de 11 años, para mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y sentirse mucho mas feliz al lado de su familia a quienes ama.
texts.en:
Maria, a resident of the city of Barranquilla, is 48 years old and works selling lunches, beers, and rum, a business she has had for 20 years. She began her business in the municipality of Soledad, to the south of Barranquilla, purchasing a refrigerator to sell beer, lunches, and liquor, but after 9 years her family and her moved to Barranquilla to a neighborhood called La Playa. This location is better because it is a touristic location where the people go to swim in La Cienaga, a coastal lake. Now she sells her products to neighbors and visitors from a fixed location that she succeeded in purchasing after many years selling there.

Now Maria is applying for a Kiva loan to purchase a freezer to store her products. She also wants to purchase a greater number of beer directly from the truck, which is cheaper and has no intermediary. She thinks she will be able to sell more beer if she can refrigerate them, because people always want cold beer. Maria hopes that with the increase in her income because of this loan, she can improve her home, where she lives with her husband, a son of 34 years of age, and an 11 year old daughter, to be able to improve the room conditions and to feel happier at the side of the family who she loves.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to store her products

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es soltero, pero convive con su pareja ya hace 12 años y tiene tres hijos que están en etapa escolar, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de estuco y el piso es de tablones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Alto Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleado en venta de parabrisas ya hace cinco años, percibiendo un salario mensual, la esposa trabaja como niñera en una casa particular, dejan a sus bebes en compañía de una guardería durante 8 horas, ambos corren con los gastos de educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de parabrisas al por mayor, pues desea incursionar  en la venta de parabrisas en forma independiente y poder tener un ingreso mayor y mejorar su actual.
El sueño de Eduardo es adquirir su propio negocio de venta de parabrisas y poder abrir también un a sucursal en la ciudad de El Alto y toda la ciudad y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Eduardo is single, but he has lived with his partner for 12 years. They have three children who are of school age. Eduardo lives at his parents’ house which consists of two rooms that have stucco walls and wood plank floors. The house is located in the District of Alto Miraflores in the city of La Paz.

Eduardo has worked as a clerk for five years, selling windshields. He receives a monthly salary. His partner works as a nanny at a private home. They leave their children at a day care center for eight hours. Both of them take responsibility for the educational expenses and the cost of basic services for their family.

Eduardo is requesting a loan so that he can buy windshields in bulk because he wants to start selling these products on his own so that he can earn more income and improve his financial standing. His dream is to acquire his own business of selling windshields and then open a branch store in the city of El Alto and in other locations. In the end, he hopes to improve his quality of life.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy windshields in bulk that he can sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and two of her children go to school. She has one additional family member, her mother. 

Harriet operates a restaurant at the market. She operates her business in a room that she rents. She has been in this business for the last two years and works seven days a week. 

Harriet has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy 50kg of rice, flour, beef, and bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build her own house and to own a fully stocked restuarant. She lives in a rented house where her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize flour, bunches of green bananas, and beef.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married and has five children. She has a fish selling business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda is requesting a loan for 1,800 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy a solar lamp. She is purchasing the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.  Rosalinda is aware that by using a solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sandra Marcela

texts.es: Sandra tiene 24 años y vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, trabajando en el diseño y confección de vestidos de baño y accesorios. Ella tiene 2 años de experiencia en este negocio, que inició después de estudiar el Diseño de Moda a nivel profesional en la Universidad. Su negocio ha sido su proyecto de vida y está muy feliz en su trabajo. Ella vende sus vestidos de baño en ferias, por redes sociales, y amigos. Sandra en el pasado ya había tomado un préstamo de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, lo cual la ayudo a obtener más capital y aumentar su producción, y ahora quiere su segundo crédito de Kiva para seguir adelante así, comprando más insumos como telas, hilos, accesorios, para nuevos diseños de vestidos de baño, porque  Sandra tiene grandes sueños, como el de tener una marca conocida a nivel nacional. Ahora esta soltera, pero le gustaría tener una familia y una casa propia, y por eso sigue trabajando y soñando con su prosperidad.
texts.en: Sandra is 24 years old and she lives in the town of Barranquilla. She engages in designing and creating bathing suits and accessories. She has been running this activity for 2 years, and she started it after having studied Fashion Design at a professional level at the University. Her activity is her life project, and she is very happy with her job. She sells her bathing suits in the fairs, through social networks and to her friends. Sandra has requested a loan to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the past, and this has helped her increase her working capital and her production. She is now requesting her second loan to Kiva in order to keep on carrying out her activity by buying more products for her new bathing suits designs. Sandra dreams big, as she dreams of owning a national renowned brand. She is currently single but she would like to have a family and a house of her own, and for this reason she keeps on working and dreaming of her success.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, and accessories for new bathing suit designs

loans.name: Irma Esperanza

texts.es:
Irma, está decidida a continuar trabajando con préstamos para poder realizar mejoras al negocio, ella está interesada en comprar un nuevo pedido de joyas de oro, aretes, pulseras, anillos, cadenas, que son las prendas que comúnmente vende su negocio, este préstamo le ayudará para mantener surtido de nuevos estilos y variar los precios en las joyas.

Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logró ganar nueva clientela y al mismo tiempo mejorar sus ventas, hasta el momento su negocio ha sido rentable, en su hogar sus condiciones se mantiene estables, en la salud todos se encuentran bien.
texts.en:
Irma has decided to continue working with loans so that she can improve her business. She is interested in placing a new order for gold jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, rings, chains, and other pieces that are commonly sold in her business. This loan will help her maintain a stock of jewelry that are of new styles and have various price points.

Irma says that her previous loan enabled her to gain new customers and improve her sales. As of this date, her business has been profitable. Her conditions at home remain stable and everyone in her family is healthy and doing well.

loans.use: to buy earrings, bracelets, rings, and chains.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and three of her children go to school. She also has additional family members, her elderly parents. 

Sylvia sells sweet bananas at the market. She operates her business on retail basis and has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. 

Sylvia has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of sweet bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a whole seller, to buy a delivery van to make transportation easier, and to build a house. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of sweet bananas.

loans.name: Franz

texts.es:
Franz es sastre en una sastrería de la ciudad de La Paz y vive en la zona de Vino Tinto con su esposa y uno de sus hijos. Trabaja más de ocho horas al día y requiere el crédito para la compra de una máquina de coser con el objetivo de poder llevarse trabajo a casa y tener unos ingresos extras, para empezar a tener una clientela propia y así poder independizarse.

Por el momento es el único sostén de su familia. El sueño de Franz es poder abrir una sastrería propia.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y con KIVA.
texts.en:
Franz is a tailor in a tailoring shop in the city of La Paz, and lives in the Vino Tinto area with his wife and one of his children. He works more than eight hours a day, and needs a loan in order to buy a sewing machine. 

His objective is to be able to take work home and have some extra income, in order to begin to have his own clientele and be able to work independently.

At this time he is the sole support of his family. Franz's dream is to be able to open his own tailoring shop. It is the first time that he has applied for a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine so that he can start working as a tailor from his home.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rowena is borrowing 1800 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours after nightfall. Rowena is aware that by using the solar lamp she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing the health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar lamp.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a business buying and selling dried and fermented fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Lolita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana se dedica al comercio desde los 20 años es por eso que tiene mucha experiencia en este rango, actualmente esta iniciando en la venta de ropa para los días que se pone lenta la venta de comida, tener otro negocio donde obtener ingresos y así poder solventar los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos.
La solicitante esta pidiendo esta pidiendo un préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de materia prima para elaborar su comida típica mexicana como es tacos menudo.
Con la ganancia que obtendrá del negocio planea pagar el crédito
texts.en: Adriana has worked in sales for 20 years, so she has a lot of experience in this post. Currently, she is getting into clothing sales for those days when her food sales business is slow. By having another income-producing business, she will be able to cover the expenses of her household and children. The borrower is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of ingredients for preparing her typical Mexican food, like tacos and menudo. She plans to pay back her loan with the profits she will make from her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Ellene

texts.en:
Ellene is 31 years old,  married, and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  Ellene runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Ellene is requesting her seventh loan for 14,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy stocks to sell in her general store.  Ellene aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stocks and food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorized plow and plastic for greenhouses

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 49 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past ten years Erma has sold fish in the Philippines. She is applying for a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy extra fish to sell.

Erma’s ambition is to grow her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy extra fish to sell.

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es:
El señor Hernán  tiene 62 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 4 hijos, reside en el Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Barbará en compañía de su esposa, una hija y 2 nietos 
Don Hernán se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años, él produce café, maíz y frijoles.
En la actualidad solicito su primer crédito por la suma de 10,000 Lempiras con el fin de conocer los servicios que la institución brinda. Además espera invertir el capital en la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y en el pago de mano de obra para la limpieza de la finca.
Don Hernán espera obtener un mayor rendimiento para aumentar la cantidad de producto que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Hernán is 62 years old. He is in a common-law relationship with his wife and they have four children. Hernán resides in the town of Nueva Frontera in the Department of Santa Barbará with his wife, a daughter, and two grandchildren.

Don Hernán has been a farmer for 30 years. He produces coffee, corn, and beans. At the moment, he is requesting his first loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL now that he has become familiar with the services that ODEF provides. He plans to invest this capital in the purchase of fertilizers and compost, as well as pay the cost of labor to clear his farmland.

Don Hernán expects to obtain a better yield so that he can increase the quantity of products that he offers to his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost and to pay the labor costs for clearing his farmland.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is married and has one child.  She is a resident of Changamwe of Coast province, Kenya. Gertrude owns a food cafe, which she has run for two years. To earn additional income, she owns a telecommunications dealership.
 
Gertrude is requesting a loan for 21,100 KES, which she will use to purchase cooking utensils and foodstuffs such as cereals, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of the family. She aspires to be a wholesaler of cereals in future

Gertrude learned about Milango through an employee with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are the lack of capital and lack of on time payments from her debtors.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils and foodstuffs such as cereals and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nora María

texts.es:
La señora Nora María  posee un negocio de venta de calzado  ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace once años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo uno está  bajo su responsabilidad. Sale de su casa de habitación a las 5:30 am, abre su negocio a las 6:00 am y finalizando sus labores a las 4:00 pm. Inicio su  negocio ambulante con un capital producto de ahorro y préstamos.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar al  por mayor aprovechando de esta manera una oferta con precios rebajados. Esto permitirá ofrecerle a su clientela precios más accesibles satisfaciendo la demanda, así obteniendo mayores ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida tanto de ella como de su familia. 

Los sueños de Doña Nora  es que su hijo logre  coronar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Nora María has been selling shoes for 11 years, from a locale in one of the markets in the city of Leon. She runs this business so she can take home income to support her family. She has three children, but only one is under her care. She leaves her house in the morning at 5:30am, she opens her shop at 6:00am and finishes work at 4:00pm. 
She started her business with capital from her savings and through loans.
The loan she is requesting from CEPRODEL will be used to buy wholesale shoes in order to take advantage of the reduced pricing. This permits her to offer her shoes at more accessible prices to satisfy the demand and to generate more income, which will improve her and her family’s quality of life.
One of Nora’s dreams is for her son to have a professional career.

loans.use: buy flip flops, shoes, sandals and parasols.

loans.name: Kimanzi

texts.en:
Kimanzi is a married man with one young child. He has a small store where he sells compact discs (CDs). He has various types of CDs, ranging from movies to songs. Kimanzi has been in this business since 2007. In addition to this business, he also has a motorcycle taxi. 

He says that he has been able to achieve some of the goals that he set. 

WIth this loan, Kimanzi intends to purchase more CDs and also spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase more CDs and spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Norhaina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Norhaina works hard to support her family. She makes dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing and buying and selling rice and charcoal. Norhaina is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish for her dried-fish business.

Norhaina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for her business

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
La señora Tania es comerciante de abarrotes en un mercado de la ciudad de La Paz (tiene un puesto donde vende arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas, etc.); su nivel de educación es secundario, tiene una hija con quien vive en casa de sus abuelos ocupando una habitación en un acabado ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de la Paz.

Tania, trabaja más de 12 horas al día, para cubrir los gastos de agua, luz, educación de su hija ya que es la única que cubre todos los gastos de su familia.

El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de mercadería, pues desea comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros al por mayor para mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Tania es vivir en casa propia ya que actualmente vive en casa de sus abuelos y que termine sus estudios su hija, también mejorar más la calidad de vida de su hija y de ella.

Es la segunda vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Tania is a grocery merchant in a market in the city of La Paz.  She has a stand where she sells rice, noodles, canned goods, etc.  She has a secondary school educational level and has a daughter she lives with in her grandparents’ house occupying a single bedroom with brick walls and cement floor located in the city of La Paz’s Sopocachi zone.

Tania works more than 12 hours daily to cover water, electricity and her daughter’s education costs since she’s the only one who covers expenses for her entire family.  She needs the loan to increase her merchandise because she wants to buy rice, sugar, noodles and others at wholesale to improve her income.

Tania’s dream is to live in a house of her own since she currently lives in her grandparents’ and that her daughter completes her schooling; she also wants to improve her and her daughter’s quality of life.  This is her second Impro loan and first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and noodles at wholesale for subsequent resale in her market stand.

loans.name: Carlos Isrrael

texts.es:
CARLOS ISRRAEL tiene 30 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

CARLOS ISRRAEL se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, liquido para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas y en Mocache. 

El sueño es comprarse un carro. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades y las plagas en las plantas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly.
texts.en:
Carlos Isrrael is 30 years old. He is single and doesn't have any children. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, which is in the province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the "16 de Agosto" communal bank, which is located in the Agua de Mocache rural community in the canton of Mocache. They earn their livings working in the farming and livestock industries.

Carlos Isrrael works in agriculture and raises animals. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid herbicides. 

With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops. He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas and in Mocache.

Carlos Isrrael's dream is to buy himself a car. The challenges he faces are plant diseases and infestations.

In his free time, Carlos Isrrael likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid herbicides.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es casado y tiene tres hijos, uno que esta en etapa escolar y  dos en la universidad, vive en una casa bastante humilde en la zona de Tupac Amaru de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como transportista por poco más de diez horas al día ya que es el único que mantiene su hogar.
El crédito lo requiere para poner un muro de contención en su casa para protegerse de la lluvia, para lo cual necesita comprar ladrillos, cemento y arena.
El sueño de Juan es dar a su familia una casa donde puedan vivir más tranquilos sin preocupaciones climáticas.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan is married and has three children. One is school-age, and two are at university. He lives in a rather modest home in the Tupac Amaru area of the city of La Paz. Currently he works as a truck driver for more than 10 hours a day, as he is the sole support of his household. 

He needs a loan in order to build a retaining wall on his property as protection from the rain. For this, he needs to buy bricks, cement, and sand. 

Juan's dream is to give his family a home where they can live more comfortably without weather concerns. This is the fourth time that he has applied for a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bricks cement and sand, in order to build a retaining wall on his property as protection from the rain.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a resident of Changamwe of Coast province, Kenya. She is a mother of one child who goes to school. Mildred runs a food stall, a business that she has been operating for ten years. In this business, she sells potatoes in wholesale. 

She learned about Milango through an employee and aims to access credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main business challenge is the high cost of foodstuffs.

Mildred is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stocks of flour, beans, charcoal, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to build a residential house. She aspires to open a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of flour, beans, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Zenaida works hard to support her family. She has a goldsmith business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Zenaida is borrowing 14,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials for her goldsmith business.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her goldsmith business

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
JULIO CESAR tiene 48 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Rios.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

JULIO CESAR se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, insecticidas,líquido mata monte.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es tener un medio de transporte propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en las plantas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 48 years old. He is in a common-law relationship and has three children. He lives with his wife and his children in the city of Ventanas, in De Los Rios province. 

He is a member of the "16 de Agosto" communal bank, located in the rural settlement of Agua de Mocache, which is part of Mocache Canton. He farms and raises livestock. 

Julio Cesar is a farmer, growing corn and raising animals. He is applying for the loan in order to buy urea fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, and herbicides. 

With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops. He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to have his own means of transportation. The challenges he faces are plant pests. In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: To buy urea fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
El señor Braulio trabaja como transportista y además trabaja como contador; su nivel de educación es técnico superior, tiene cuatro hijos vive casa propia ocupa dos habitaciones en un acabado ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Central de la ciudad de la Paz.

Braulio, trabaja  más de 8 horas al día, para cubrir los gastos de agua, luz, alimentación.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar estuco, lija y pintura para el acabado fino de una habitación para mejorar su calidad de vida, comprara estuco, pintura, puerta y ventana.Con un préstamo anterior pudo terminar la obra fina de la facha de la casa.

El sueño de Braulio es terminar la obra fina de su casa.

Es la quinta vez que saca crédito con IMPRO y la quinta vez con Kiva.
texts.en:
Braulio works in transportation and also as an accountant.  His level of education is higher technical.  He has four children and lives in his own two-bedroom house with brick walls and cement floors located in the central district of the city of La Paz.

Braulio works more than 8 hours daily to cover water, electricity and food costs.  He needs the loan to buy stucco, sandpaper and paint to do the finishing touches in a bedroom to improve his quality of life.  He will buy stucco, paint, a window and a door.  With a previous loan he was able to finish the final touches on the house.  

Braulio’s dream is to finish the fine touches on his house.  This is his 5th Impro loan and 5th with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stucco, sandpaper and paint to do the finishing touches on a bedroom.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 56 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more food stuff and grocery items to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Victoria would like to to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more food stuff and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from selling frozen foods.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Arlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from poultry. Arlyn is borrowing 13000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Arlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom go to school. Her sister and brother live with her as well. They live in a rented house with access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

For the last eight years Farida has sold charcoal at the market seven days a week. She also adds to her income by selling piped water. Transportation and the weather are her main challenges.

Farida is applying for a 400,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy extra bags of charcoal to sell. Her ambitions are to build a house and become a charcoal wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy extra bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who catches and sells fish in the Philippines. She has already paid off one loan through NWTF and is now applying for a second in the amount of 14,000 PHP. She will use it to buy fishing gear and other equipment for fishing.

NWTF is listing this second loan application in support of Rosalie's efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 49 years old, married, and has two children. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Teresa has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past to sustain her business.

She requested a loan of 11000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Maryury Elizabeth

texts.es:
MARYURY ELIZABETH tiene 32 años de edad es soltera tiene una hija, vive con la hija y la madre en la ciudad de ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

MARYURY ELIZABETH se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en la agricultura. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprarce un carro. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en las plantas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y basket.
texts.en:
Maryury Elizabeth is 32 years old, single with one daughter.  She lives with her daughter and mother in the city of Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

She is a member of the “VRC AUGUST 16” group, which is located in the Mocache Water Campus that belongs to Canton Mocache.  The group works in agriculture and livestock.

Maryury Elizabeth is dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry work. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea [fertilizer] and anti-weed liquid.

With the help of this loan, she can invest in the agriculture. She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to buy a car.  The challenges she faces are insect plages in plants.
In her free time, she enjoys playing indoor soccer and basketball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea [fertilizer] and anti-weed liquid.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 33 years old and married with two children.

Susan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like canned goods, bread, candies and other groceries.

Susan has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Susan aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like canned goods, bread, candies and other groceries.

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Minata est une veuve de 56 ans et vivant avec ses 4 enfants dans la grande famille de son défunt mari à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso. 
Minata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, elle s’est initié à cette activité de restauration il  y’a environ six ans. Elle mène son activité devant une école tous les jours où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle composée d’ élèves et de professeurs pour la qualité de ses plats. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’un an. Après deux prêt individuel bien remboursés, elle sollicite nouveau prêt individuel pour acheter 10 sacs de pomme de terre, 45kg de viande de bœuf, 60kg de poissons frais, 15 litres d’huile alimentaire, 5 paquets de maggie, 5 bidons de vinaigre, 30 sachets d’Attièkè, 4 sacs de charbon de bois, 50 miches de pain et des bananes (Aloko).
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 190 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Minata is a 56-year old widow. She lives with her four children and her deceased husband's large family in the district of Kaboïla II, at the center of Sikasso. After having attempted several different business ideas with little success, Minata discovered the restaurant business, where she has been working for about six years. She maintains her restaurant in front of a school. Every day, her customers (consisting of students and teachers) line up for her quality meals.

In order to satisfy her constantly growing customer base, Minata decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has now been a member of the organization for over a year. With two personal loans fully repaid, she is currently seeking a loan to buy 10 bags of potatoes, 45 kilograms of beef, 60 kilograms of fresh fish, 15 liters of cooking oil, five packs of Maggi (bouillon flavoring cubes), five bottles of vinegar, 30 packets of attiéké (local dish prepared from fermented, dried cassava pulp), four sacks of charcoal, 50 loaves of bread, and plantains for making aloko (thinly sliced, deep-fried plantains).

Minata hopes to make a monthly income of 190,000 FCFA. She will use her income primarily to contribute to family expenses, and to pay the interest on her loan. She plans to use the remainder to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom attend school. She also supports two additional family members. She makes petroleum jelly cosmetic products from home. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 11 years. She also earns additional income from selling piped water. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more cans of raw materials for making her products. Her major business challenge is transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build a house and to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making petroleum jelly cosmetic products

loans.name: Olga Indelira

texts.es:
OLGA INDELIRA tiene 38 años de edad es divorciada tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos y unos familiares en Ventans provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 16 DE AGOSTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Agua de Mocache, pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

OLGA INDELIRA se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, liquido para la maleza, ranger.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprarse un carro y viajar. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Olga Indelira is 38 years old and divorced with three children. She lives with her children and relatives in the town of Ventanas,  in the Los Rios province.

She is a member of the "VRC AUGUST 16" group, which is located in the Mocache Water Campus and belongs to Canton Mocache. The group engaged agriculture and livestock work.

Olga Indelira is dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry work.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea [fertilizer] and anti-weed liquid.

With the help of this loan, she can buy what is needed for the crops.  She will make her purchases in the town of Ventanas.

Her dream is to buy a car and travel.  The challenges she faces are the agricultural diseases. In her free time she enjoys playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea [fertilizer] and anti-weed liquid.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 36 years old and married, living at West Point.  She has four children between the ages of 5 and 23. 

For the past five years, she has been selling coal by retail in her community.  Some difficulties she faces is the low sales during the rainy season. She makes a profit when she sells and uses it to buy more charcoal bags and thus help her husband with meeting the expenditures of the home. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more charcoal bags to sell.  Her plan for the future is to educate her children

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal bags to sell.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Liliosa works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables. Liliosa is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Liliosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 33 years old  and lives in the Jacob Town area.  She’s married, with three children aged between 3 and 13, all of whom live at home. Her husband is a security guard.  

For the past six years, she has been involved in the sale of charcoal and other goods. Her main challenge is price increases. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. 

She will use this loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She will use her profits to help pay for school fees, and one day she would like to own her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Maimo

texts.en:
Maimo is 31 years old and lives in Jacob Town.  She is married, with two children, ages 6 and 13 years.  

For ten years now she has been selling groceries (spices, oil, rice, etc.) in her community.  One of her major problems is that prices are not stable, and she has to buy goods at a very high price. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more spices, oil, and rice for her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more spices, oil, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Mawatta

texts.en:
Mawatta is 40 years old and lives in Jacob Town.  She is married and has five children between 22 and 9 years old. 

For five years now, she has been selling palm oil, pepper, bitter balls, etc., in the local market,.  She started this business with the help of her husband. She enjoys her business because it gives her a lot of profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more stocks of palm oil, pepper, bitter balls, etc., for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (palm oil, pepper, bitter balls, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es: Oswaldo es originario  del caserío Nueva providencia, él se dedica ya desde hace 5 años a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales y ha encontrado en fape y kiva un gran ayuda q para poder superarse, el actual mente cuenta con la siembra de tomate milpa y frijol, es por eso que está solicitando este crédito para la compra de semillas y abono para el cultivo, espera kiva le pueda ayudar como en otras ocasiones a través de los créditos.
texts.en: Oswaldo is a native of the small town of Nueva Providencia. He has already worked in agriculture for five years, farming and raising animals. He has found a big source of help in FAPE and Kiva, which enables him to better himself. He is currently growing tomatillos and beans, so he is requesting this loan so he can purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crops. He hopes Kiva will be able to help him as they have before through their loans.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Bakary est âgé de plus de 47 ans, polygame et père de huit enfants. Il vit avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, il s’est vite initié aux activités de commercialisation des engrais, pesticides et insecticides depuis plus de vingt ans. Bakary jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ses besoins fait défaut, c’est ainsi, qu’il  sollicite  ce nouveau prêt pour acheter,  20 sacs d’engrais urées, 10 sacs de complexe coton et 10 sacs de complexe maïs afin de pouvoir satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre.  Bakary est à son cinquième prêts et les quatre prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Il s’approvisionne auprès du représentant de TOGUNA (une usine de fabrique d’engrais) à Sikasso. Avec une clientèle composée essentiellement d’agriculteurs certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autres à crédit.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Bakary is approximately 47 years old, a polygamist and the father of eight children. He lives with his two wives and their children in Hamdallaye, a popular district in the city of Sikasso.

Never having had the opportunity to attend school, Bakary began marketing fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides. He has now been running this business for over twenty years. Bakary has a strong reputation and has earned many commendations from his clientele. Unfortunately, he lacks the resources to meet the ever-increasing demands of his customers. With the loan he is currently seeking, Bakary plans to purchase 20 sacks of urea fertilizer, 10 sacks of complex fertilizers for cotton, and 10 sacks of complex fertilizers for corn. Bakary is on his fifth loan cycle, and all four of his previous loans have been repaid in full. Bakary purchases his supplies in Sikasso from a representative of Toguna Industries (a fertilizer manufacturer). His clientele is composed primarily of farmers, some of whom pay in cash, and others who buy on credit.

With the income he earns from this loan, Bakary expects to make a monthly income of 175,000 FCFA. He plans to use this income to pay for essential expenditures, family expenses, to pay the interest on his loan, and to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for resale.
